loans.name: Hashmud

texts.en:
Hashmud B. is thirty-seven years old.  He is married and has given birth to two children.  Both of his children are currently in the basic school.  Hashmud and his family live at Atebubu.  Atebubu is a town that has most of its inhabitants actively involved in the farming business. 

Very few are into different trades such as batik and tie-dye production and Hashmud is one of those few.  Batik and tie-dye is a local textile design in which raffia or waxes are used to resist the pigment (dyes) from getting to undesired areas.  

Hashmud buys materials such as mercerized cotton, caustic soda, etc from the city.  He has been in this business for six years.  He sells in the local market and treks to surrounding villages. 

Hashmud wants a loan to buy more of the raw materials so that he can produce on a large scale to be able to trek to more markets.

loans.use: To buy tie-dyeing materials.

loans.name: Holomè

texts.fr: Agée de Cinquante ans, dame H. Holomè mariée et mère de six enfants est originaire de d'adjarra dans le département de l'ouémé au sud du Bénin.Dépuis sept ans, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de condiments, d'huile d'arachide et d'huile rouge. Pleine d'ambition de développer d'avantage l'activité, dame Holomè avait décidé de faire chaque fois une demande de financement et est aujourd'hui à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Mrs.Holome Houkonnou is married and the mother of six children. She originated from Adjarra in the district of Oueme in the south of Benin. For the last 7 years she has specialized in the sale of food condiments, peanut oil, and red oil. Holone is full of ambition to develop her business and has taken out several business loans. She is now requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a basket of tomatoes, a crate of peanut oil and a crate of red oil.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi A. est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient depuis 10 ans un restaurant de foufou, un plat préparer à base de l’igname,qui est très apprécié par la population locale. Avec ce crédit Essi désire mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en achetant les condiments nécessaires à la préparation de ce plat et aussi des ignames.
texts.en:
Essi A. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three. For ten years, she has had a restaurant serving foufou , which is a dish made from yams that is highly appreciated by the local people. With this loan, Essi would like to satsify her customers better by buying the condiments necessary for making this dish and also yams.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the ingredients necessary for making foufou

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot T., 29, is married and resides with her husband, her elderly mother and two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer who typically makes US$1 per day. Her husband is a worker who breaks rocks and sells them. On average, he makes US$4 per day. Two of their children are students. Mrs. Sot T. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike and tools to make ice cream. She will start a new business selling ice cream. (Mrs. Sot is pictured with her husband, two of her children and her mother.)

loans.use: Ice-cream-making tools and a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of 17 members, is located in Ta Daol Bei village in Kandal province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thach T. was selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to breed and earn more income. Her husband, Mr. S. Rim, is employed by a company. Mrs. Thach T. is 43 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Mr. Rorn S. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead. 

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en: Sevinj H. is a thirty-year-old mother, and at the same time a very successful entrepreneur. She started her business in 2002 when her husband passed away, and she had to feed her son. Being without higher education and job experience, she decided to borrow money from relatives to start her business. Sevinj chooses to sell very popular, best-selling dishes including both dinner and tea sets. These goods are in very high demand among young ladies and those who are getting married. Her business brings permanent income to Sevinj so she can pay for her son’s education. She applied for a $1200 loan to increase the number of items she sells. Let’s wish good luck to this brave and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To increase number of items

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C., 26, is a woman living in Pursat Province. She earns a living cultivating rice on farmland she inherited from her grandmother. She is a widowed mother who cares for one minor child who is enrolled in school. She lacks capital for the upcoming rice farming season; thus, she has decided to seek a loan to purchase rice seed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for growing rice

loans.name: Alayar

texts.ru: Алаяр Зияев проживает в районе Вахш. В возрасте 61 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алаяр и члены его семьи занимаются земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимаются более 20 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, для закупа минералов, чтобы использовавшись получить хороший урожай картошки и пщеницы.
texts.en:
Alayar Z. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 61 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Alayar and members of his family work in agriculture. They have been in this business for more than 20 years. The client is asking for credit from us in order to purchase minerals, which he will use to get a good harvest of potatoes and wheat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase minerals

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio S. is a 53-year old chicken grower and a father of three children. He started his poultry business in 1997. His business is doing very well today. He needs additional capital to increase his livelihood. "Before, I was working in the factory as a salesman. My income was not able to suffice all my family expenses that is why I decided to stop working and started a business to manage," he said.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a micro-finance partner of Kiva in the Philippines. He will use the loan to purchase chicken feed. "With my loan, I have better chance to expand my business all the more." 

Because CEVI has helped him sustain his business for a long time, he remains loyal to CEVI and continues using its services. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Ulziybayar

texts.en:
Ulziybayar T. is a 45-year-old married man with three children aged 12-18. All his children go to a local school. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic housing, like a yurt) district on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. 

Ulziybayar is a plumber. He gets orders from local residents to fix their water pipes and toilets. Besides working as a plumber he has been running a plumber's workshop during the past 18 years. Ulziybayar purchases plumbing supplies at a wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, and resells them to local residents or institutions at retail prices. With the profit he improved his living conditions dramatically. Now his working capital has reached 5 million tugrugs (equal to $3,500). He requests a loan to purchase plumbing supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing supplies

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy L. is a pig breeder, who asking for a loan to hire a repairer to paint her old wooden house. She is 37 years old and is a mother caring for three kids who are students. She is married to Vann Koeum, 46 years old, who is a local palm climber. The family are people living in the rural area of Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: To hire a house repairer to paint her old wooden house

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom H. lives in Prey Mei Lang Thboung village in Takeo province. She is a 31-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Kimsoeun, is shown in the picture with her.

Mrs. Sarom H. is a pig breeder and also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband owns a machine to plow fields and is hired by the other farmers.

Mrs. Sarom H. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. The rest of loan will be used to repair her husband’s plowing machine.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food and to repair her husband's plowing machine

loans.name: Juana Cynthia

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. Tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Huajsapata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de coca (hoja de planta medicinal).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar coca, alcohol, incienso, velas, vinos, etc.

Su deseo es poner  una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Diana de Gales”, located in the District of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single, and does not have children. Sra. Juana completed her high school education and lives in the neighborhood of Huajsapata. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used as capital for her business selling coca (medicinal plant leaves). Sra. Juana is now requesting another loan in the amount of 1300 soles to purchase coca leaves, alcohol, incense, candles, wine, etc. She hopes to open a well-stocked grocery store. She enjoys the convenience of her payments and her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coca leaves, alcohol, incense, candles, wine, etc.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe M. (0) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Utualii. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

Pepe owns and operates a business raising crops, sellings fish for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 450 WST a month.

Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Pepe is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acheter des outils de travail notamment des peaux de bêtes, de la colle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is forty – two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Gladys is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Gladys also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
The group leader, K. Margaret, was unable to be in the group picture, but she is shown in the small picture on the upper left. 

K. Margaret is a business lady with many businesses that she runs with the help of her children and other employed workers. Margaret is a widow. She has rental income bringing in a monthly fee. She has a hardware shop selling building materials. She makes pancakes for sale every day from her home as well as making juice from yellow bananas that she sells in jerry cans in Bakuli, Kampala. She decided to join all these businesses because she always wanted the best for herself and her family, especially after the death of her husband. Margaret is a hardworking and devoted lady. 

Margaret is the leader of her lending group. She is one of the founding members of the group. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using proceeds from her businesses and, currently, she still has two children in school. Margaret needs a loan to help recapitalize her businesses, especially the hardware shop. She will buy ingredients for making the pancakes as well as more bananas for making the juice.

loans.use: To restock a hardware shop and buy raw materials for making pancakes and bananas for making juice

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios V. shared that “time management is really important in running a business”. She is engaged in a general store business where she sells different products as such biscuits (cookies), canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, condiments, and even vegetables and fruit. With her business she is able to help her husband in financing their daily needs as well as the educational needs of their children.

Remedios is married to Pablito who works as a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children namely: Patrick John, 17 years of age, a second year college student; John Paul, 14 years old; and the youngest is Marichu, who is now 11 years old.

Remedios’s general store is situated at her house at Villa Marcos, Ramon. Her income from the store is quite enough for their daily needs but she still wants to expand it, especially since one of her children is now enrolled in the college level of education. In connection with that she is requesting a Php 5,000 loan from Kiva lenders. She knows that the amount will be of great help to her family and to her business as well.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Khaled has been working as a DJ since 2003. He takes care of private parties like weddings, events and more. Khaled requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car to transport his DJ materials. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan. Khaled is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors, agencies and whoever needs him for an event or celebration. When he first started his business, he had difficulty in purchasing all the required tools and sound systems for his work. He decided on doing his business because from a young age he had always wanted to be a DJ. In the future, he plans to improve his work by always having the best materials for his work.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport his DJ materials .

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells groceries at retail prices to his customers in Asaba, Delta state. He is 39 years old, married with 2 children. He is an LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. His greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mr. Long V. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Muon Ny Mol, is a cake seller. Now Mr. Long V. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living with this loan. He is 30 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: M. Florence is a business lady. She is married with 3 children. The children are school going. She resides in Nakifuma and owns a hardware shop. She has been carrying out this business for over 2 years. The business is located in Nakifuma trading centre. She is using the loan in running her hardware business by stocking enough inventory (iron sheets, nails, wires, and so forth) to meet the demand of her customers. Her dream is to set up another hardware shop outlet.

loans.use: Increasing store inventory

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita P. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Mohon Barangay Binicuil, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a photocopying business. She currently has four photocopiers and wants to use her loan to put a down payment on a fifth. Amelita’s husband, Demetrio, works as a part-time driver and also helps the business. They have six children between the ages of 4 and 13. Four of her children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Amelita P. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, a Kiva partner, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of 30,000 Philippine pesos from her business activities. Amelita P. is a NWTF-PD member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund operations of her photocopier business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 10th loan, the amount of Php 20,500, which she intends to use as a down payment for an additional photocopier unit. Amelita P. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Down payment for one additional photocopier

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R., 59, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Conrado R., a driver, they are blessed with three children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store while renting out a house for nine years now.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 22,000. This  will be used as added capital for expanding her business by incorporating more products into her variety store’s inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a comfortable life with her family.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To incorporate more products into her variety store’s inventory

loans.name: Yasmina Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Yasmina Elena A. cuenta con un pequeño SALON de entretenimientos, juegos de video  denominado  SAMIR actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años, esta casada y es madre de familia, tiene un hijo.
Con los ingresos que le genera este negocio suple algunos gastos personales y estudios de su hijo. 
el credito que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio ya que tiene que estar actualizando sus consolas de videos que ese desgastan por el uso y actualizando sus juegos ya que sus clientes en su mayoria son jovenes y niños a los que tiene que tener satisfechos y bien entretenidos.
texts.en:
Yasmina Elena A. has a small entertainment room with video games named SAMIR. She has dedicated herself to this work for more than 5 years. She is married and is a mother; she has one son. With the revenue from this business she pays for personal expenses and her son's education. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her business to upgrade her video machines which are wearing down from use. She also plans to upgrade her games as most of her customers are young people and children and they are the ones who must be satisfied and entertained.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video games and materials to maintain the machines.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han S. (pictured in her grocery store), age 39, and her husband Mr. Dara Run, age 44, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of them works full-time and the other three attend school. 

Han has been selling grocery for three years. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh to resell in her store in front of her house. Han hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional grocery items to respond her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To continue expanding her grocery business.

loans.name: Florienne

texts.en:
Florienne is 45 years old and married. She has 2 children who are 12 and 20 years old.  Florienne is a proven entrepreneur who sells food in her village.  She has been in this business for about 13 years.  The hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Florienne realized that her original investment was too low to earn more profits. She is now requesting a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales, as well as her profits.  With this loan, Florienne hopes to start selling various fruits, because they are often purchased in her business area. With this additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Florienne will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Mrs. Pha K. is a villager in Chrak Chi Koam village in Takeo province. She breeds pigs and on the side makes white wine. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have enough money so is asking for a loan to buy more pigs, pig food, and vaccinations. Her husband, Mr. Khang Yorn, is a teacher in the local school and also farms his three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family. They have two children, one a teacher, and the other in school.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, pig food, and vaccinations

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en: Anushik H. was born in 1963 in Kapan. She is married and has two daughters who are already married and live separately from their parents. For about 10 years Anushik has managed her own shop where she sells food and household goods. Anushik's husband helps her in that business and also keeps bees which adds to their family's income. Anushik purchases her inventory six times per month — five times in Kapan, and once in Yerevan. Anushik asks for an 850.000 AMD loan to increase her shop’s assortment of good and to buy a coffee grinder for her shop, which will help bring in more customers.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods and to buy a coffee grinder for her shop

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Esperanza” se formó en base al espíritu emprendedor de las señoras y por necesidad de generar mas ingresos de sus integrantes  para tratar de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Utilizaran el crédito para diversas opciones dependiendo de la actividad a que se dedica cada integrante así como la señora Lorenza quien realiza servicios de manicura y pedicura sus horas libres.
Ella recibe los pedidos por teléfono y hace servicio a domicilio de las clientas, por sus buenos trabajos ya cuenta con clientela formada y un ingreso seguro mediante este trabajo.
Ella comenta que esta actividad genera un ingreso imprescindible para ayudar con los gastos de su familia por ello desea adquirir para mejorar sus servicios herramientas mas sofisticadas como limas de distintos tipos, raspa callos, pinzas, y otros.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de estas herramientas y agradece a kiva por la ayuda que brinda a las personas de escasos recursos pero con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) Committee was established out of the entrepreneurial spirit of a group of women who needed to generate more income to improve their quality of life. They will use this loan in different ways depending on the business activities of each member. Sra. Lorenza provides manicure and pedicure services in her free time. She receives appointment requests over the phone and provides her services in the homes of her clients. Lorenza already has an established clientele and earns a steady income from this line of work. She says that this business generates essential income to help with her family’s expenses. In order to improve her services, she wants to acquire more sophisticated equipment such as distinct types of nail files, callus files, tweezers, and other items. She is requesting a loan to buy this equipment and thanks Kiva for helping people of limited resources who are eager to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nail files, callus files, tweezers, and other items

loans.name: Nakalama North Harriet Namugose Group

texts.en: Harriet N. is a hardworking business woman of thirty-five years of age, single, with two dependents who are in school. She has been running a retail shop business for four years. She will use her loan to purchase retail items such as salt, soap and sugar for sale in order to expand her business. Harriet is a promising business woman whose dream is to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as salt, soap and sugar for sale to expand her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 23 years old and married with one child who is 2 and a half years old. Sarah makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop. Her shop is open from 6 am to 6 pm every day. Although Sarah has owned her shop for a long time, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To end this, Sarah is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. If she gets this loan, Sarah will purchase additional goods, mainly foodstuffs like rice, sugar, etc. With these additional goods, Sarah will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, to sell

loans.name: Lubov's Group

texts.en: Lubov P. is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married. She has two daughters, both of whom are married and live separately with their families. Lubov and her husband provide car repair services and have been doing this for seventeen years. In this way they make 8,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Lubov wants to purchase a fridge to improve her living conditions. Svetlana R., 32, is married. She has two sons and a daughter: the older son is eight and studies at school and the others are too young. Svetlana and her husband began to provide car repair services three years ago and in this way they make 8,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Svetlana wants to purchase an oven in order to improve her living conditions. In the future she plans to purchase cattle for breeding. Ekaterina O., 25, is married. She works as a cook and her husband is a programmer in a bank. Ekaterina applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a personal computer. Margarita S., 40, is married. Eight years ago, she and her husband began to sell household goods. They started with an initial investment of 1,000 soms and now they make 2,800 soms per month. Margarita wants to start providing sewing services, so she applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a sewing machine. Nataliya A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 40 and married with three sons and three daughters. Two sons and the daughter are married and live separately with their families while the other children study at school. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 4,000 soms, Nataliya purchased a calf and started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull in order to resell it at a higher price after fattening. In the future she plans to open a sewing workshop. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Blanca Ninosca

texts.es:
Blanca de 31 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años en la Escuela Salomon Ibarra Mayorga ubicada en la colonia los Angeles, es madre soltera de un niño de 7 años de edad que estudia su primer grado de Primaria en la Escuela Mauricio cajina, ella cuando viaja todos los dias a las seis de la mañana ya le deja el desyuno hecho a su hijito y lo deja al cuido de su abuelita materna.  

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn y repellarla, para contar con mayor comodidad; su mayor sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando y que a su hijo no le falte nada, es importante mencionar que esta clienta es bien cumplida con sus compromisos y se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old, and works as a primary school teacher at the Salomon Ibarra Mayorga School located in the Angeles colony. Blanca is a single mother to a 7 year old boy who is in first grade in the Mauricio Cajina school. She works everyday from six in the morning and leaves her son’s breakfast already made and leaves him in the care of his maternal grandmother.

This will be Blanca’s seventh loan which will be used to put a floor in the bedroom and finish plastering to have better comfort. Her biggest dream in life is to keep studying and that her son will not lack anything, it is important to note that the customer is very punctual with her responsibilities and is characterized as someone who is honest and very hardworking.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a floor in the bedroom and finish plastering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, flour, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells rice and vegetables for an income of USD 4.3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana G. is from the village of Quezon, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Susana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Susana joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susana is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Mr. Nuy Peng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up a village bank loan in Rumchek village in Takeo province. Mr. Nuy P. is the village bank president, born in 1952 and selected by the other members who will each use their loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Hing Torn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. He is also a rock breaker. 

His problE. is that his home is not comfortable to live in because his home does not have electric current. So, Mr. Nuy P. is applying for a loan to buy some electrical supplies. He is a father of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is an air conditioner repairman.

loans.use: To buy some electrical supplies

loans.name: Gaamaa

texts.en:
Gaamaa D. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her son works as a salesperson in the KJK company while her daughter is a teacher at the Kanan Co.ltd. Her husband is retired and currently helps out with the business. 

Gaamaa has been operating clothes selling business since 2009 in the rented outdoor space at the Urt Tsagaan trade center in Ulaanbaatar. Over the many years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman and her daily revenue reaches between 90,000 and 100,000 MNT. She pays rent fees of 100,000 MNT per month. She has had 13 loans and fully paid off all her loans on time. Gaamaa is a very modest and happy woman and says, " We have been living for many years in the ger and now I want to purchase an apartment where can live in the civilized environment with my family." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import products such as children's clothes and slippers etc, from China to sell.

loans.use: To import more products

loans.name: Ewoé

texts.fr: Ewoé est une femme de 30 ans,  elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de sacs. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce commerce et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de femmes pour la plupart. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 2 douzaines de sacs de voyages.
texts.en: Ewoé is a 30-year old lady who is married and mother to one child. She has a business selling bags and has three years experience in this business. She gets her supplies in Lomé. Her customer base is made up primarily of women. She is experiencing a fall in her stock and for this reason is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy two dozen travel bags.

loans.use: Purchase of bags

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. fotocopiadora, ella tiene una pequeña tienda que atienD. desD. las 7:30 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papel al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" which translates to "together and united". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Maruja, she is 62 years old and is married with 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with a copier business. She has a small store which she tends to from 7:30 am until 8:00 pm. She wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy paper in bulk.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream through these means and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues on time.

loans.use: Purchase paper in bulk.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Vicente; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la venta de churros (es un dulce con reyeno de manjar),el lo vende en su carreta por las tardes de forma  ambulatoria  conjuntamente con su esposa , el socio es una persona muy emprendedora y con este su negocio saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como azúcar, harina, manjar entre otros más. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together).  The bank is located in the Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

This member is Vicente.  He is 36, has a wife and they have a son.  He sells churros (a pastry with caramel or dulce de leche filling).  He is a street merchant and together with his wife sells the churros from his cart in the afternoons. He is a very entrepreneurial member and this business is helping his family get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business such as sugar, flour,manjar (caramel or dulce de leche) and more.

Victor thanks those who are part of his dream and he promises to make the payments in the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his business such as sugar, flour, manjar (caramel or dulce de leche), and more .

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Fatumah has a business of a restaurant, which she has had for five years.  She also sells clothes.         

To help expand her business, Fatumah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cups and food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fatumah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Fatumah hopes to own a  house.  Fatumah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by reading books.

loans.use: To purchase cups and food

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Laxmi M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 1. In 1996, she established her business making brass religious statues. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials like bronze, wax, silver, etc., for her work. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business making bronze statues

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, de 43 años, está casada con Erwin, de 48 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Isabel, de 21 y Edwin, de 12 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Su alegría es notoria, ya que ella hace 10 años comenzó con la apertura de una tienda de comestibles, donde vende bebidas como cerveza, gaseosa, helados, y demás productos de primera necesidad, los cuales en todo este tiempo le proporcionaron buenas ganancias, tanto así que ahora en sociedad con su hija Isabel, comenzaron a incursionar en la apertura de un salón de belleza, en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad donde está segura le irá muy bien. Ahora Mirtha está pensando implementar su negocio con la compra de equipos de última generación para poder mantenerse las expectativas de sus clientes y crecer en el tiempo. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal se siente feliz de poder integrar una asociación unida y sin mayores complicaciones. De obtener el crédito, podrá invertir en la compra de un mostrador de vidrio para su salón de belleza, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 680.00 nuevos soles, y el resto del dinero lo invertirá pen la compra de insumos necesarios para comenzar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 43, is married to Erwin, 48.  They have two children:  Isabel, 21, and Edwin, 12.  The family lives in their own house, located in the city of San Ramón (in Peru's central jungle).

Mirtha is well-known for her happiness.  10 years ago she opened a grocery store, where she sold beer, soft drinks, ice cream and other staple goods.  The store gave her such a good income that now, with her daughter Isabel, she has begun to invest in opening a beauty salon in a central location in the city where she is sure she will do well.  Now Mirtha is thinking about supplying her business by purchasing the most modern equipment to meet her customers' expectations and grow with time.

This is her eighth loan with MFP, and as a member of her communal bank she is happy to be able to join such a united association that has no major problems.  When she receives the loan, she will be able to purchase for her beauty salon a glass counter, which costs on average 680 new soles.  Mirtha will invest the rest of the money in necessary supplies for starting the business.

loans.use: Buy a counter and materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is divorced and has three children. She sells yam tubers at Abura using the income she makes for the general upkeep of her home. The loan will be used to purchase extra yam tubers for sale. With the profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase yam tubers for sale

loans.name: Rubasharaza

texts.en:
Rubasharaza V. is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is a very hardworking man with a spare bicycle parts business and service and repair shop. He sells 2T and others. He has two helpers and he has been in business for over 10 years in Rwanja Trading centre. V. was previously a mechanic until he got capital to start up the shop. 

His clients are mostly from the local community. On average, he is able to make monthly profits of 250,000/=. He is also involved in the sale of produce from a banana plantation that he owns. His dream is to open up a wholesale shop for bicycle spare parts.

loans.use: To restock with more spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Phean

texts.en: The man in the picture is Phean S., 21, who sells firewood. He usually works eight hours a day, selling in and around Siem Reap province. Phean S. buys firewood in bulk from his suppliers. His wife’s name is Keo Sochea. She is 21 and works with him in the same business. This family typically generates an average of $4 US [a day] to cover the family expenses. They are blessed with one young child who is still not enrolled in school. Phean S. will use his loan to add to his saving for a motorbike in order to run a motor taxi service for additional income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for a motor taxi service

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her blanket sales business. She started this business 8 years ago to financially support her husband, who is a driver by profession and his income was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. With the loan, she will buy blankets in larger quantity which will allow her to sell to many more customers and make extra income. 

She lives in a 3 room brick house with her family in a small city called Kot radha kishen, which is located in Punjab Pakistan and is famous for its dairy industry. Her house is located in Judgewala, which is a small residential area of the city. She came here with her family 10 years ago. She is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her daughter is only 4 months old. She is hopeful that she will be able to make positive changes to her business by investing loan money into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To buy blankets for selling.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro es padre de casa de 51 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores en casa propia en el caserío La Esperanza, una hora y media del distrito de Olmos en Lambayeque. Viven en la parte rural y no cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz. 

Desde hace seis años, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores: ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. También trabaja como negociante de madera. Vende sus productos en los mercados locales a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Estas actividades lo ayudan solventar sus gastos familiares. Desea usar el crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio y comprar alimentos balanceados y más animales para engordar y vender.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 51 year old father.  He lives with his wife and their three minor children in their own house in the village of La Esperanza.  It is one and a half hours from the Olmos district in Lambayeque.  They live in a rural area, and they do not have basic services like running water and electricity.

For six years he has been raising small animals like sheep, goats, poultry, and pigs.  He does this in an area in back of his house.  He also works as a wood merchant.  He sells his products at the local markets.  He sells to businessmen who usually visit the area where he lives.

These activities help pay the family expenses.  He wants to use the loan for 1,500 soles to expand his business.  He will buy balanced feed and more animals to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and more animals

loans.name: Marcos Ederberto

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos vive en la zona de Viloma grande cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado lechero, se encuentra casado y tiene 1 hijo pequeño que aun no va a la escuela.

Su esposa y el se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda pero su principal actividad es la cria de conejos, ellos cuentan con mas de 100 conejos y antes de que encuentren este proyectoque les ayuda en la construccion de comederos ellos ya les construyeron sus granjas pero son contruidas de forma muy artesanal con mallas milimetricas y adobes(bloques de tierra) ahora que la poblacion de conejos esta creciendo considerablemente necesitan construir mejores comederos, por esa razon estan solicitando el credito, para poder pagar en la construccion de las nuevas granjas, asi su produccion sera mas optima, y sus ingresos seran mayores.

Con el tiempo el Señor Marcos desea comprar una propiedad donde pueda brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, porque ahora estan viviendo en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Marcos lives in Vilorma Grande district.   He has 6 head of dairy cattle, is married, and has one young son who doesn't go to school yet.

Marcos and his wife both work producing raw milk but their main business activity is raising rabbits.  They have more than 100 rabbits.  They used to  construct their enclosures by hand themselves, with wire netting and 'adobes' (blocks of earth).  However, now that their rabbit population is growing considerably, they need to construct better homes for their rabbits.  They are requesting this loan so that they can pay for new rabbit pens to be built.  In this way, their production will be better and their income will increase.

Over time, Marcos would like to buy a home so that he can provide better living conditions for his family as right now they are living in his mother's house.

loans.use: to build a rabbit farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. M. is 38 years old, married to John and together they are blessed with 4 children. She has been selling farmers' choice products for the last 12 years and gets an income of 9,600 KES.


She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her fourth loan, which she plans to buy more stock of farmers' choice products like sausages and hot dogs to sell.  She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.


In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a grocery store. She desires to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sausages and hot dogs for sale

loans.name: Jonnathan

texts.es:
Jonnathan forma parte del banco comunal “Pocuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
El tiene un almacén en el cual vende provisiones, artículos de librería, servicio de teléfonos y venta de frutas. Jonnathan se dedica a éste rubro desde hace un año, ya que anteriormente tenía un negocio de lavado de autos, sin embargo le robaron todas sus maquinarias, debido a los saqueos ocurridos en la ciudad de Concepción. En la actualidad Jonnathan se encuentra trabajando, por lo que su madre y socia queda a cargo del negocio, ya que su almacén está ubicado en su misma casa.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en la Vega monumental, que es una feria de abarrotes, frutas y verduras. 
Con éste préstamo comprará una máquina congeladora para helados.
Sus metas son tener una frutería y verdulería, ya que dónde vive sólo hay panaderías, además desea obtener una máquina de barquillos, que le permita vender helados en la temporada de verano. 
Su sueño a nivel personal, es poder terminar sus estudios de Administración de empresas con mención en Recursos Humanos. Por esto las motivaciones de proyectarse en su negocio y seguir con éste.
Jonnathan vive junto a sus padres y su hermano de 8 años de edad. 
Él está agradecido y contento del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que éste le ha dado la oportunidad de concretar sus proyectos y además podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de los talleres de ventas que se realizan en las reuniones, conocimientos que ha podido aplicar en su negocio. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jonnathan is part of the communal bank "Pocuro", which belongs to the city of Coronel.  He has a store that sells supplies, stationery, telephone services, and fruit.   Jonnathan has been in this business since last year, having previously been in the car wash business.  However, all his machines were stolen in the looting that occurred in the city of Concepción.  Today, Jonnathan is working, so his mother (another member) is in charge of the business because their store is located in the same house.  He usually buys their goods in the Vega Monumental, which is a market that sells groceries, fruits, and vegetables.  

With the requested loan he will buy an ice cream freezer.  His goals are to have a fruit and vegetable shop because where he lives, there are only bakeries.  He also wants a waffle maker so that he can sell ice cream cones in the summer.  His dream on a personal level is to finish his studies in Business Administration with a concentration in Human Resources.  He is motivated to improve his business so that he can continue his studies.

Jonnathan lives with his parents and 8-year-old brother.  He is thankful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza as it has given him the opportunity to realize his projects and will also allow him to invest in his business and generate more revenue.  He is also participating in sales workshops that are at meetings and he has applied that knowledge to his business.

Coronel is a municipality located in southern Chile, near the town of Concepción. Bíobío region.  It has an economy based on services, forestry, and agriculture.  It also has a strong tradition of coal mining, which is now extinct, but there still remains a coal mine “Chiflón Puchoco", which is now a mining museum.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream freezer.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Doris P. Guierrez tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de quesillo y cuajada, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
doña Doris es viuda, hace mucho tiempo que se le murio el esposo y le a tocado trabajar sola para educar a sus hijos los cuales ya son profesionales. 
Doris cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leche pura de vacas para hacer la cuajada y el quesillo.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar la iglesia
texts.en: Doris P. Guierrez is 60 years old and she lives in Triunfo Choluteca and she makes and sells cheese and curds. Her business is located in her house. Doris is a widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, so she needed to work alone to send her children to school. They all have careers now. Doris has children's support. The loan will be used to purchase pure cow's milk to make curds and cheese. During her spare time she visits the church.

loans.use: to purchase cow milk to produce cheese and curds.

loans.name: Hilmer

texts.es: Hilmer, de 25 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Aunque es muy joven todavía, Hilmer sabe que ya es hora de ganar su propio dinero y salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus vecinos. Es así que ellos acuden a su establecimiento, debido a que se encuentra ubicado en una zona donde hay mucha afluencia de gente y por tal razón los productos se venden muy rápido. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es un socio muy comprometido y solidario. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para su tienda de abarrotes y así tendrá un mejor stock para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Hilmer is 25 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young man who lives in a rental house.  What he would like more than anything is to work very hard in order to improve his quality of life.  Although he is still very young, Hilmer knows that it is time to earn his own money and get ahead in life.  For this reason, he decided to set up a grocery store where he could meet his neighbors' demands.  People come to his store as it is located in very busy area and, for this reason, his products sell out very quickly.  Hilmer has been in this business for two years and what he most enjoys about his work is chatting to his customers.  He hopes that his business will grow and make him better income.

This will be Hilmer's second loan from MFP and he hopes not to miss any repayments.  He is a very committed and supportive member of his community bank.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more products for his grocery store so that he has better stock to offer his customers.

loans.use: to stock his store with more products

loans.name: Natalia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade é casada,  mãe de 2 filhos,de 9 e 18 anos, todos vão  a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia sustenta sua sogra e sobrinha que vivem com ela. Fez a 9ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de concições.

sai de Sofala com seus pais para Maputo no tempo da guerra, devido a falta de condições teve que começar a trabalhar muito cedo, consegue uma proposta de  trabalho na Escola EP1 de Mugado( na vila da namaacha) como auxiliar administrativa onde se encontra ate então.  Trabalha das 6:45 as 14h auferindo mensalmente 1.821.02mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Para alêm do salário conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul. 


  Ja teve empréstimo no BIM ( outro banco comercial), Conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o quinto empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção ( chapas de zinco, portas e cimento) para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os três empréstimos anteriores de (3.500.00, 5.000.00  9.00.00 e 10.000.00)mt  foram para a mesma finalidade. 

  Esta feliz porque dentro em breve vai se mudar para a sua própria casa. Ira reembolsar cem nenhum problema para aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
This customer was born in the province of Sofala in central Mozambique.  She is 36 years old and married, the mother of two children ages 9 and 18.  Both attend school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother in law and a niece who live with her.  She completed school through the 9th grade but did not finish because she did not have the means. 

She left Sofala with her parents for Maputo during the war.  Due to her situation, she had to begin working very young.  She was offered a job  at School EP1 in Mugado (in the town of Namaacha) as an administrative assistant, and she still works there now.  She works from 6:45am to 2pm and earns 1.821.02mt per month, which she uses for household expenses. In addition to her salary she has help from her husband who works in South Africa. 

She has already had a loan from BIM (another commercial bank).  She learned about Hluvuku through colleagues who are also clients.  This is her fifth loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials (zinc panels, doors, and cement) to continue building her home.  Her four prior loans were for 3,500.00, 5,000.00, 9.000.00 and 10.000.00mt, for the same purpose.  

She is happy because she will soon move into her own home.  She is going to pay her loan back without any problems in order to have access to future loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (zinc panels, doors and cement)

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Catching fish is the main part of 53-year-old Seng’s daily work. She and her husband have been operating in this business for over 8 years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market for daily income. Seng and her husband support their two single children who are enrolled in school, while their 4 other children are married and live in their own houses. Seng would like to request a loan to buy a new boat and nets because most of her fishing tools are cracked.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijas, tiene casa propia, se dedica a la venta D. medicinas y granja D. pollos, este negocio lo heredo hace cinco años D. su esposo, actualmente lo administra muy bien y sus hijas le ayudan.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el negocio D. medicinas, comprando pastillas, jarabes, inyecciones para distintas enfermedades así como también vitaminas y reanimantes, al mismo tiempo quiere comprar concentrado para la granja D. pollos.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que siempre busca las alternativas para progresar en el negocio y ayudar a sus hijas, su propósito es tener un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Marta is a widow and lives with her two daughters in her own home.  She sells medicines and owns a chicken farm.  She inherited the latter business from her husband five years ago.  She currently runs it very well and her daughters help her.  

Marta needs a loan to buy merchandise for her business selling medicines.  She will buy pills, syrups and injections for different illnesses and also vitamins and stimulants.  In addition, she would like to buy concentrated feed for her chicken farm.

Marta is a hard-working woman who is always looking for ways to make progress in her business and help her daughters.  Her goal is to own a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy syrups, injections, pills, and also concentrated feed for her chicken farm

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de sesenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia en una localidad muy concurrida. El posee un molino y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo visita a diario pues el servicio que Ricardo les ofrece es inigualable, muele harinas, maiz, frijoles, chicharrones, yuca, por ello las personas siempre quedan satisfechas; Ricardo quiere estar adelante de la competencia y está dispuesto a esforzarse duro en el trabajo, pero él sabe que para que funcione su esfuerzo necesita propósito y dirección y el quiere mantener a flote el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un nuevo molino y reparar el que no tiene en uso de esa forma mantendrá los clientes y le dará a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 62 years old and lives with his life partner in their own house, located in a very busy community. He owns a mill and already has many customers who visit him daily because the service Ricardo offers is unmatched. He grinds flours, corn, beans, pork scratchings and yucca. His customers always leave satisfied.

Ricardo wants to keep ahead of the competition and he is ready to put a great deal of effort into his business. However, he knows that for his efforts to work he needs purpose and direction. He wants to keep his business afloat so he requested this loan through INTEGRAL. It will allow him to buy a new mill and to repair another that he doesn't currently have in use. This way he will be able to maintain his customers and to give his family the opportunity for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new mill and to repair an old one

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is a member of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 7,000 KGS. Together they have two daughters and two sons; the sons are at school and the daughters help their mom with housework. After the collapse of the USSR, Zamira got a piece of land, which she uses to grow agricultural products. She grows cotton, potatoes, and corn. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase 83 kg of mineral fertilizers. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase 500 kg of wheat for her family's needs. In the future Zamira wants to see all her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
This is Paz, 41, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Joey, a driver, and is the mother to their three children. Two are in high school while the youngest is still staying at home. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating a business. 

Paz operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively separated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Paz's for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Paz hopes to buy a van to transport the scrap materials she collects. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials and items she buys in her junk shop business.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with four children. Two of her children attend school while two are still too young to go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a bicycle spare parts shop, where she sells the spare parts to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a hardware shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase additional bicycle spare parts for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bicycle spare parts for re-sale.

loans.name: Urjinbadam

texts.en:
Mrs. Urjinbadam, 56, is a teacher at The Government Training Center. She lives with her husband; all of her children are living individually. She has been working as a teacher for 36 years and she has had many pupils since she started teaching. Urjinbadam also does custom decorating jobs on order from her customers for the holidays.

One of Urjinbadam's daughters was married this year and is planning to move out of her parents house. Because of this she needs to buy another apartment that is not so expensive, but she lacks the money for an advance payment on an apartment. Therefore, Urjinbadam decided to support her daughter and is taking a loan to cover the advance payment of the new apartment.

loans.use: To cover the advance payment of a new apartment.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is 28 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling tea in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Gisma requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a shop for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase glasses and a kettle to sell tea.

loans.name: Glocille

texts.en: Glocille is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Rizal Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married with three children. Glocille has a shop that sells cosmetics and other beauty products. She has had this business for four years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more skin moisturizers, perfumes, lipsticks, fingernail polishes, eye and face makeup preparations, shampoos, permanent waves, hair colors, toothpastes, and deodorants.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic and beauty products for her shop.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”QOLQUEWASI”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Florentina; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y la socia desea invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de arroz al por mayor, compra de azúcar en bolsas, compra de fideos, leche por cajas, panetones, galletas, mazamorras, harinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otros. 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Qolquewasi". The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Florentina. She is 45 years old, married, and she has 3 children. She has a grocery store and she wishes to invest in the purchase of basic consumer goods. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of rice in wholesale, sacks of sugar, pastas, boxes of milk, pastries, cookies, puddings, and flour. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, etc.

She is thankful for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments according to the agreed payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is unmarried and aged 24 years-old. He has been selling computer accessories for the last four years in order to earn a living. Previously, he was employed elsewhere. His potential customers are passerby and neighbors. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Paul dreams of becoming more financially stable in the future. He has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy computer accessories for resale. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loan from them.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca used her previous loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy soap, biscuits and sweets. With additional inventory, her business improved.  She hopes to open other outlets of her business in other regions. She has requested for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking fat, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se unieron varias mujeres con el objetivo de poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Quieren ayudar a sus familias y piensan que el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación les será de gran ayuda.
Una de ellas es la Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos de toda clase, gracias a esto ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues hasta ahora le ha sido muy bueno. Ella tiene muy buena clientela, y muchos pedidos, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Quiere comprar zapatos de todo tipo para la poder cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues será de gran ayuda para ella y para sus amigas el crédito.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Lorenzo. It consists of several women who have the objective of being able to get ahead by working together. They want to help their families and believe that the foundation’s program for woman entrepreneurs will be a big help to them.

One of the members of the group is Maria. She is engaged in selling all kinds of shoes. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead and help her family. She wants to continue investing in her business since, up until now, it has been very good to her. She has very good customers and a lot of orders. This is why she is applying for the loan.

She wants to purchase shoes of all types in order to fulfill her customers’ needs. She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity it has given her since the loan will be a big help for her and her friends in the group.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for later sale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años convive con Sonia hace 6 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el anexo de Alto Yapaz en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro- Chanchamayo.  Carlos es un hombre del campo, pues se dedica a la agricultura gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. 
Cuenta con terrenos de cultivos que la comunidad le otorgó, en ellos siembra café y plátanos. El café estará listo para la cosecha en el mes de julio, mientras que el plátano cada 15 días, sacándolo de apuros e imprevistos.  Al inicio no le fue tan bien, ya que no contaba con terrenos propios, por ello tenía que arrendarlos. Ahora dispone de sus tierras con sabiduría. En este trabajo intenso lo apoya Sonia, su pareja; pero cuando es temporada de cosecha tiene que recurrir a personal operario mediante un contrato para que labore en sus cosechas.
Más adelante espera ampliar sus sembríos, para eso deberá alquilar otras tierras y con suerte quizá, llegaría a comprarlos. Éste sería el préstamo número 5 que recibiría de MFP gracias a la ayuda de ustedes, por ende se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por su parte se siente contenta trabajando con su banco comunal por que comparte los mismos intereses con los integrantes.
