De obtener el dinero, Carlos podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus sembríos de plátanos y café.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old and has been cohabitating with Sonia for six years.  This family lives in a home of their own in the Alto Yapaz annex of the San Luis de Shuaro- Chanchamayo district.  Carlos is a field worker and farms thanks to his father who taught him.

He has farmland that the community gave him and he raises coffee and bananas.  The coffee will be ready to harvest in July and the bananas every two weeks.  He doesn’t have to worry about unforeseen situations.  Things didn’t go well for him at first because he didn’t have his own lands, so he had to lease them.  Now he works his land wisely.  Sonia helps him with his work, but he needs more help during the harvest and must hire field hands.

In the future he hopes to expand his crops, but for that he will need to lease more land and with some luck be able to buy it.  This will be his fifth loan through MFP, thanks to your assistance.  He is committed to be on time with his payments and is glad to be working with his communal bank because he has the same interests as the other members.

Carlos will be able to buy ten sacks of organic fertilizer for his banana and coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito, porque lo necesita para contratar personas para  la recolección de la cosecha puesto que dos manzanas de tierra cultivadas de granos básicos el cual le ayudado a poder vender la cosecha y dejar para su familia.
El está muy feliz por los créditos anteriores ya que le han ayudado mucho para su familia y de esa forma ha podido apoyar a su familia y vivir en mejores condiciones de vida. Este es su tercer prestamo en la institucion, de los cuales dos han sido de este fondo, pero el ultimo lo cancelo con unos dias de atraso, por esto no ha podido republicar su prestamo.
texts.en:
Luciano has decided to request another loan because he needs to hire people to gather his harvest of two acres of basic grains so that he can sell most of it, while keeping some to feed his family.

He’s very grateful for the previous loans because they were very helpful to his family and he’s been able to help them live in better conditions.  This is his third loan through the institution, two of which have been through this fund, but he paid off the third only a few days behind schedule.  Because of this he hasn’t been able republish his loan.

loans.use: to payfor field hands.

loans.name: Eliana Patricia

texts.es: Eliana  de 23 años de edad  se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada dese hace 8 meses cuando inició su negocio, mediante guías especializadas que le ofició una amiga a través de su código.  Inicialmente vendió productos cosméticos y accesorios, pero gradualmente como sus pedidos aumentaron se vinculó directamente a la empresa y adquirió su propio código. Ella tiene una vitrina donde exhibe sus productos, que preferiblemente compra cuando vienen con descuentos especiales y últimamente ofrece servicios de informática y de telecomunicaciones; en su negocio le ha ido muy bien  pues con sus utilidades, compró un computador y tres equipos de celulares, con los que agregó un nuevo servicio. Su meta mas adelante es aumentar sus ingresos y su sueño es tener consigo a su hijo, que en la actualidad se encuentra en otro municipio al cuidado de su abuela, este es el motor que la anima a levantarse diariamente y a trabajar fuertemente, para lograr estar con él , ofreciéndole alternativas de bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, maquillajes que tiene encargados y que harán que esta inversión tenga éxito.
texts.en: Eliana is 23 years old. She has worked selling varied merchandise for 8 months. She started her business via specialized catalogues. A friend got her started with her code. At first, she sold cosmetics and accessories, but gradually, as her sales increased, she affiliated herself directly with the business and acquired her own code. She has a display case where she exhibits her products, which she buys preferably when there are special discounts. Lately, she has been offering computer and telecommunication services. Her business has gone very well and with her profits she has bought a computer and three cell phones, to add a new service. Her goal for the future is to increase her income and her dream is to get her son, who at this time is in another town with his grandmother. This is the engine that motivates her to get up every day and work hard to be able to be with him, offering alternatives for his wellbeing. At present, she is using her Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and makeup that people have ordered from her and will make this investment be a success..

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and makeup that people have ordered from her.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 36 años de edad, esta acompañada con un hijo.

Ella tiene más de 26 años de dedicarse a la elaboración hamacas, es una persona que ha vivido trabajando de este oficio, es una mujer luchadora que quedo como madre soltera cuando su hijo tenia un año de edad, desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar. Maria elaboraba dos hamacas a la semana y hoy en día elabora ocho hamacas a la semana, ella inicio el trabajo con su mamá y poco a poco se fue independizando.

Los materiales que utiliza como la soga la compra en una ciudad que queda a cuarenta minutos de su casa. Allí adquiere la soga por quintales para su uso y también vende rollos a otras personas que se dedican a la misma actividad.

Maria solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 5 quintales de soga y elaborar más cantidad de hamacas ya que tiene una enorme demanda y también utilizara el préstamo para celebrarle la graduación de noveno grado a su hijo. Con esto ella dispondrá de materia prima suficiente para elaborar muchas más hamacas ya que tiene planes de contratar a otra persona que le ayude y elaborar aún más. Ella vende sus hamacas en una ciudad de la zona oriental del país.

De esta manera Maria recibirá más ingresos, que le permitirán brindarle el estudio a su hijo, para que él se gradué en una carrera universitaria y ser ella su sustento. También desea establecer otro negocio instalando una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old and lives with her son.  For more than 26 years Maria has worked making hammocks.  She is a hard working woman who became a single mother when her son was just one year old.  Since then, she has not stopped working.  She makes the hammocks during the week and today can create about 8 per week.  She began this work with her mother, but little by little she began to work independently.   She buys the materials she uses in a city about 40 minutes from her home.  She buys the material in bulk, for her own use as well as to sell to other artisans who also make hammocks.   Maria is requesting a loan from Foundation Campo, so that she can purchase enough material to make a larger quantity of hammocks as she has great demand from customers.   She would also like to use some of the loan to help celebrate her son's graduation from the 9th grade.   With this investment Maria will be able to create many more hammocks, and she has plans to hire another person to help her make even more.   She sells the hammocks in a city located in the eastern part of the country.    With this business growing and income increasing, Maria can pay for her son's education, so that he will be able to graduate from a university and have a good career.   She would also like to set up another business, a small general store, for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase materials necessary to make more hammocks, and also to celebrate her son's graduation from 9th grade.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén de 32 años de edad, es un hombre soltero, vive en casa propia y se esmera en seguir adelante. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar  en la chacra, hoy es campesino y viene trabajando 15 años en sus propias tierras. En su parcela cuenta con variedad de plantaciones como: plantas de cacao. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano de los peones que contrata, para así avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, de esa manera ve la recompensa en la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus frutos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio que están situadas en su localidad, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y sembrar plantas de cacao. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el préstamo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará peones para realizar el desmonte de malezas y comprará semillas de café para sembrar en su parcela.
texts.en: Ruben is 32 years old, single and lives in his own house. He wants to succeed. Since he was a young child, his parents have taught him to work on the farm. Now he is a farmworker and he has been working on his own land for the past fifteen years. On his land he grows a variety of crops, such as cacao. During the harvest her needs the support of contract workers in order to pick the fruit and the coca leaves. What he likes the most about his work is the harvest. This is how he is rewarded for the good quality of his fruit. The most difficult part of his work is transporting his fruit from the farm to the gathering centers, which are located in his area. This is the place that offers the best price for his products. In the future he would like to buy more land in order to increase his plantings and also grow coffee plants. This is his second loan with MFP. He feels that this money helps him greatly with his work. He is grateful to the Prisma Institution for offering him this loan. With the 2,000 new soles, he will hire workers to help him with cutting down the weeds and he will buy seeds to plant on his land.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Nila Ysabel

texts.es:
Nila es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella vive en la Ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor. Nila es una joven muy trabajadora sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 1 años, a quien quiere muchísimo y por quien trabaja muy duro para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor y convertirla en u a persona d bien. Día a día Nila trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atnder hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va  bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Nila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como polos shorts, bivirís, faldas, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Nila is a young woman of 21 years of age. She lives in the city of Guadalupe, which is characterized by a very hot climate and a friendly atmosphere. Nila is, above all, a very hard-working young woman because she is the mother of a small one-year-old child whom she loves very much. She works very hard to be able to give him a decent life and, above all, a lot of love so he becomes an upstanding person. Day by day, Nila works in her business selling clothes. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers during the day. She thinks her business is going well because she is very friendly with the customers and, above all, because she really wants to get ahead.

Nila is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts, shorts, undershirts, skirts, etc. In this way, she will be able to have a greater variety of products for her customers, thereby enabling her to increase her income and fight to make her greatest dream a reality: "To have her own house".

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, shorts, undershirts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Botomabakouwe

texts.fr: En 1998, madame Botomabakouwe a démarré son activité de vente de charbons de bois, de mais et du miel sous un hangar. Elle exerce seule cette activité et sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour approvisionner en marchandises. Elle espère épargner et avoir une famille financièrement stable. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants(20 et 16ans) scolarisés. Elle est quant à elle âgée de 47ans.
texts.en: In 1998 Botomabakouwe started selling charcoal, corn and honey in a shed. She works alone, and has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy supplies. She hopes to be able to save, as well as to provide financial security for her family. Botomabakouwe is 47 years of age, married, and has two children at school (aged 20 and 16).

loans.use: To buy charcoal, corn and honey.

loans.name: El Hadji Kalidou

texts.fr:
Kalidou est paysan sénégalais âgé de 48 ans, il est établi dans le village de kassack nord, il a commencé cette activité de culture rizière depuis son enfance accompagné de ses parents, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de riz de la variété sahel 108, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du carburant.

Il a comme perspective d'avenir de lutter pour une autosuffisance alimentaire en riz dans son village en premier lieu et dans le pays de manière générale, il compte aussi gagner d'autres marchés locaux pour une commercialisation de son produit.

loans.use: Achat de smence de riz(variété sahel 108), d'engrais, de l'herbicide et de carburant

loans.name: Pahsom Shg Group

texts.en:
Pahsom SHG group consist of 10 members, Ngaineihoi is the representative of this group. She is the featured borrower with her hand raise in the picture. Ngaineihoi bears 3 children (2 daughters and a son) who are studying and her husband is a cultivator.
Ngaihneihoi has already avails loan from WSDS and has started weaving business. She weaves traditional skirts and with the profit she repays the loan and also use for paying her children educational fees.
She is looking forward for another loan amount so that she could continue weaving and sell the traditional skirts so that she could earn more profits for her family and also for her children.  She also has a long term goal of buying paddy field. 
Likewise the rest of the members are also engage in selling garments, weaving, and piggery and are eagerly waiting for the loan to start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy stock of colorful textures of yarn for weaving traditional skirts.

loans.name: Abidé

texts.en:
Madame S. Abidé was born in 1960. She is a married mother of six children. To generate income, she sells a local drink called “sodabi,” which is made from palm oil extract. This drink is very popular with the local population. The quality of her work and rigorous management has brought her a satisfactory clientele. Because of the quality of her sodabi, clients buy in bulk for resale. That’s the way Mme S. keeps her business thriving. Currently she can’t meet daily demand, therefore she wants to increase her business and needs a more consistent means of finance. She is seeking a loan of $900 which will serve as capital for the purchase, storage, and resale of sodabi in order to meet her clients’ demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Abidé est née en 1960. Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenue la vente de la boisson locale « SODABI », une boisson extraite à base du palmier à huile. C’est une boisson appréciée par la population. La qualité de son travail et la gestion rigoureuse qu’elle en fait lui procurent une clientèle acceptable. A cause de la qualité de sa boisson, des clients viennent s’en procurer en gros pour aller revendre. C’est ainsi qu’on constate une animation permanente chez Mme S.. Actuellement, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire la demande qui s’offre à elle quotidiennement. Elle veut alors augmenter son activité et a besoin de moyens financiers plus consistants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $900 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente du « sodabi » en vue de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: purchase, stocking, and resale of SODABI drink

loans.name: Lidia Maricela

texts.en:
Lidia Maricela is the single mother of a small child. She studied design and sewing and started out working for someone else. However, in order to take care of her son, she got together the money to buy a sewing machine and opened her own business. She now has three industrial sewing machines and requires the help of another person in order to make school uniforms. Lidia’s business has grown, as has her number of clients. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $925, which she will use to buy rolls of fabric to make sports uniforms.

Become an important part of the growth of this business. Lidia has worked hard for what she has and now she needs your collaboration. You can do it, have no doubt.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia Maricela es madre soltera de un pequeño hijo, ella estudio diseño y costura e inició trabajando para alguien más, pero para no descuidar a su hijo, juntó dinero para comprarse una máquina de coser y así poder abrir su propio negocio, ahora ya son tres las máquinas industriales que tiene y requiere de la ayuda de otra persona para la elaboración de uniformes escolares. El negocio de Lidia ha crecido y sus clientes, ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $925 dólares que empleara en la compra de rollos de tela para la elaboración de uniformes deportivos.

Conviértete en parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Lidia se ha esforzado mucho para que esto pueda ser real, ahora necesita de tu colaboración, tú puedes hacerlo, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make sports uniforms

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Mrs. Pum N. is 33 years old and sells fruit at the market.  She earns $2.50/day while her husband earns $6/day working in construction.  Pum N. and her husband have three children, one of whom works in construction with his father.  They will use this loan to buy more fruit to sell and help the father buy a motorbike for transportation purposes.  In the future, Pum N. wants to buy a stand in the market.  She would also like for her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell at the market

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she sells all types of basic goods such as sugar, medicinal herbs, oil, meat, etc. Also, with the help of her husband she prepares "chipa" to sell on the street (a typical Paraguayan food made of starch, eggs and cheese). She has done this for more than 20 years.

Adelina tells us there have been very difficult periods, when sales in the store were low and they had to make and sell "chipas." Her husband would go selling in the streets, especially by the soccer fields, and she by the church. They did this for at least two years and again stocked up their store, Adelina returning to manage it. Thanks to their honest work and sacrifice, today their children study, work and help to cover household expenses.

Adelina has previously applied for loans and has developed a good payment history. Today she wants to apply for a $500 loan to buy flour, eggs, milk, candy and oil, amongst other goods, in order to build up her inventory and that way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelina tiene 50 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella es dueña de una despensa donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, yerba, aceite, carne, etc., además con la ayuda de su marido, Don Amancio, ella prepara chipa (una comida típica de Paraguaya hecho a base de almidón, huevo y queso) para venderla de forma ambulante.

Se dedican a esta actividad hace más de 20 años, Adelina nos cuenta que pasaron momentos muy difíciles, dónde las ventas en la despensa eran muy bajas por lo que tuvieron que fabricar chipas y venderlas, su marido salía a vender de forma ambulante especialmente en las canchas de futbol y ella cerca de la iglesia, hasta que pasaron por lo menos 2 años y nuevamente volvieron a surtir su despensa y Adelina volvió a quedar al mando de la despensa. Gracias a su noble trabajo y sacrificio hoy día sus hijos estudian, trabajan y ayudan para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Adelina ya ha solicitado créditos con anterioridad, y ha adquirido una buena referencia de pagos, hoy día ella desea solicitar $ 500 para comprar harina, huevos, leche, golosinas, aceite entre otros para surtir el stock de su mercadería y así poder ampliar las ventas de su despensa.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, milk, snacks and oil

loans.name: Cicek

texts.en:
A. Cicek is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan.  She lives in the city of Sumqayit. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children. 

She is busy with her business, trading mobile industry goods. She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling industry goods and earned little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty providing for her family's other consumption needs for medication, clothes, schooling etc.
 
She wants improve her business and increase the number of clients and increase her income.

Now, she needs $1000 loan. With this loan, Cicek wants to operate her business in the central market and expand her business. Cicek thinks that expansion of her business will directly improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months. Cicek will repay her loan on a monthly basis. She is very grateful for your help.

loans.use: to open area of private trade for selling of the industry goods in the central market and expand her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel has shown great care and interest in his work of sowing and cultivating fruits since he was a boy. As a young man, he learned to perfect this ability, and with much effort, he became an excellent farmer and obtained the best products of his community. With this activity, he has been able to construct his house and has adquired some material goods, which he hopes to offer to his future family. Nevertheless, now at 28 years old, he continues striving for his future beloved wife and family. He plans to start growing coffee, which is currently having a huge boom in demand, to be able to settle his own expenses and to save what's necessary to be able to offer comfort and well-being to his future family. He is counting on your enormous generosity to be able to carry out his plans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel, mostró siempre desde niño un gran cariño e interés en las labores de siembra y cultivo de frutas, ya de joven aprendió a perfeccionar esta capacidad y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un excelente agricultor y a obtener los mejores productos de su comunidad.Con esta actividad ha podido construir su casita y ha adquirido algunos bienes materiales los cuales desea ofrecer a su futura familia, sin embargo ahora a sus 28 años, continúa esforzándose por su futura amada esposa y familia Por lo que ha pensado incursionar en el cultivo de café, que está teniendo un gran auge y demanda en la actualidad para poder solventar los gastos de sí mismo y ahorrar lo necesario para ofrecerle comodidad y bienestar a su futura familia.Cuenta con vuestra enorme generosidad para llevar a cabo sus planes.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to grow coffee on his fruitful lands

loans.name: Angostura 2 Group

texts.es:
Consuelo, 48, is married and has two children; her husband is a farm laborer. She earns a living raising pigs which she subsequently sells, live or butchered, to local buyers. Like her, Miriam earns a living raising and selling pigs. The other borrowers engage in various activities: Maria de Lourdes has a business making fishing nets; Marilu has a small store in her house where she sells sweets; Yolanda has a business selling chicken pieces. The group will divide up the loan so that each member will be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

CONSUELO TIENE 48 AÑOS, CASADA, DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL CAMPO COMO AGRICULTOR. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS PARA POSTERIORMENTE VENDERLOS VIVOS O TROZADOS ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD. AL IGUAL QUE ELLA MIRIAM SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE LOS MISMOS ANIMALES. EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES TIENE ACTIVIDADES DIVERSAS. EN EL CASO DE MARIA DE LOURDES ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR MALLAS PESQUERAS, MARILU TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE DULCES PARA SUSTENTAR EL ALIMENTO FAMILIAR, YOLANDA SE DEDICA AL VENTA DE POLLOS TROZADOS. EL GRUPO REPARTIRA EL PRESTAMO PARA CADA CUAL FORTALECER LAS VENTAS DE SU NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Invest in growing their businesses in order to increase their earnings.

loans.name: Boimatova

texts.en: Boimatova G. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children.  She has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. Mrs.Boimatova is engaged in the livestock business. It is the family business. She has the appropriate knowledge in the livestock because she worked with the bovine animals from her early years. She helped her mother on the farm in the livestock raising and sellingand the milk production . It is the only family income which is why now Mrs.Boimatova wants to try a new business. She would like to start a business in the fruits selling. Now Mrs.Boimatova requests the loan of $750 for the fruits business development.

loans.use: for the fruits business development.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa T. owns a mini bus for public transport.  He worked as a driver and after saving some money, Issa took loans from SMT and purchased a used vehicle.  Issa plans to buy the second vehicle.  His business provides transport especially to female traders who travel to different village markets to sell or buy business items.   He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To buy a second vehicle so that he can meet the demand of the local women to get to the various markets each week.

loans.name: Kagali East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joyce W.. She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joyce is 42 years old and is married. She has 8 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Joyce makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business. Joyce has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Joyce is joined in her small group by Anna N., Deborah M., Priska T., and Teresa W.. Anna N. has a business trading produce and wants to boost business. Deborah M. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to increase capital. Priska T. operates a business selling soft drinks and wants to purchase a fridge. Teresa W. is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To boost and expand clothing business

loans.name: Shima

texts.en:
Mrs. Shima K. lives with her husband and two children in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. is a farmer in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. Due to the lack of new technology, she has to depend on seasonal farming. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and the evening. Now she is requesting her first loan of US$ 175 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

Mrs. Shima’s husband's name is Madan K. and he works in a private office. Their son is studying in grade 12 and their daughter is studying in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate C. E. is  married with five children. She is forty years old from Delta state, but resides in Benin City, E. State Nigeria. She sells female wears and other clothes, which is one of the services people in her community enjoy. She has been in the business for fifteen years and needs the loan of $450 to buy more clothes so that she can sell them.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sales

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is from the little town of Calapuja. She decided to take what little she had and move to the city of Juliaca with her beloved children in search of better opportunities. Since moving to the city she has made a living selling food on the street, selling chifes (plantain snacks), and these days, making and selling beautiful garments for women and children to wear. Because of her hard work she has been able to improve her quality of life and build a small home, thus providing her two small children with security and a roof over their heads. Right now Hermelinda, a dedicated mother, would like your support to increase the total amount invested in her business. With the profits that she hopes to achieve her business will grow alongside her wonderful family. Hermelinda is living proof that with enthusiasm, perseverance, and determination you can complete many projects.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Calapuja, es el pueblito natal de Doña Hermelinda, quien con lo poco que tenía decidió emigrar hacia la ciudad de Juliaca junto a sus queridos hijos en busca de mejores oportunidades, desde que radica en dicha ciudad se dedicó a la venta de comida al paso, comercio de chiflerías en general y actualmente a la confección y venta de hermosas prendas de vestir para niños y damas, gracias a estas actividades logró mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su pequeña vivienda con el fin de brindarles un techo propio y seguro a sus dos menores hijos.En esta oportunidad ésta dedicada madre desea contar con tu apoyo para incrementar el monto de inversión de su negocio y con los beneficios que espera conseguir crecer junto a su adorable familia Hermelinda es una fiel prueba de que con entusiasmo, constancia y voluntad es posible concretar muchos proyectos.

loans.use: Increasing her capital so she can increase her selection of products

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett has been selling wine for five years. She travels once a month to bring the wine from Chincha. Then she offers it to her neighbors, who know her. She also sells the wine in a market close to her home. Additionally, for the past two years, Janett has been selling clothing every afternoon. She sells her merchandise in the market, where she has a small table. She advertises this to the public. She also sells clothing by request to her neighbors. She will use the loan to purchase the merchandise needed for her business. She would like to have her own stand in the market, where she could sell her clothing.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Janett se dedica a la venta de vinos desde hace 5 años. Ella viaja una vez al mes a traer los vinos desde Chincha. Luego los ofrece a sus vecinos, quienes ya la conocen. También reparte los vinos en el mercado cerca de su casa. Además, desde hace 2 años Janett vende ropa todas las tardes. Ella ofrece su mercadería en el mercado, donde saca una pequeña mesa y lo promociona al público. También vende la ropa a pedido de sus vecinos. Los préstamos los ha utilizado para comprar la mercadería que necesita para sus negocios. A Janett le gustaría tener un propio puesto en el mercado, donde ofrecer su ropa. Además, quisiera poner un gimnasio en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise with which to stock her businesses

loans.name: Eveline Katty

texts.es:
Eveline tiene 23 años, es una joven madre que vive con su bebe de tan solo 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño restaurante, local que alquiló en la entrada a la carretera de su zona, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 meses y gracias a Dios, no menciona, le está dejando grandes satisfacciones. Le agrada porque se dedica a lo que mejor sabe hacer, que es cocinar y atender al público, en lo que es muy hábil y tiene una riquísima sazón. Lo más difícil para ella, es atender a todas las personas que vienen a su establecimiento, debido a los pocos recursos con lo que cuenta, tanto en comestibles como en muebles (mesas y sillas.) Por ello Eveline desea adquirir utensilios y mesas para ampliar su restaurante y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, con el tiempo ser la propietaria de un restaurante de comidas típicas, ya que se encuentra en una zona donde la gente transita a varias de las ciudades de la selva central del Perú.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Eveline is a 23 years old young mother who lives with her 2 year old baby. She sells food in a small rented restaurant, which is at the entrance to a road in her neighborhood; she has been doing this for the last four months thanks to God, who is giving her great satisfaction. It makes her happy because it is what she knows how to do best, cook and serve the public, something that she is very good at and she has great skill. The most difficult thing for her is to serve everyone who comes to the restaurant due to her limited resources, both in terms of food and furniture (tables and chairs). Therefore Eveline would like to acquire utensils and tables to expand her restaurant and be able to provide better care to her customers; in the future she would like to become the owner of a restaurant serving typical food since it is located in an area where people travel frequently to several cities in Peru’s central jungle.

loans.use: Purchase of utensils (kitchenware and cutlery), chairs and tables to expand her small restaurant.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos. Ha sabido superar muchas situaciones difíciles, tal es así, que ella hace varios años que  su esposo falleció, y adicional a la enorme pena, la circunstancias la obligaron a ser el único sostén de su hogar, con mucha energía comenzó realizando diversos negocios, y hace mas de un año decide asociarse con su cuñada para emprender una fabrica de muebles de diversos diseños en metal, encargándose ella de tapizar todo los días esos muebles.Esta actividad es la única que le permite sostener a su familiar. Cada día disfruta del trabajo que realiza y no considera dificultades las vivencias diarias que son propias de su trabajo.
Andrea realiza estos esfuerzos porque desea seguir adelante, y de esa manera sus hijos sigan superándose.
Solicita un préstamo con el que comprará al por mayor, fierros, pernos y tela, para así aumentar su producción y capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Andrea is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children. She has learned how to overcome many difficult situations, especially since it has been several years since her husband passed away. In addition to the enormous sorrow, circumstances forced her to become the sole breadwinner in her home. She energetically began various businesses, and more than a year ago she decided to be associated with her sister-in-law to undertake the manufacture of various pieces of furniture fashioned in metal, taking charge of upholstering the furniture every day. This is the only activity that allows her to support her family. Every day she enjoys the work she is doing and she doesn't consider the daily tasks that are part of her work difficult.

Andrea makes this effort because she wants to get ahead, so that her children can get even further than her. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy iron, studs, and fabric wholesale in order to increase her production and her working capital.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture furniture, such as iron, studs, and fabric.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en: V. Munavar is a very diligent 46-year-old woman. She is married and she has four children. Her husband is a doctor. Thanks to her parents' seeding skills she is very familiar with agriculture work. Her mother gave her farming fields ten years ago and she has been working them ever since. This activity has helped to pay the expenses of her family and to give an education to her four children. She wishes to improve the quality of her products and is requesting this loan so she can acquire seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene 57 años de edad, con dos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, uno de ello estudia y el otro trabaja en el país de Costa Rica, debido a que  aquí se le hizo difícil hallar trabajo, y le manda remesa gracias a eso he podido ayudarme mucho, ella trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos, y alquila un cuarto lo cual le genera ingresos. Con la solicitud de crédito es para infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para alquilarlo y poder tener mas clientes como mas ingresos, a futuro es poder acondicionar los cuartos al gusto y necesidad del cliente, poder tener salud para apoyar a sus hijos  ya que desea que su hijo regrese pronto ya que se le hace difícil no tenerlo junto a ella oh cerca.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Sur of the capital, Managua. She is 57 years old with two children who are 20 and 25 years old. One of them studies and the other works in Costa Rica because it's difficult to encounter work here. He sends her money and has been able to help her a lot. She works in a house in domestic services, and she also rents a room which generates an income for her. The requested loan is for construction of a room to rent in order to have more tenants for more income. In the future, she aims to furnish the rooms to the tastes and needs of her client. She wants to be able to support her children because she really wants her son to return home soon since it's hard for her to not have him with her or at least near to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Mrs. Vy Rin is a 21-year-old rice farmer in Kvav village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Bros Pao, sells secondhand batteries. Because his business is doing well, he wants to expand. To this end, Mrs. Vy Rin is seeking a loan to buy more secondhand batteries that he can repair and resell. They hope thereby to increase their income and improve their living conditions. The couple does not currently have any children.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand batteries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase shoes as well as natural medicines for a small business.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mrs. S. sells vegetables, transporting them to customers' homes. She has a bicycle to use as transportation for her business. She has been running the business since 1999 and it has gone well; she earns around US$ 4 per day. She is married to Mr. Koeun and has five children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. To improve her husband's business, S. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase an ox to use to do hard physical labor.

loans.use: purchase an ox to use for hard physical labor

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta P. is 53 years old and owns a store. She sells a variety of goods in her neighborhood. In 1990, she started her business with capital of only 7,000 Php ($150 USD). Her store is growing and established. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 ($150 USD) from CEVI. She will use her loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. Part of the loan will be used to buy feed for her pigs. This loan will truly help Vicenta expand her business.

CEVI helps its clients sustain their businesses. Like Vicenta, more and more CEVI clients use its credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jannatoi

texts.en: Jannatoi O. lives in the Mastcho region of Tajikistan. She works in the local bazaar where she sells gold jewelery. She works with customers who wants to buy jewelery and suppliers who bring import  it from Turkey. Jannatoi is engaged in the gold jewelery business for 5 years. She is applying for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 4 months to open an outlet in one of crowed local bazaars. Jannatoi thanks KIVA and its supporters for their hard work.

loans.use: To open a jewelery outlet in one of crowed local bazaars

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is a tailor. She sells tailoring materials like zippers, thread, etc. She also sells sarongs. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She is 27 years old and single. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Шомахмадов Таварали проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет . женат и имеет семерых детей. Семья очень большая , поэтому он очень много работает для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью.Он занимается и сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы купить двух молодых и породистых бычков. Таким образом он обновит  поголовье ,а  так же сможет получать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Tavarali S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 48 years old, married and has seven children. His family is very big, and Tavarali has to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He is involved in both agriculture and animal husbandry. He is requesting the loan in order to buy two young purebred bulls. This will enable him to renew his livestock headcount and have a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purebred bulls

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: The picture shows Mrs. Oem P. who is a modest villager living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. She owns farmland in the village where she plants rice and vegetable crops to make an income. P. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children who are still single. Two of her children help with the family's daily expenses by working in different jobs. One of P.'s daughters is selling grocery items out of the home. Recently, they ran out of grocery items. This is why P. would like an $ 800 loan. She plans to order additional grocery inventory to sell and the rest of the money will go to supporting the farming business.

loans.use: To order additional grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Хошимов Муроджон- кредитор в Микроинвест с 2006 года. Все свои кредиты он пунктуально погашает, не нарушая условий Фонда. Займы он использует на свой основной бизнес ( ремонт автомашин). Он покупает запасные  части и предложив клиентам , устанавливает и перепродаёт им вместе с оплатой за установку и ремонт авто. За хорошее обслуживание и качественный ремонт к нему обращаются многие водители автомашин . За три года кредитования он ни разу не нарушил условий Фонда и использование займов.
texts.en:
H. Murodjon has been a borrower of MicroInvest since 2006. He pays all of his loans back on time and does not violate the terms of the Fund. He uses the loans for his main business (auto repair). He purchases spare parts and after offering them to customers, he installs them and resells them together with the payment for installation and vehicle repair. Many car drivers turn to him for his good service and quality repairs. During three years of borrowing he did not once violate the terms of the Fund and the use of the loans.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan H. is 43 years old and married to a soldier. She has eight children who all go to school. Juan is currently in the business of selling eggs and bread, and is now requesting a loan to buy dresses and bedsheets to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy dresses and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.en:
Y. Zukhra is 31 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. Zukhra has a tailoring business at her home. Her business involves sewing clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good, and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized, with a good head for business. She has had this business for 15 years, and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Zukhra is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Zukhra’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура Асоева проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Мастура более 6 лет занимается производством, она в основном выпускает корзины, кувшины из прутей. Клиентка просит кредит, для того чтобы отремонтировать мастерскую и закупить сырье для производства.
texts.en:
Mastura A. lives in the Vahdat district. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Mastura has been involved in manufacturing; she mainly weaves baskets and pitchers from twigs. Client is requesting a loan in order to remodel her studio and buy materials needed for production.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Studio remodeling and purchase of materials

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es:
Señora María vive en el barrio la Playa, es un barrio ubicado  en el sector rural Cruz del Camino en la Comunidad del Valle, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima es bonito  y variado, las tierras son buenas para las siembras, cosechan maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras, no en gran cantidad porque la gente sale a la ciudad a trabajar, pero si para abastecer al sector, y para consumo propio de los dueños, además se dedican a la cría de animales como vacas, borregos, pollos, gansos, cuyes, y otros.

María tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hilos de 21, 18, 16 y 15 años, el de 21 estudia en el SECAP(es un centro de capacitación profesional en Cuenca), los tres restantes estudian en el colegio del Valle, el esposo trabaja de albañil en la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta que el barrio es tranquilo y unido, viven en armonía con su familia,  Es presidenta del Banco Comunal, se dedica al comercio de ganado hace unos 10 años, asiste a las ferias de ganado los días Jueves, Sábados y Domingos, en diferentes partes de la provincia, cuenta que el negocio si es rentable ya que casi nunca pierde, cuando esta tan mala la feria solo recupera el capital, pero por lo general gana un aproximado de 30 a 40 dólares por cabeza de ganado, y cuando no se puede vender para no perder los lleva a su casa para sacarlos la próxima semana.
Es socia ya hace mucho tiempo,  este crédito que solicita es de 1100 dólares, que es para invertir en el negocio, dice que cada cabeza de ganado compra más o menos a unos 250 a 300 dólares, el único inconveniente que tiene es que al realizar el préstamo  tiene que pagar intereses y es lo que le hace pensar mucho según ella que el monto es alto y la meta que tiene es poder tener su propio capital para trabajar y no tener que estar pagando intereses.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria lives in the neighborhood of La Playa, located in the rural sector of Cruz del Camino in the community of Valle, which is 45 minutes from the city of Cuenca. The climate is lovely and varied. The land is good for crops. They grow corn, beans, potatoes, and green vegetables. The harvest is not large because the people are leaving to work in the city, but is enough to supply the farmers and the community. They also raise their own animals, as well as those of others, such as cattle, sheep, chicken, and geese. Maria is 40 years old, is married, and has 4 children aged 21, 18, 16, and 15 years. The 21 year-old studies at the SECAP, a professional training center in Cuenca. The remaining three children study at the high school in Valle. Her husband works as a bricklayer in the city of Cuenca. She says that the neighborhood is peaceful and united and her family lives in harmony there. She is president of the Communal Bank, has raised livestock for 10 years, and attends livestock markets on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays in different parts of the province. She says that the business is profitable and almost never loses money. When the fair goes badly her only returns are the original capital, but in general she earns approximately $30-40 per head of cattle. When she cannot sell the cattle above a losing price she brings them back home so that she can sell them at a profit next week.

She has been a partner for quite a while. She is asking for a loan of $1100 to invest in the business. Each head of cattle costs about $250 to $300. The only drawback of the loan is that interest has to be paid and seems high, so her goal is to develop her own capital to invest so that she will not have to pay interest.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a business that buy heads of cattle

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, es socia del Banco Comunal “6 de Enero”, que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada, con 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir fibra de alpaca.

Ella desea mejorar su negocio, por ello requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, con dicho préstamo ella podrá adquirir fibra de alpaca  en las feria de Huacullani, Mazocruz, e Ilave para luego venderlo en Juliaca.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “6 de Enero” (January 6th), which is located in the District of Ilave in El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 chidlren. Sra. Juana completed her elementary school education and lives in the neighborhood of San Miguel.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 8 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to acquire alpaca wool.

Sra. Juana wants to improve her business, so she is requesting another loan of 1100 soles to buy more alpaca wool at the fairs in Huacullani, Mazocruz, and Ilave. She will then sell it in Juliaca.

Sra. Juana dreams of building her own house. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“No one can survive in the midst of crisis without sacrificing,” says Elizabeth T., a loving housewife married to Ronald T.. They live in a rural area, in Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They belong to a poor family, but they have strong faith and determination to become successful some day through their patience and sacrifices. Furthermore, they want their children to be successful in the future; hence, they are doing their best to earn an income to satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

As a source of income, Elizabeth's husband cultivates their parcel of land by planting rice and vegetables while Elizabeth is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables during the day, and, during the night, she sells balut (chicken embryo) which is a delicious snack. She uses her small capital to acquire products which she sells retail in their barangay (village).

When Elizabeth was informed of the programs and services of the lending institution, she joined the programs and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP as capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that, with her patience and sacrifices and with financial assistance, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a fruit, vegetable and "balut" business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 52 años, es una mujer muy luchadora, vive en una casa como cuidante junto a sus 3 hijos: Huber D. 21, Marta D. 14 y Jesús 9 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. Su carretilla D. golosinas se encuentra ubicada en el Parque Bolognesi, (parque importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que ella siempre los atienD. con mucha amabilidad y una sonrisa en los labios. Su carretilla tiene una gran variedad D. productos, lo que ha hecho que su negocio le sea muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente clima, ya que a veces hace mucho calor y a veces mucho frío. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda vender sus golosinas con mayor tranquilidad.
Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Elsa con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto D. todos los acuerdos a los que lleguen su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 35 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, sus padres le enseñaron a desarrollar correctamente todas estas labores. Actualmente se encarga del cuidado de sus animales (ganado vacuno) y de sus tierras de cultivo, su trabajo es duro y arduo, pero es compensado cada día al vender la leche de sus vacas y en las épocas de cosecha. Para más adelante Alcides desea tener un establo más grande donde pueda albergar a más animales.
Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, está muy entusiasmado por este nuevo ciclo de préstamo y va a poner todo de su parte para seguir con la actitud de compañerismo que hay en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una vaca joven para criarla y que a futuro produzca leche.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca joven

loans.name: Lovi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier logoté,  elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la couture, elle a associé à son commerce la vente des articles de mercerie. Elle travaille dans son propre atelier, le revenu qu’elle gagne de son commerce lui permet de contribuer aux charges de la famille. Son stock d’articles de mercerie étant épuisé, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter un carton de fils à coudre, des fermetures, 6 boîtes de boutons et divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Lovi A. S. lives in the Logoté district, she is married and has two children. She is a seamstress and she also sells sewing supplies. She works in her own shop and the money she makes enables her to help take care of her family's expenses. Since her stock of sewing supplies is low, she needs to purchase more and is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase a box of sewing thread, zippers, six boxes of buttons, and various other sewing supplies.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Entrepreneur Rehema G. is a married Tanzanian business-woman with two school-aged children.

Rehema runs a food shop, selling varieties of food crop products at Yombo Viyuka ward in Dar es Salam. She purchases her business goods from the wholesale shops at Kariakoo and other shops around and then she sells to retail customers at her shop.

She uses the business income to meet her family’s daily needs, to pay school fees, and for business capitalization.

Rehema needs a loan of 800,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 50 years old, married with six children.Her children are excelling in school. She sells foodstuffs and food spices at retail prices to her customers. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr. Emmanuel M. is thirty-five years old; he has a retail shop dealing in leather products. He is using the loan to increase his working capital, specifically to purchase leather products for resale. He has been operating this business for over four years. The business is prospering due to the use of the loan. He hopes to be successful and more so, his future dream is to become a wholesaler of leather products in Makindye.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. Choeun S. is a villager in Roung village in the Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Saom Koy, is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more duck food and ducks for breeding. Thus, Mr. Choeun S. decided to request for a loan for this purpose. 

He is 40 years old and the father of five children, two of whom help the parents work while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more ducks for breeding and duck food

loans.name: Enhebat

texts.en:
Enhbat is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called "ger". All her three children attend a local secondary school.

She operates a small cafe with the help of her husband and mother in her town. Her cafe serves a variety of traditional Mongolian dishes. Enhbat started her business in 2003 by renting a room and has grown a successful operation over the years. In 2006 she received a loan worth of 3,000,000 tugrugs in order to buy her own working place, and in 2007 she managed to extend her working place with the loan of 4,000,000 tugrugs. She is very hardworking and is known for her good personality and positive attitude. Enhbat has many hopes for the future and hopes to expand her business soon. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase potatoes and meat for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and meat for her cafe.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz B., 62, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Diego B., a vendor, she is blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling assorted meats for several years now.

Paz has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s cooperative.

Paz is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy different kinds of meat for her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 4,700 per month.

Now with your help, Paz would like to obtain a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying pork and other meats from wholesale butchers.

Paz dreams that her business will continue to improve with more loyal customers.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy pork and other meats from wholesale butchers

loans.name: Abdudjalil

texts.ru: Латипов Абдуджалил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое сыновей занимаются торговлей. Сам Абдуджалил более 4 лет занимается продажей лекарств. Он имеет среднее Техническое образование по специональности "Фармацевт". Абдуджалил имеет собственную аптеку, где продает лекарства. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdudjalil L. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of their sons are involved in retail sales. Abdudjalil has been involved in selling medications for over 4 years. He has a secondary technical education as a pharmacist. Abdudjalil owns a pharmacy, where he sells medications. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira tiene 51 años de edad, esta Señora tiene una gran personalidad por lo que el carisma que ofrece a sus clientes es el mejor y esto les atrae mucho. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general pues ha logrado aumentar su inventario. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que sus inicios no fueran fácil, pero sirvieron de mucho para proporcionarle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar, pues siempre se ha hecho cargo de ella, ya que es Madre y Padre a la vez es por eso que trata de ofrecerle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la inversión de su capital de trabajo y no perder a sus clientes. Su deseo es establecer una tienda de cosméticos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yadira is 51. This lady is full of charisma and has a great personality-and these are what attracts her customers to her. Her business is selling merchandise in general and she has succeeded in increasing the variety of inventory. More than 31 years ago she started this business although it wasn’t easy to get started. The business helped her give her daughter the opportunity to study. She has always supported her since she is both mother and father, and thus she tries to give her daughter what she needs. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital and to not lose her customers. Her dream is to open a cosmetics store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Benny

texts.en: Benny is a 60-year-old widow with no children because she gave birth to six children but all of them died of AIDS. Benny owns a four-room house with electricity and piped water, where she lives with four people.  Benny takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala and she works seven days a week.  She serves about fifteen customers a day. Benny is a fashion designer of ladies clothing and works in shops in Kampala City. She incurs transport costs to and from the shops. The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly rent, defaulters, medication, thieves, and feeding the family. Benny has been with MCDT for five years and is requesting her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of clothing materials and other accompanying accessories. Benny hopes to grow her business and own a  bridal shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and other accessories.

loans.name: Muzamil

texts.en:
Muzamil is a 29-year-old man who is married to a housewife and has a 4-year-old child. He is the family’s breadwinner and lives with two people, his wife and child, in Hoima, Uganda. 

Muzamil has been operating a barber shop for eight years. Having worked as a ventilator constructor, he then worked in a barber shop, after which he set up his own shop by using the savings he had and a loan from Hofokam. He says he would like to shift the business to the central market where there are more customer opportunities. 

The loan will be to used to buy a motorcycle to ease his transport from home to work, because he lives far from his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the largest and the capital city of Mongolia. Battulga operates a carpentry business. He has been operating his business since 2003, and produces a variety of wooden furniture as well as working as a construction contractor. In April 2009, Battulga received 45 days of carpentry training from GTZ (German Technical Cooperation) in order to improve his skills. 

Battulga operated his business from his home until 2009, but has been renting a workshop in the 10th micro district in Mongolia. He has been expanding his business and recently ordered Chinese equipment for manufacturing wooden windows. Battulga plans to begin manufacturing vacuum windows in the near future. He is a very industrious person and is focused on the future. He says, “I would like to successfully reach my goal of becoming a reliable client of the bank in order to grow my business into a stable operation with financial support.” He is requesting a 1,250,000 tugrug loan to increase his working capital and to purchase more timber and other necessary equipment  for his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay S. is a businesswoman who sells clothes in Waterloo market. She is 34 years old and married to a man who works for an NGO. They have two children – a boy and a girl. Sallay has been in this business for 17 years. She is requesting this loan of 3,000,000 SLL to purchase more clothing for resale. She hopes to make more profit and change her situation forever.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Washington Agustin

texts.es:
Washington de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposa es ama de casa, por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener su negocio Washington construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un local para la tienda que tanto había querido. 

Poco a poco con una vitrina y unos cuantos víveres empezó su tienda, trabajando diligentemente ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 00h00pm, vende arroz, legumbres, verduras, frutas, cereales, etc. Para incrementar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y bebidas y asi asegurar el el futuro de su familia. 

En el futuro quiere que sus ventas aumenten.
texts.en:
Washington, 54 years of age, lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil. His wife is a homemaker and, due to a lack of resources and his desperate idea of having a business, Washington built a site for the store he so wanted in the rear section of his home. Little by little, with a display case and a few products, he started his store. He worked diligently, and now has a well-stocked business where he works from 7 am selling rice, vegetables, fruits, cereals, etc. To grow his enterprise, he would like to take a loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages, so he can secure the future of his family and increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Nakalama C East Mutesi Jamawa Group

texts.en:
M. Jamawa is a hardworking business woman. She is fifty years old and married with five children and three dependents (siblings), two of whom are going to school.

She has been running a tailoring business for over six years. She is using this loan to purchase materials for designing clothes to sell.

She is a determined business woman whose dreams are to prosper, educate her kids, and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for designing clothes to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed with seven children and all her children are in school.  She also takes care of her brother’s daughter.  She owns a retail shop in Mulago and sells all types of merchandise, like sugar, salt and soap, and also refreshments like sodas, mineral water and juice. She has been in this business for five years. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and crates of sodas.  She rents her business premises for 50,000 UGX per month.   Margaret works seven days a week.  Her business challenges includes seasonality and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her shop in Mulago. 

She wants to get a permanent business location.  She joined MCDT because she needed additional capital. Margaret rents and resides in a two-room house where the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kamigamba Katukore, Ibanda Group

texts.en: Hard working N. Milton has been operating an agro produce sales business from Kamigamba, Ibanda for a period of 8 years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of 3 children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed,  however, as the business now produces diminishing returns, earning him 100,000 Ugandan shillings less than previous earnings. There is always a story connected with people in western Uganda who despite laboring under tough times, always seem to find a way of educating their children. Milton is no exceptional. What he is looking forward to with this loan is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying more maize, grains, beans, rice, millet cassava and other cash crops. This will improve his revenue and also make him more able to meet his day to day life necessities.

loans.use: purchasing more produce for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel G. y su esposo el señor Clemente Delgado tienen dos hijas que actual mente están estudiando y desean que terminen estudios. 
En este momento tiene que pagar las inscripciones y útiles, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir esta necesidad.
Es por eso que están solicitando nuevamente su cooperación para este crédito ya que han tenido dos préstamos con KIVA.  
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Doña Maria Isabel de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya que Don Clemente se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como albañil.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Isabel G. and her husband, Mr. Clemente Delgado, have two daughters. Both attend school and [Maria and Clemente] would like them to complete their studies. At the moment then need to pay for tuition and school supplies, but they don’t have the money. They are asking for your cooperation once again. They have had two previous loans through Kiva. They plan to repay this loan with the income that Ms. Maria Isabel receives from her job in a factory. Mr. Clemente takes care of the family expenses with the income he receives while working as a mason.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia B. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is 44 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Constancia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, particularly in fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Constancia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for fishing. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Benso 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benso 4 sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 41 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à Maban, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités  hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ADJA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée  de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benso 4 group are married women who average 41 years of age, have four children each and live in polygamous families in Maban, one of the villages in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of better organising their winter activities. They grow pearl millett, peanuts and beans. They are on their third farming loan and the previous loans have been repaid in full. With this new loan, Adja Dembelle is planning on buying intrants and small materials as well as paying the labor costs of maintaining around 1.2 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. The produce is sold in the towns of Dioïla and Massiqui after the harvest to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. They are counting on making an average profit of around 55.000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, sowing, fertilizers, weedkiller, hoeing and small materials

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 34 years old and is married with three children. She owns a restaurant where she sells tea as well as some pastries. She has been in this business for about five years and her business hours are from the morning hours until late in the evening.

Although Oliva has been in this business for about five years, her capital is still too low to expand her business meaningfully. To solve this problem, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will be used for better reinvestment in the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky P. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Jinky is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jinky owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jinky has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jinky is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
