Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: John Chege

texts.en:
John is 39 years old and married to Jane Wangui who is a secretary at the District Commissioner office. They have four children. John runs an electronics shop besides his taxi business, in Mwingi. He has been in the electronics business for a period of about 10 years with a monthly profit of approximately Kshs. 25,000.  

He intends to use the loan to buy solar panels for resale and with the extra profit buy a generator for power back up for his business. He hopes to put up some rental houses in the future and have a big stock of fridges and televisions.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Review John from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy solar panels for resale

loans.name: Bismark Jose

texts.es: El señor Bismark José tiene 52 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos que ya trabajan de manera independiente. El señor tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y leña. El señor ya tiene 20 años de tener este negocio, empezó porque no encontraba trabajo y resulta muy difícil estar sin trabajo y con hijos, empezó con muy poco capital vendiéndoles a diferentes personas. Pues siempre ha sido un padre responsable disfruta mucho de negocio. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirle más a su negocio y de esta manera obtener más ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bismark José is 52 years old, married, and has two children who work independently.  

He had a business that sells fruits and firewood.  He has had this business for twenty years.  He started it because he couldn't find work and it was difficult to be without work and have children.  He started out with very little money and selling to different people.

He has always been a responsible father and enjoys this business very much.  He is asking for this loan in order to invest more in his business and earn more income.  

His dream has always been to have a business in the market.

loans.use: Working capital for a fruit and firewood business

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a 37 ans et fait le commerce de chaussure pour participer au menage. Elle exerce cette activité 10 ans deja. Elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d'adidogomé. Elle sollicite ce credit pour acheter 90 paires de chaussure;
texts.en:
This 37-year-old woman is married and has one child. She sells footwear to help with household expenses. 

She has been engaged in this activity for over ten years. She gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé for sale at the local market of Adidogomé. 

She is seeking this loan to buy ninety pairs of shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Belky Yolany

texts.es:
la señora Belky Yolany F. M. es soltera y vive en la aldea Rio Grande de la ciudad de Nacaome, Belky se dedica al comercio desde hace 3 años, tiene una bodega de abarroteria y granos basicos en el interior del mercado de Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria y granos basicos para surtir su negocio ya que desea mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
la señora Belky necesita comprar arroz, maiz, frijoles, refrescos, aceites, manteca, margarina, papel higienico entre otros productos de mayor venta en su negocio.
 
su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Belky Yolany F. M. is single and lives in the village, Rio Grande, located near the city of Nacaome. Belky has had a store for three years. She has a grocery store inside the Nacaome market. The loan will be used to buy groceries and staple grains to supply her business. She wants to improve her sales and income. Belky needs to buy rice, corn, beans, soft drinks, oils, butter, margarine, toilet paper along with other products that sell well.

Her big dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, beans, corn, sugar, coffee, toilet paper, soups, butter, oil, margarine, pasta, cereal, oats, soap

loans.name: Awoa

texts.fr: Awoa est mariée et  a en charge 2 enfants. Elle a 45 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de bijoux. Elle est née à Tchamba mais habite à Hédzranawoe. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et expose son commerce à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite un prêt  pour satisfaire plus de clients surtout en cette période de fin d'année où la demande est élevée.
texts.en:
Awoa is married with two children in her care. She is 45 years old, and makes a living selling jewelry. She was born in Tchamba but lives in Hédzranawoé. 

She has been in this business for almost ten years. She buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé and displays the merchandise at the front of her house. 

She is requesting a loan to satisfy more customers, especially in this year-end period where demand is higher.

loans.use: Buying jewelry

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen M. V. de 40 años vive en el barrio Los Almendros de Soledad, se dedica a la elaboración de cuadernos al óleo y al comercio de ropa en general, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 4 años, Su negocio de venta de ropa funciona en un lugar ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla desde hace 7 años , donde trabaja en compañía de su hermana, ella trae ropa desde Bogotá, ciudad capital y también le compra a confeccionistas  de los municipios aledaños como Juan de Acosta Soledad, entre otros. Sus compras las hace de contado. María del Carmen tiene también otro negocio y es el de elaborar cuadros al oleo desde hace un año  y funciona en su residencia, pero tiene distribución de puerta a puerta a través de un vendedor a quien le paga por comisión. Para la época navideña maneja unas ventas de $180.000 COP diarios con un margen de utilidad del 20% de descuento. Este, su credikiva es su tercer financiamiento a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará ropa casual, pantalones blusas y camisas elegantes. Desde que recibió su primer financiamiento con esta organización su vida ha cambiado porque complementó su subsidio de vivienda  y logró adquirirla. Su sueño ahora es adquirir el local al lado donde funciona su el comercio de ropa. Su mayor desafío es el manejo de la estacionalidad pero María ya tiene este aspecto controlado porque identifica los picos altos y bajos en sus ventas.
texts.en:
María del Carmen M. V. is 40 years old and lives in the Los Almendros de Soledad neighborhood. She dedicates herself to crafting oil paintings and also sells clothing. She is married and has two children who are 20 and 4 years old. Her clothing sales business has been located in the center of the city of Barranquilla for the past 7 years, where she works with her sister. She brings clothing from Bogota, the capital city, and also purchases clothing from tailors from neighboring municipalities like Juan de Acosta Soledad, amongst others. Her purchases are made in cash. María del Carmen also has another business; she has been crafting oil paintings for the past year in her home, but she distributes them from door to door through a salesman who she pays by commission. During the Christmas season she manages sales of 180 COP daily, with a sales markup of 20% off the discount. 

This is her third Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with it she will buy casual clothing, pants, blouses, and elegant shirts. Since she received her first loan through this organization her life has changed because she complemented the housing subsidy she receives and was able buy her house. Her dream now is to acquire the locale next to where she has her clothing sales business. Her biggest challenge is managing the changes in seasons, however, Maria has this aspect under control because she is able to identify the peaks and lows of her sales.

loans.use: She will purchase casual clothing, pants, blouses, and elegant shirts.

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora hace 15 años del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 73  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 13 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos  vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un puesto en la calle chile en Portoviejo en el cual vende todo tipo de especias como: pimienta, comino, entre otros. Además también vende detergentes, desodorantes y otros productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que lleva más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios esto le ha dado para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de sus productos, especias, detergentes, entre otros. Sus sueños siempre han sido tener una tienda para ya no trabajar en la calle.
texts.en:
Members of the community bank Light and Progress gather every fifteen days In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Rosa founded the community bank fifteen years ago. She likes the facility of obtaining loans and the additional benefits the institution offers.  She is 73 years old and married.  With her husband, she has 13 grown children, one of whom still lives with her.  Her husband is a storekeeper.

Rosa has a shop stall on the street in Portoviejo where she sells all types of spices like pepper and cumin among others.  She also sells detergents, deodarants, and other products.  She works every day from 6AM to 6PM.  She tells us she has been selling for more than 30 years, and thanks to God her work has allowed her to help her husband support their family.  She buys her products from a distributor in downtown Portoviejo.

Rosa will use this loan to buy more products, like spices and detergents, among others.  Her dreams have always been to have a store so that she no longer has to work selling in the street.

loans.use: Buying spices, detergents, deodarant, etc.

loans.name: Rosario Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Rosario Es grupo de 8 personas que conocen muy bien esta compuesto por 5 mujeres y 3 varones, presidenta es la Sra. Elba vive en casa propia por la urbanización los olivos sacaba, vive junto a su s 3 hijas y su esposo, la mencionada señora es muy buena líder y se dedica a la compra y venta de calzados de forma ambulante por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba con el dinero del crédito comprara zapatos por docenas, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora que se levanta muy temprano para cocinar y dejar todo listo para sus hijas y después sale a vender su mercadería, de esta forma colabora con los gastos del hogar, esta agradecida con la instrucción por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Rosario Communal Bank is a group of 8 people who know each other very well. It is made up of 5 women and 3 men. Mrs Elba is the group's president. She lives in her own home in the Los Olivos development. She lives with her three daughters and her husband. She is a very good leader. Her business is buying and selling shoes on the streets throughout the city of Cochabamba.

She will use this loan to buy shoes by the dozen. She is a very responsible and hard-working person who gets up very early to cook and leave everything ready for her daughters. Then she goes out to sell her merchandise. This is how she contributes to the household costs. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Kahuna Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Dorothy is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a nursery school and has been in service for 3 years now. It has been growing as pupils’ enrollment increases almost every term. With the money generated she has been able to buy land, and her goal is to build her own school and stop renting. Dorothy is requesting this loan to start building classrooms. She is a member of Kahuna Tweyimukye where each member guarantees each other’s loans.

loans.use: To build classrooms

loans.name: Jensen Laurette

texts.en:
Jensen Laurette M., 30 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 2. To make a living, Jensen Laurette plants and harvests rice for sale. Jensen also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to her community.

Jensen Laurette joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Jensen Laurette is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm supplies and pig feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pig feeds

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Mr. Chat T. has been a fisherman on the local river in the province of Siem Reap for over five years. His wife assists him in supporting their family by selling the fish in the busy market. The couple helps each other in order to ensure that their two single children finish high school.

 Mr. Chat T. always uses his old motorbike to pick up products up to sell every day. Unfortunately, the motor broke down during use. He wants to buy another one to replace the broken one, but his savings are insufficient to make this possible. In order to deal with this issue, Mr. Chat T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle in place of his broken one

loans.name: Flormira

texts.es: Flormira tiene 45 años de edad, y es madre soltera con una hija. Vive en la parte urbano-marginal el distrito de José Ortiz Leonardo en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 8 años, gana su vida vendiendo frutas como plátanos, granadillas, y guabos en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado muy conocido en la región y con bastante movimiento. Aprendió esta actividad de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro de este negocio. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Flormira es muy trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar sus ingresos para poder seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Flormira is 45 years old and is the single mother of one daughter.  She lives in the urban-marginal part of the District of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque Region.  She has been earning a living selling fruits such as bananas, granadillas, and guama for more than eight years at the Moshoqueque Market, a well-known market in the region with many customers.  She learned this job from her mother, that is to say that she knows the business very well.  She has an established clientele in the area.  She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise.  As a result, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.  Flormira is very hardworking and responsible.  Her biggest dream is to increase her earnings in order to continue getting her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: El Escondite Group

texts.es: La presidenta es la Sra. Damiana es  casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando,  tiene una pensión, donD. venD. comida y bebidas  su esposo es albañil ,el local es muy conocido en la zona  D. Chimboco  ,como las reuniones se realizaran en la casa D. la presidenta es por eso que el banco D. emprendimiento decidieron las socias denominar el escondite, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. refrescos para surtir la pensión y papa y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus comidas, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas D. la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan D. lunes a domingo, se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación D. 1 varón D. igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad, son personas trabajadoras y dinámicas que están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Damiana is the president of this group.  She is married and has three children who are in school.  Damiana runs a small restaurant where she sells food and drinks.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Damiana's establishment is very well known in the Chimboco area.  As the group's meetings take place in the president's home, they decided to name it 'el escondite' (the hideout).

Damiana will use her loan money to buy soft drinks to stock her restaurant.  She will also buy potatoes and groceries which she needs to make her meals.  This community bank is maD. up of neighbors who have all lived in the same area for several years.  Each member has their own business activity that they are engaged in from Monday to Sunday.  They all know each other well.  One man participates in the group.  The group's members are all very well known for their different businesses.  They are hard-working and dynamic people who are grateful to the institution for the support they have offered them.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria teresa se dedica a la venta de frijoles cosidos, leña, leche y bolsitas. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida pero como se traslado a vivir con su esposo tuvo que empezar un nuevo negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece que son de primera necesidad, para las personas que viven cerca su vivienda, ya que es aquí donde está ubicado su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de los productos como frijoles, leña, leche, azúcar, frutas, bolsas para la elaboración de sus bolsitas.
texts.en: Maria Teresa has a business selling cooked beans, firewood, milk and "bolsitas" (beverages sold in little plastic bags.)  She has had this business for more than 20 years.  Before that, she had a business selling food, but since she moved to be with her husband she had to start a new business.  Most of her customers come to buy the everyday consumer goods that she sells.  She sells to the people who live near her house, since that is where her business is located.  The loan that she requests will be used to purchase products such as beans, firewood, milk, sugar, fruit and plastic bags to make her "bolsitas."

loans.use: to buy beans, firewood, milk, sugar, fruit, and plastic bags to make her "bolsitas"

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana está satisfecha con su trabajo en el negocio y desde el barrio la Magdalena, envia un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: "Gracias a ustedes por prestarme el dinero ya que he logrado fortalecer mi negocio, espero sigan confiando y me financien el nuevo proyecto." Ella está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y con el comprará materias primas e insumos para la preparación de fritos, pescado para aprovechar la subienda, cajas de tomates y aji para distribuír en las tiendas y obtener nuevos ingresos porque ese capital adicional es bien cierto que le sirve de mucho.

Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Liliana Patricia C. puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/184495
texts.en:
Liliana is satisfied with the work she does, and from the neighborhood of Magdalena, she sends out a message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the loan that will strengthen my business.  I hope you have confidence in me and will finance my new project."  

She is applying for her second CrediKiva and plans to use it to buy raw materials and ingredients to make fried foods, fish, cases of tomatoes and peppers to be distributed to stores.  This will provide her with further income which will be of much help to her.

If you would like to learn more about Lilliana Patricia C., please follow this link:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/184495

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients to make fried foods, fish, cases of tomatoes and peppers for store distribution

loans.name: Rene Wildon

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco; capital Cusco, este es conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América" y donde se reúnen cada treinta días los socios del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este banco comunal conocimos al señor Wildon y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Cusco en el populoso distrito de Santiago, él tiene 33 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos. 

Wildon desde hace 9 años que se dedica a la venta de adornos y auto partes para automóviles en el centro comercial “Auto Partes San Pedro” de la ciudad del Cusco. Wildon no tiene un puesto propio sino alquilado, el trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche todos los días de la semana. En esta oportunidad Wildon requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo micas, faros, direccionales, bujías y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Every thirty days, the members of the "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United) community bank meet in Asociación Arariwa's central office, in the city of Cusco, in Cuso department, Peru.  For many years, this area has been known as the "Archaeological Capital of America".

Here we meet Wildon who is a member of the bank.  He tells us that he was born in the city of Cusco, in the densely-populated Santiago district.  He is 33 years old, married, and has two children.

For nine years, Wildon has been selling decorative accessories and spare parts for cars in the "Auto Partes San Pedro" shopping center, in the city of Cusco.  Wildon does not own his own sales location but rents instead.  He works from 7.00am to 7.00pm every day of the week.  On this occasion, Wildon needs a loan to buy merchandise such as decals, headlamps, turn signals (indicators), spark plugs, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as decals, headlamps, turn signals (indicators), spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de ropa afuera de su vivienda.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar más mercancía que es zapatos, ropa para caballero, de niño y aparatos eléctricos. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso que obtiene de las ventas ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más mercancía y variedad de productos para la venta, ya que con la inversión que realizara a su negocio tendrá más ventas y con eso pagara el crédito y podrá pagarles los estudios a sus dos hijos que tiene ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Juanita has been selling clothes outside her home for more than eight years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as shoes, men's and children's clothes, and electrical appliances.  She does not have the capital she needs to make this investment and does not want to remove capital from her business since it is her family's source of income.

Juanita would like her business to have more merchandise and a range of products for sale.  Her investment in her business will enable her to make more sales and she will use the money to repay her loan and pay for her two children's education.  She is a single mother.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren is 44 years old and makes a living as a professional driver. He lives with his wife and two children, who are 16 and 18, in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Both of his children attend college, so the family has to pay high school fees. Ochirsuren’s wife helps him in his transportation business and they both work hard because they are determined to provide their children with a good education. 

Since 2003, Ochirsuren has run his business by using the family minivan. He has permission to carry passengers in one of the city’s remote areas which lacks bus service. He is applying for this loan to buy spare parts to service his van and ensure compliance with transportation safety regulations. Now he has 200,000 MNT on hand, and is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to get the rest of the money he needs to do this work.

He said, “I want to buy a big bus to run my transportation business, and then to be able to improve my children's education and buy my own apartment.”

loans.use: to buy parts to improve and repair his van.

loans.name: Sherlina Group

texts.en:
Sherlina is married with four children. Sherlina is 49 years-old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban.

Sherlina sells a variety of products for household chores to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other household items.

Sherlina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other household items.

loans.name: Darío De Jesús

texts.es:
Darío un luchador incansable, trabaja diariamente para hacer crecer su microempresa y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y aunque como él mismo lo afirma no son muchas las ganancias por lo menos tiene la tranquilidad de contar con los recursos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. 

Poder comprar surtido para su legumbrería es una necesidad que hoy en día se le presenta, sin embargo el no cuenta con el capital para invertirlo, por lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos al por mayor y generar mayores utilidades, ayudando así a mejorar las ventas y generando mas ingresos para ir poco a poco cumpliendo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Darío is a tireless fighter who works hard every day to grow his small business and improve his quality of life.  His business has enabled him to improve his income and although, as he himself admits, he doesn't make much profit, at least he knows that he has the resources he requires to cover his basic needs.

Right now, Darío needs to buy stock for his fruit and veg store.  However, he does not have the capital he needs to make this investment.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy supplies wholesale and thereby make more profits.  This will help him to improve his sales and make more income so that he can gradually achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy stock for his fruit and vegetable store

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 10 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in Pire, a village located 100 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Their main business activity involves trading with farm products, such as cassava tubers. The group members are experienced in this field and have a strong customer base. The workday starts at 8 a.m. and ends around 8 p.m.

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they will resell at the market. The income earned from the sale of cassava will enable them to strengthen their business and provide for their children (school fees, healthcare and household expenses).

loans.use: to buy cassava, groundnuts and millet.

loans.name: Kerimbubu

texts.ru:
Керимбубу 61 год, замужем, имеет двоих детей.  Керимбубу окончила Фрунзенский Финансово- Экономический техникум и долгое время проработала бухгалтером – кассиром.  В 1999 году, в целях нахождения дополнительного источника доходов для своей семьи,   клиентка начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день, в собственности у семьи имеется 1 дойная  корова, один  теленок и  10 баранов. Также у Керимбубу имеется  7,0 га орошаемой земли с многолетними травами и фасолью.  Два года назад Керимбубу уже обращалась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50, 000 сом (KGS), который погасила  без нарушений.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,   Керимбубу запрашивает кредит в сумме 70, 000 сом для увеличения поголовья  скота и перепродажи. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" (CJSC “Bai Tushum & Partners” MFC) предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Kerimbubu is 61 years old and married with two children. Kerimbubu graduated from the Frunze Financial and Economic College and worked in an accounting department for a long time as a cashier. In 1999, in order to find an additional source of income for her family, the client began to work in farming and animal husbandry. Now the family has a milk cow, one calf, and ten sheep. Also Kerimbubu has seven hectares of irrigated land which she has sown with perennial grasses and beans. Two years ago, Kerimbubu asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS), which she paid off with no problems. To further development her business, Kerimbubu requests a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock for resale.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her eldest daughter attends high school and her youngest daughter goes to the kindergarden. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She used to sell blankets and sheets at Narantuul market between 2004 and 2008. Since 2008, she has been selling the same products at Han Talst market. Her total turnover capital is 2.5 million MNT and her daily income is between 50,000 MNT and 100,000 MNT. Her revenue is about 40% of her income. She has collected much business experience in past years.

She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I want to expand my business activity." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy more products to increase her sales turnover.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Gory

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de quatre enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école.Il a hérité de ses parents un troupeau de vaches qu'il entretient pour les léguer à ses enfants qui devront en faire de meme.C'est pourquoi, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il est obliger d'acheter d'autres animaux, de les engraisser pour les vendre et obtenir des ressources financières.Il achéte des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les nourrit pendant quatre mois puis les revend.A l'approche de la fete du mouton (Tabaski), il sollicite un pret de 400000F à l'UIMCEC pour acheter 15 moutons.Son ambition est de faire de l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man, the father of four children, who all attend school. His parents passed down to him a herd of cows that he maintains in order to leave to his children, who should in turn do the same. This is why, to support his family, he is compelled to buy more animals, fatten them, and sell them to obtain financing. He buys sheep from the weekly markets, feeds them for four months, and then sells them. As the sheep festival (Tabaski) approaches, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs from U-IMCEC to buy 15 head of sheep. His ambition is to be a livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy 15 head of sheep

loans.name: Garatel

texts.ru:
Garatel zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fzuuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoim mujom i detmi. Garatel 53 qoda. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego dela. Garatel uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric.
texts.en: Garatel is married and has three children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region, in the Makhmudlu village together with her husband and children.  Garatel is 53 years old.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens for developing her business.  Garatel has been involved in poultry farming and breeding chickens for eight years.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба женщина предпринимательница. Бизнесом она занимается уже 2 года. Она занимается куплей и продажей посуды. Хабиба  замужем, имеет 4 детей. В бизнесе помогает ей её дочь. Муж  Хабибы  на заработках в России. Для расширения бизнеса  ей нужны средства, поэтому она решила сотрудничать с «Имон Интернэшнл». Она надеется на поддержку и понимание и заранее благодарит всех за участие в её жизни.
texts.en: Habiba is a businesswoman. She does business for two years. She buys and sells dishware. Habiba is married and has four children. Her daughter helps her with the business. Habiba's husband is now working in Russia. To expand the business she needs financial means and that is why she decided to partner with Imon International. She hopes for the support and understanding and thanks everyone in advance for taking a part in her life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jonathan has been working hard to manage his small store, which sells pesticide and farm supplies to local farmers. 

To help expand his business, Jonathan has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new types of pesticides and increase his inventory as necessary, and will help Jonathan to generate greater profits and provide for his family. Jonathan hopes that in the future he will be able to own a business with 20mil UGX of capital. 

Jonathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jonathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new types of pesticides

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”QOLQUEWASI”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lucila; La socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia trabaja en una institución del estado como personal público, ella también se dedica paralelamente a esto a la compra y venta por catálogos de cosméticos, la socia ofrece sus productos de belleza como perfumes, lápiz de labios, rímel, sombras entre otros productos a sus amistades y compañeras de trabajo y ellas le hacen los diferentes pedidos una vez que llega los productos la socia les reparte y en dos partes le van pagando el costo de los productos y nuevamente en dos semanas tienen un nuevo catalogo para otro grupo de productos. La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos de belleza de sus catálogos que están en oferta para tener en su almacén y venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ”QOLQUEWASI” communal bank.  This communal bank is located in Huanchac district, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

This member is Señora Lucila; she is 49 years old and single.  She works for a state organization as a public personnel member, and she also works in parallel buying and selling from cosmetics catalogs.  The member offers beauty products for sale to her friends and work colleagues, such as perfumes, lipstick, mascara, and eye-shadow among other things.  Her customers place various orders, and once Lucila has the products, she delivers them and the purchasers pay for them in two installments.  In another two weeks, they get a new catalog with another set of products.

This member wants to invest the loan in purchasing the beauty products that are on offer from her catalogs, so that she can have them in her storeroom and sell them.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing beauty products.

The member is grateful for the loan and commits to making her repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing beauty products.

loans.name: Jessica Consuelo

texts.es:
Jessica Consuelo tiene 33 años de edad vive en Unión Libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. 
Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. 
El sueño es trabajar para reunir suficiente dinero para poderles dar el estudio para que lleguen hacer profesionales.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música
texts.en:
Jessica Consuelo is 33 years old. She lives with her common law husband and 5 children in the Ventanas canton in the Ríos province.
The community bank LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO can be found in Recinto Caimato II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is an area of agricultural laborers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.
Jessica is a farmer who sows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She does her buying and selling in the canton of Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep her crops in good condition. She also used the money from her previous loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies  like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep her crops in good condition.
Her family relationships have improved because now she is able to bring in a little more for the family wellbeing. Things are going much better for her work because she has increased production and her revenues have improved a lot because now, with the sale of her produce, she gets better income.
Her dream is to work and get enough money so that her children can study to become professionals. 
In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricul agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle achète et revend du sel de cuisine en gros à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne du sel au Ghana et travaille seule. 
Ayoko a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la grande quantité de sel de cuisine destiné à la vente. Elle pense réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans le développement de son commerce.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayoko voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’assurer une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 31-year-old woman. She is single. 

Ayoko has worked as a retailer since 2011. She buys and resells cooking salt in bulk to everyone in a store. She stocks up on salt in Ghana and works alone. 

Ayoko requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase the large quantity of cooking salt she intends to sell. She plans on reinvesting her extra profits in the development of her business. 

In the next few years, Ayoko would like to expand her business. She says that she will be able to provide a happy life for herself with her profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cooking salt.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
El señor Concepción tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero.

Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la pesca artesanal, fue un amigo quien le enseño a pescar, antes Concepción trabajaba en un taller de carpintería. Los materiales que necesita para la pesca los compra en una ciudad que queda a veinte minutos de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en hacerle mejoras a su casa, ya que con el invierno el agua entra en su casa, por eso le cambiara techo ya es de lamina y el agua se filtra, a demás los postes que sostienen la casa son de madera y el comejen se los come, por eso los cambiara a uno de cemento.

Con el préstamo tendrá una mejor vivienda, ya no se preocupara cuando llegue la época de invierno, que su casa se llene de agua. Más adelante él piensa construir una casa de bloque por que la que tiene es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Concepción is 41 years old and is single.

For ten years he has been dedicated to fishing. It was a friend who taught him how to fish. Previously, Concepcion worked in a carpentry shop. The materials that he needs for fishing he buys in a city that is 20 minutes from his house.

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in making improvements to his house since, with the winter, the water enters his house. Because of this, he will change the roof since it is laminated and the water gets through.Additionally, the posts that support the house are made of wood and the termites eat them. As a result, he will change them to ones of cement.

With the loan, he will have a better house and he won't worry when the winter season arrives that his house will fill up with water. In the future, he is thinking of building a house of blocks since the one he has is of wattle and daub.

loans.use: to change the roof of his house and the posts that support it.

loans.name: Nancy Violeta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nancy; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos , la socia tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite entre otros productos ,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy is 55 years old and has three children.  She runs a grocery store and sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and other products.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Through this business she has been able to support her children.  She wants to expand her store and is requesting a loan to buy products wholesale, such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.

She is very grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy products wholesale, such as rice, sugar, milk and oil for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories, phone air time and increase float.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina cuenta con 24 años de edad y está casada con el señor José Ángel quien es chofer, tienen 2 hijos Rafael y paulina los cuales están cursando primer año de primaria y segundo año de preescolar, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 2 años.
Dice que se animo a iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, para mejorar su calidad de vida, apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: aceite, pastas para sopa, arroz, refrescos, leche, galletas, focos, jabón, clarasol, etc. para tener un mejor surtido. 
Una de las metas que dice tener doña Rufina para su negocio es la de invertirle mucho más para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas su pequeño local y poner su abarrotería, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ganancias, también empezar a ahorrar parte de las mismas, para asegurar su futuro junto al de su familia.
Doña Rufina está muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por todo el apoyo y sobre todo confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en:
Rufina is 24 years of age and is married to José Ángel who is a chauffeur.  They have two children, Rafael and Paulina, who are studying first year of primary school and second year of preschool.  She has a grocery store, where she has worked for 2 years.  She says that she was very excited to start this business, since she wanted to look for a way to help her husband to resolve the household expenses, in order to improve their quality of life, support their children with their education and become more financially solvent.  She will invest the loan that she received in the purchase of more merchandise such as: oil, soup bases, rice, soft drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, bleach, etc. in order to have a better selection.

One of the goals that Rufina says she has for her business is to invest much more in it to make it grow rapidly, since she wants to expand her small location a little and put in her grocery store.  In this way, she will obtain more and better profits, and also begin to save part of them to assure a better future for herself and her family.

Rufina is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and to the Kiva lenders, for all the support and moreover, the trust and confidence that they are extending her.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: oil, soup bases, rice, soft drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, bleach, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 34 años, tiene 10 años de casado con dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela, vive en aldea San Juan de la Lima, Cortes.
Santos tiene cuatro años de haber establecido una pulpería donde vende productos de abarrotería, granos básicos como frijoles, arroz, lácteos, carnes, aceite, medicinas, refrescos etc. este negocio lo inicio vendiendo carnes y condimentos, pero los clientes demandaban de otros productos y con fondos propios lo surtió. Para atender a sus clientes le ayuda su esposa todos los días. Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para surtir más el negocio en productos de abarrotería, granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos y otros. Su meta es mantener surtido para incrementar las ventas, con las ganancias va ampliar su vivienda para ubicar mejor el negocio y llegar a tener una bodega pequeña de productos de abarrotería.
texts.en:
Santos, age 34, has been married for ten years.  He has two children, ages nine and two.  One of them goes to school.  He lives in the village of San Juan de la Lima, Cortes.

Four years ago Santos established a store where he sells grocery products like basic grains such as beans, rice, dairy products, meat, oil, medicine, and soft drinks, etc.  He started this business selling meat and condiments.  However, his customers requested other products, and he stocked them with his own funds.  His wife helps him take care of his customers every day.

This is the first loan that he has requested.  It is to better stock the business with grocery products, basic grains, dairy products, soft drinks, and others.  His goal is to keep his business stocked in order to increase sales.  He will use the income to expand his house to better place his business and to come to have a small grocery store.

loans.use: to stock the business with grocery products, basic grains, dairy products,  and soft drinks.

loans.name: Surayya

texts.en:
Surayya is 35 years old and a mother of five. She has always been a great support to her family. 

She has been sewing for 12 years. As there is demand for sewing in the local community, she wants to buy a new sewing machine, along with some other necessary tools and accessories, so that she can sew a variety to clothes for her customers. But their family income is not enough to purchase all of this. 

Therefore she has applied for this loan. 

Income from sewing will enable her to support her family and save some for future purposes. She dreams of having a good life for her children.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and accessories for it

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year old Eugenia engages in food vending business. She prepares and sold snack food like banana cue (deep-fried mid ripe banana, with caramelized sugar), popcorn and ice candy with various fruit-flavors.
She is married and has three grown children. 
She also raises and sold hogs, as additional income of the entire household. She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

She has been  selling snack foods to the locals in her place. She would like to boost her both sources of income by providing adequate supply of feed and also prepare variety of snack foods.

Eugenia  has requested to purchase feed and more ingredients like sugar, milk and coconut. These could help improve her both sources of livelihood and continue to expand. In that way, she will be able to gain higher earnings and able to provide higher volume of snack foods to sell.

She is hoping that someday, she will become more sustainable, and Eugenia is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase feed and more ingredients like sugar,  milk and coconut

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Ms. A. Denise was born April 14th, 1977 in Lomé. She is single and has one child. Having only a middle school education, she had to begin supporting herself at a young age. She is a retail saleswoman of bread, raw peanuts and snacks. She has already benefited from two loans which she repaid on time.

Today she is seeking another loan of $850 which will allow her to increase her activities by offering her customers processed peanuts, ground coconut, and bulk peanuts. This will allow her to expand her market share and to make her activities more profitable.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Denise est née le 14 Avril 1977 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant. De niveau d’études de classe de 4ème, elle a du commercer très tôt à se prendre en charge. Elle est revendeuse de pain, d’arachide et de casse croûte. Elle a déjà bénéficiée de deux crédits qu’elle avait remboursés normalement sans aucun retard.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un autre crédit de $850 remboursable qui lui permettra de renforcer ses activités en offrant à la clientèle des cacahuêtes, des cocos râpés, d’arachides. Ce qui lui permettra d’accroître sa part de marché et de rentabiliser plus ses activités.

loans.use: increase retail sales

loans.name: Alma Georgina

texts.en:
I have had my business for 5 years, selling food I make myself to my community. My store is installed during the afternoons outside of my home, and I have a good location on a street that is heavily trafficked. By having it near my home I have the opportunity to watch for and care for my children. I know that I can earn more if I invest more capital and by doing so, improving our standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico desde hace cinco años a la venta de comidad que yo misma preparo. Mi negocio lo instalo por las tardes fuera de mi casa, ya que tiene buena ubicacion y esta calle es bastante transitada. Por tenerlo frente a mi casa me da la oportunidad de cuidar a mis hijos y atenderlos. Se que puedo lograr mas si invierto mas capital asi voy a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase tortillas, cheese, meat, potatoes, condiments, butter and other items.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is a mother of 2 children. She lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. 
This 28-year-old young mother of 2 children has a plot of land, where she plants vegetables.
 Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer and seed for  improving her land, to get rich harvest.
Shehas run this business for  3 years.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sitara

texts.en: Sitara is a mother of 4 children. You can see Sitara and her husband in the picture. They live in Khachmaz region, Hadjilar village. This 43-year-old woman has 6 years of experience with cattle breeding. Now the family needs a loan of $1200 to buy 4 calves so they can grow their business

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Rosa Alexandre

texts.pt:
Rosa Alexandre P. is 29 years old, she is the single mother of 4 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Mavalane in Maputo. She resells chicken in the Mavalane market. Rosa joined the program in February of this year and requested a loan of 5.000MT which she repaid on time. She is the second cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 8.000MT to be repaid in 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Alexandre P. tem 29 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro de Mavalane em Maputo. Revende frangos no mercado de Mavalane. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro do presente ano com um emprétimo inicial de 5.000MT com um bom desempenho em termos de reembolso. Está no 2º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 8 meses.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es:
Carmen is an enterprising woman. She is always happy to do a good work. When she was young, she had a big desire of self-improvement, so she decided to study Pedagogy and today she is a teacher in a small school in her hometown Chambara. She is also in the sheep breeding business. Both activities allow her to support her 2 children who are the reason of her being; and she has raised them alone since she separated from her husband several years ago. At present the oldest of her children is studying in a Higher Institute and the youngest is in school. Carmen lives with them and her senior mother, for this reason she wants to increase her investment capital to be able to keep supporting them. With your support she will be able to buy new animals. Let's support this mother and professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, es una mujer emprendedora, cada día esta siempre animosa de realizar una buena labor, ella en su juventud y con sus amplios deseos de superación decidió estudiar la carrera de pedagogía y hoy es docente de una escuelita en su tierra natal de Chambara. También se dedica en parte de sus días a la crianza de animales ovejitas, ambas actividades le permiten sostener a sus 2 hijos que son la razón de su existencia y los ha criado ella sola desde que se separó de su esposo ya hace varios años. En la actualidad el mayor de sus hijos esta estudiando en un instituto superior y el menor esta estudiando en la escuela, Carmen vive en compañía de ellos y de su anciana madre y es por ello que anhela incrementar su capital de inversión para seguir procurándoles bienestar y sostén con la nueva adquisición de animalitos que desea realizar con vuestro apoyo. Apoyemos a esta madre y profesional de corazón.

loans.use: Increase working capital to buy more animals.

loans.name: Argentina 3 Group

texts.es:
Teresa is 33 years old and has three children. Together with her husband, Teresa has a shop in which they sell accessories for and repair bicycles, because these are widely used by the people in their community. The other women in her group have different activities: Catalina has a general store in her home; Maria Guadalupe and Antonia sell cosmetics and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

TERESA TIENE 33 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TIENEN UN TALLER EN DONDE REPARAN Y VENDEN ACCESORIOS PARA BICICLETAS, YA QUE SON MUY UTILIZADAS POR LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. SUS COMPAÑERAS DE GRUPO TIENE DIFERENTE ACTIVIDAD: CATALINA TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, MARIA GUADALUPE Y ANTONIA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES.

loans.use: Investing buying bycicle spare parts (INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE REFACCIONES PARA BICICLETA)

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Enyonam A. is 35 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has to take care of the household expenses and the costs relating to sending her children to school because she is married to a polygamist who has difficulty meeting his own needs. She plans on using this loan to increase the size of her business in order to earn more and better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Enyonam A. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Les dépenses du foyer et celles relatives à la scolarisation de ses enfants reviennent à sa charge puisqu’elle est mariée à un homme polygame qui subvient difficilement à ses propres besoins. Elle pense, avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce pour gagner plus et mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of rice, 3 cases of milk and 5 cases of canned food

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana V. is a single mother who works with zeal to be able to put food on the table in her humble home. She lives in El Sauce. Her only son is in school. She has been working for the past 10 years as a teacher of young students at a local primary school.

She urgently needs to invest on the infrastructure of her house. She needs money for the materials and construction and the labor before the rainy season comes, because whenever it comes around her house ends up flooded.

For this reason, Mrs. V. has come to Ceprodel for help. Ceprodel has already begun to help her with loans that have allowed her to purchase materials for construction and have allowed her to give her son an improved home and quality of life. Now she needs a little more in order to complete her home improvement project.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Ana V. es madre soltera que con gran ahínco se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación en El Sauce. Su único hijo se encuentra en edad escolar y es por eso que la señora V. desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la profesión de docencia dando clase a niños de primaria en un colegio de su localidad.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa la señora Ana V. es la urgencia de invertir en la infraestructura de su casa debido a que ha iniciado la remodelación de su humilde hogar y para esto necesita adquirir los materiales de construcción y el pago de la mano de obra antes de que el invierno le visite y se produzcan muchas inundaciones en su hogar a causa de la lluvia.

Por esta razón es que la señora V. acude a Ceprodel quien le ha iniciado a apoyar con créditos que le han beneficiado tanto que ha adquirido parte de los materiales para la construcción y así brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo que tanto necesita del apoyo de su querida madre.

loans.use: Improve her home to stop flooding

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em Y., 61, works with her husband on a plot of land growing rice and vegetables, earning around $2 a day of profit. They have 3 children: one is married and lives away from home, and the other two help their parents growing rice and vegetables.

This loan will be used to purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and good rice seed to assist in their work.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizers, and good rice seed.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael I. is a strong and energetic woman. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and single. She sells and rents VCDs and cassettes to people in her community. She has been in this business for 2 years. Ms. I. is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more VCDs and cassettes for sale. This will help her improve her business. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more VCDs and cassettes for rent and sale

loans.name: Gbadebo

texts.en: Gbadebo S. sells bags such as traveling bags, school bags, and handbags in Oka community, Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She learnt this business for 3 years and started her own in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more bags for sale.  She is from the western part of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more bags for inventory

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A. is 24 years old, single, and without children. He is a barber and has opened a shop in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With these funds, he wishes to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying hair clippers, a new mirror, and beauty products. Also, with the profits he is going to make from his business, he hopes to help more with taking responsibility for family needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Kossi A. est âgé de 24 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est coiffeur et a ouvert un salon à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec les fonds, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant des tondeuses, un nouveau miroir et les produits de beauté. Aussi, avec les profits qu’il va dégager de son activité, il espère mieux participer à la prise en charges des besoins de sa famille maternelle.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of his enterprise

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Bertha is a widow and has 4 children aged 32, 27, 26 years old and all are married. She also has a 13-year old that is in high school. She started her busines sto support her children so that they would attend school and not have to fight their way through life like her. She wished to have a better income to provide her children with the necessities of life and to send them to school. She washed and ironed people's laundry and she provided house cleaning services and she didn't want the same fate for her children.

About 17 years ago she started working at a business selling accessories. Her boss was not from the same region and so offered her the stand with the little bit of merchandise. Slowly and with good management skills she generated positive sales and her busines started growing.

She requests a loan in the amount of $350 that will be repaid in a term of 6 months to purchase clay item such as pots, decanters, vases etc.. With your help Bertha will continue making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Bertha es viuda y tiene 4 hijos de: 32 años, 27 años, 26 años casados y una de 13 años que estudia secundaria. Inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudiaran y no batallaran en la vida como ella. Ella deseaba tener un ingreso mayor para poder darle a sus hijos lo indispensable para subsistir también su preparación académica ya que ella se dedicaba a lavar, planchar y recoger casas ajenas y no quería lo mismo para sus hijos comenzó hace aproximadamente 17 años le compro el negocio de venta de novedades y accesorios, al que en ese entonces era su patrón ya que ella trabajaba atendiéndolo como no era de ahi le ofreció quedarse con el local con un poco de mercancía poco a poco con su buena administración y sus buenas ventas fue haciendo crecer su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de artículos de decoración hechos de barro como son cazuelas, jarros, floreros, vasos etc. Con tu ayuda Bertha seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia is 28 years old and lives with her partner. She has one son and she was in school until 5th grade of secondary school and she lives near San Martin in the district of Zepita in the province of Chucuito - Juli in the region of Puno.

She is a member of the group Zepita where she got her first loan of 300 soles, which she invested in buying 3 bottles of fizzy drinks, 2 bags of noodles and 1 sack of noodles for her grocery store. With the following credits and with her earnings she has been putting it together bit by bit.

For a year she has been starting another business with her husband: raising bulls from 2-4 years old so that she can earn more. With the loan of 300 soles she will invest in 2 bulls to raise. She will pay this back in 3 lump sums.

Eufemia says that being part of this group has helped her to start more productive businesses, and for this she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Eufemia tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de un hijo, su nivel de instrucción es quinto de secundaria y vive jirón San Martín s/n del distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito - Juli y Región de Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Zepita, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero invirtió en compra de 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 2 bolsas de fideo, 1 saco de fideo, para su tienda de abarrotes. Con los siguientes créditos y con sus ganancias fue implementando poco a poco. Hace un año junto con su esposo han emprendido otro negocio que es engorde de ganado vacuno, especialmente toros de dos a cuatro dientes, ya que de ello obtienen mayor ganancia. Por ello con su préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en comprar 02 toros para el engorde. Este crédito será pagado en 3 cuotas. Eufemia, cuenta que estando en el Banquito despierta más para emprender negocios más productivos, por ello está sumamente agradecida a Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su sueño es construir establos para el engorde y que su hijo estudie para que sea profesional.

loans.use: To buy 2 bulls/Compra de 2 toros (ganado).

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.es:
La señora Marbelita, socia del Banco Comunal “MARIA AUXILIADORA”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la  venta de artículos de limpieza, sobre todo para utensilios de cocina, en un  puesto de venta que esta situado en el Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres C-4, mercadillo Tarapoto.

Se inició en el negocio porque le gusta, poco a poco aprendió el manejo de esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para sostener a su familia. Está contenta con lo que ha logrado gracias a este negocio.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como escobillas, esponjas de diferentes variedades  para el lavado de los utensilio de cocina y ollas, además quiere implementar el negocio con ollas. Los productos se lo envían de la capital. Quiere surtir bien su negocio porque la clientela son en su mayoría mujeres y muy exigentes .

Marbelita tiene 67 años de edad, es natural de Tarapoto, tiene 6 hijos, todos ya mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace. En un futuro piensa poner otro negocio en un puesto más grande y sobre todo seguro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marbelita, member of the Communal Bank "Maria Auxiliadora", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She sells cleaning supplies and kitchen utensils from a stand located on Jr. Andres Aveline Caceres C-4 in the Tarapoto market. She started the business because she enjoys it and has learned little by little to manage the business better in order to generate profits to support her family. She is happy with what she has accomplished thanks to this business. With this loan for $275, which she'll repay in 4 months, she'll purchase products such as brooms and various types of sponges for washing dishes and pans. She also wishes to expand the business by selling pots and pans. Her products are sent from the capital. She wishes to fully stock her business as the majority of her clients are women and very demanding. Marbelita is 67 years old and a native of Tarapoto. She has 6 children, all of whom are adult and independent. She is characterized by her gentleness, customer attentiveness, calmness, and self-confidence. In the near future she would like to expand her business to a larger and secure location.

Translated from Spanish by Liz West, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products such as brooms, sponges, and pots.

loans.name: Davlathudo

texts.ru: Хосиятов Давлатхудо житель района Джиликуль .Возраст  45 года,женат,имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности преподаватель.Работает в средней школе  района.Но так как заработная плата очень маленькая, клиент занимается куплей продажей фруктов.Он скупает у местных крестьян фрукты и реализует их на рынке.На доход от  торговли он содержит свою большую семью. На полученный кредит Давлатхудо хочет увеличить  денежный оборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Davlathudo H. lives in the Jilikul region. He is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children. Davlathudo has a college education and is a teacher by profession. He works at the regional high school. Because his salary is very small, the client also purchases and sells fruits. He purchases fruits from local farmers and sells them at the market. Davlathudo uses the profits from this business to support his large family. He will use his loan to increase his working capital. Davlathudo plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly S. was born in 1967 and she now lives in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hang San, are farmers who can get little rice revenue because they own only a small piece of land to cultivate rice on. They have five children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Ly S.'s  family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions so Mrs. Ly S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Haroon

texts.en:
Haroon is a 30-year-old man who lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a car parts shop. He is a very hard worker and experienced man who has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but now the location of his business has changed. He feels his business is little weak so he wants to enlarge this business to attract his customers back.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and complete some of his necessity materials to further his business with more success and make his business like it was in the past. He is sure that he can do it.

Haroon wants to thank everyone who helps this process and he would like to thank lenders around the world. He really appreciates this process of small loans in Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership so as to have another shop in the future.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Anzhella

texts.en:
Anzhella is married and has one teenage daughter. She sells children's and teenage clothing. Her monthly gross income is 20,000 UAH; the profit is 5,000 UAH.

Anzhella has been in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a department store, where she rents some space. When Anzhella was just starting, she felt sure that children's and teenage clothing would always be in demand. She was right and her business grew. Being hard-working and a determined person, Anzhella desires to develop her business even more and  open a second business location.

Anzhella is asking for a loan of 1,500 UAH for 1 month. She believes this can be another little step in her business's growth.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Alexeeva

texts.en: Alexeeva N. wants to be a retailer, and rented a market stall to start her trading business. She’s experienced in this business now, as she has worked in it for more than 2 years. The business is located in the central open-air market of Orhei town. She launched her business on the 19th of April 2006. This loan is Ms Alexeeva’s first loan with MicroInvest. The purpose of the loan is to invest in her working capital. She used her own resources to purchase a booth, where she will store and sell merchandise. In the future, Ms Alexeeva would like to increase the assortment of goods for sale, and increase profits.

loans.use: To invest in the working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells medicine. The demands for her medicine are high. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She says, "Thanks to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Makole E Group

texts.en:
Catherine has owned a small shop in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees for her children.  


Catherine is 41 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 21 and 13.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mary, who also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Bunry Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people living in Sramaoch Haer village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Bunry N. is a 39-year-old village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries to generate bigger profits. Her husband, Mr. Chhang Srorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Bunry N. has three children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to generate bigger profits

loans.name: Shiraz

texts.en: Shiraz S. is a 42 year old man who sells sweets, candies, tea and some home products in his small store which he rents. Shiraz has two years of experience in this field. His dream is to build his own store in the future. Now he enjoys his business and is trying his best to grow it and provide the best future for his three children. Shiraz applied for a US $1200 loan to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia E. is a food vendor. She is managing a small food stall to earn a living for her family. She started her business using her small savings. Until now, she was able to sustain her business. The income that she gets from cooking and selling food is what she uses to pay the electricity, tuition, and their other needs.

The purpose of her loan is to buy additional ingredients for her food business. She wanted to grow her business to give her children a bright future. Schools are very expensive that is why she is working so hard to support her children in their studies.

CEVI is reaching out to small business people to grow their livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.fr: Mamata A. est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 7 ans. Avec ce crédit, Mamata souhaite accroître la capacité de son commerce en approvisionnant son magasin. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses recttes et par conséquent mieux satisfaire les besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Mamata A., 45, is married and the mother of 3 children. She owns a little grocery store in Wome. She has been in this business for 7 years. With this loan, Mamata hopes to grow her store by adding to the inventory. This loan will permit her to increase her earnings from the store and thus be able to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking her store with merchandise

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Hà works in a family member's service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Hà has just started working in this business and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
