Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Hà is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND (US$550), which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
En 2000, cette femme a débuté le commerce de céréales, elle s’est vite adaptée à ce commerce et vend bien, ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu lui permet de subvenir à certaines charges. Son stock a baissé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son premier cycle de prêt qui lui permettrait d'acheter 5 sacs de maïs,04 sacs d'haricots et 2 sacs de sorgho.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started selling cereals in 2000. She adapted well to this business, and her sales are good, and her income enables her to provide for some expenses. Her stock has experienced a drop, and she would like to resupply. This is why she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 5 sacks of corn, 4 sacks of bean, and 2 sacks of sorghum. She's married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn, 4 sacks of bean, and 2 sacks of sorghum

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.en:
S. Abduzoir is a farmer. He grows potatoes and other vegetables to support his family. He is 48 years old and has 5 children. He is worried about getting money to sustain his farm business. His wife and children support him in all his decisions. In the photo you can see his daughter.

Abduzoir has been tilling the land for 7 years. He is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni that he will use to buy more seeds and fertilizer. The loan will allow him to have an abundant harvest. Abduzoir and his entire family are sincerely thankful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.en:
Señora Norma is a 49-year-old single mother with one daughter. She lives just outside the city of Pucallpa. Norma is an independent businesswoman, dedicating herself to the sale of beauty products, kitchen supplies, purses, and other items.

Norma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for nine years and belongs to the communal bank "Las Guerreras" (The Warriors). She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase sandals to sell. Eventually, the sale of sandals and other goods replaced the laundry business that she had at that time. (Norma used to take clothes in for washing).  

At this time, Norma is requesting a loan of 2,500 soles, which she will invest in her business. Norma plans to use the funds to construct a small store space within her home where she will display her goods. Norma is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support. With her loans, her earnings from her business, and a lot of hard work, Norma has been able to purchase land for her home, construct her house, and create her own business. She plans to continue working with Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Construction of a small store space to display goods for sale

loans.name: Estela Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Estela es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, en el distrito  de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, ella tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta y vive en el Barrio Villa Paxa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó como capital para su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1900.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar 2 maquinas Play station para ampliar su negocio de servicios de cabinas de Internet, negocio que tiene actualmente.

Su deseo es comprarse un bus grande para hacer servicio interprovincial.

A ella le gustan la solidaridad las reuniones y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower), in the Puno district, Puno Province, in the state of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She did not complete her upper level education, and lives in the Villa Paxa neighborhood. She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 soles; she used that money as capital for her grocery business. Presently, she needs a loan of S/. 1900 soles. The loan will allow her to buy 2 Play Station machines to broaden her business services in Internet consoles, a business she currently operates. Her dream is to buy herself a large bus to provide inter-provincial services. She likes the solidarity meetings and gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2  Play station machines

loans.name: Ciria Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y con un hijito, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), y  vive  en el Centro poblado de Churo López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, este monto  ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas Maruja vende las ovejas luego de mejorarlos a mas precio en las ferias de Ilave.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando y le gustaría comprar ganado mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 27 year old widow and the mother of two children who attend school. She operates a bicycle spare parts shop, a venture she initiated in 2000. She requires kshs 20,000 to increase her stock of bicycle spare parts.

loans.use: Buy stock of bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 36 años, es padre de un hijo y vive con su pareja en una casa alquilada. Hace 16 años se dedica al cultivo de café, paltas y plátanos. Últimamente está cosechando los plátanos cada 15 días y vendiéndolos en su misma chacra por arrobas (12 kilos), mientras espera la cosecha de sus cafetales por un lapso 9 a 12 meses. Una vez iniciada la recolección de este grano (café), junto a su esposa preparan la carga que transportarán hasta el mercado convencional de su provincia, a 45 minutos en carro desde su zona. Por ello, trata de que en un viaje lleve de 8 a 10 quintales, para que le permita cubrir el precio del transporte y sus pasajes. Ya de regreso, con las ganancias obtenidas, compran alimentos para su hogar y vestimenta para sus hijos, lo cual lo llena de mucho regocijo.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 600 plantitas de café para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de plantas de café

loans.name: Joweria's Group

texts.en:
Joweria Balugamberia is the leader of her group in Lugozi. She is involved in retail and has owned her own shop for 5 years. The 200,000 USH the shop currently generates per week in profits allows her to care for her seven children and the three orphans for whom she cares.

Recently, prices for goods have been higher; consequently, she would like to use the loan of 1,500,000 USH to remain well supplied. People choose to shop with her because her prices are good and because she always has what the customer needs. Joweria hopes that her business will continue to expand and that all of her kids will be raised to be good citizens of Uganda.

loans.use: restocking her store

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita D. is a 55 year-old businesswoman from Malaria, Caloocan City. She has been a widow for years and now lives with her three children, all of whom are already working and earning for themselves. Melita has been direct-selling beauty parlor supplies and salon products for many years. She is earning more than P 40,000.00 a month.

Melita has been with Kiva partner the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for two years now and has been enjoying the warm ambience of the weekly gathering of her fellowship group. She is now applying for a loan of P22,000.00 which she will use to purchase additional beauty parlor supplies. She wishes to expand her business by establishing a salon branch in other areas.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase additional beauty parlor supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old, married and has six children.  All are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the western region of Ghana. 

She works to provide for her family. Mary is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community and sells all kinds of local dishes. Mary has hired extra hands that work for her. She buys food stuffs such as maize, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc. from nearby communities and has been in business for over 15 years.  Mary wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: Buy food items.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha K. is 33 years old and married with two children aged 17 and 14 years, plus she takes care of her siblings.

Martha has a restaurant in Gayaza that has been operating for eight years because of the good service and meals that she offers. She is able to make $27 in profit a week, and this helps her in running her home, restocking her business with more food, buying needed utensils and paying her rent.

Martha wants to educate her children through the University, which she has been working toward ever since her children were young.

At this time, Martha needs a loan to help increase her stock of rice, maize flour, beans and so on for expanding her business operation.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice, maize flour, beans and so on for expanding her operation.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar B. is a 28-year-old and currently lives with his 3-year-old daughter. Chuluunbaatar got divorced from his wife in 2008 but lives with his daughter right next to his parents' home.

Chuluunbaatar is a freelance artist. He graduated the School of Arts with a major in ceramics in 2003. Since then, he worked as an assistant artist for a local arts company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Early this year, he decided to launch his own practice and became a freelance artist. He now makes various artistic items out of bone, various stones, and ceramics. His main customers are foreign tourists who are impressed with local arts. His work is mostly sold through souvenir shops in tourist camps. He says that he enjoys doing ceramics and various traditional artistic work and plans to add more variety of products to his collection.

He requests a loan to purchase necessary frames and raw materials for his arts work.

loans.use: to purchase necessary frames and raw materials

loans.name: Bayramov

texts.en: Bayramov M. was born in 1956. He is married and has 4 children. He and his family live in Khachmaz town. Three years ago, he started a cattle breeding business.Now Bayramov is asking for  a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Precila's Group

texts.en:
Precila B. is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Precila is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Precila is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Precila owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Precila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Precila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Precila is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Chanthorng

texts.en: Mr. Chanthorng P. is 27 years old and a villager from Roluos village in Takeo province. He is the father of one child who is too young to study or work. Chanthorng P. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mom Oreng (pictured right), is a laborer in a garment factory. However hard the family works, they do not earn sufficient income. Therefore, in order to improve their living conditions, they want to start a new business but do not have sufficient funds. So, Mr. Chanthorng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a taxi-moto

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: In 2005, Jenny S. joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. which means "To rise up from poverty”), a micro-finance institute and Kiva partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in selling of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes), and soon hopes to expand the business with more stock. Now on her 6th loan, Jenny requested PHP 25,000 to purchase an inventory of clothes, including jeans, shorts, and other supplies. She is optimistic that her business will grow because she already has regular customers requesting orders from her. Jenny dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her products. She also dreams of building a durable, concrete house and having a successful businesses that can provide them with a good life that is far away from poverty. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, Jenny is hopeful that her expanded business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s college education. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, shorts, and other supplies

loans.name: Rael Achieng

texts.en:
Rael Achieng O. operates a food kiosk (hotel) in Manyatta, Kisumu, Kenya. She started this business in 2009 since she was tired of being just a housewife and wanted to support her husband in providing for their three children as well as to be economically independent.

Rael buys her stock in Kibuye market weekly but would like to expand her business so that she could be doing this more often and in larger quantities to boost her income. She would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 20,000 to increase her stock.

Rael is 23 years old and has a dream of building rental houses and educating her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock to boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Muon's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who are villagers in Trav village in Prey Veng province. Mr. Muon K. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Key Korng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Muon K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Through this activity, the couple supports four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, and two are laborers in the local village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ciencia

texts.es: Ciencia, de 57 años, es viuda desde hace dos años, tiene 7 hijos pero sólo vive con dos de ellos en una casa alquilada en una localidad de Santa Ana. Su alegría desbordante hacen que todos las personas que la conocen, le tomen cariño, y valoren a la mujer trabajadora y luchadora que es, pues luego de la muerte de su esposo, se había dejado invadir por la pena y no sabía a donde ir, hasta que hace un año llegó a esta localidad  y empezó a plantar café, plátanos y palta, en terrenos que poseía. La belleza de los cultivos le ayudó a olvidar de su tierra natal y de la pena que la invadía, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y vecinos. Lo que más le gusta es aplicar abono a sus plantaciones, porque sabe que tiene que cuidarlos muy bien para que den una cosecha productiva. Por ahora desea comprar más hectáreas de terreno agrícola y además de construir su vivienda, para que sus hijos se sientan seguros y tengan la tranquilidad que merecen. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y asegura que su palabra vale más que cualquier documento que pueda firmar, por lo que pagará la deuda sin retrasos, asimismo está entusiasmada de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde todos la recibieron con los brazos abiertos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará quinientas plantas de café y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ciencia, age 57, has been a widow for the past two years. She has 7 children, but she lives with only two of them, in a rented house in a neighborhood of Santa Ana. Her exuberant happiness causes everyone who knows her to like her, and they appreciate her hard-working and determined nature. After her husband's death, she was overcome with sorrow and did not know where to go, until a year ago she arrived in this place and began growing coffee, bananas and avocados on lands she owns. The beauty of her fields helped her forget her original home and her sorrows, and she also received help from her children and neighbors. What she likes best is applying fertilizer to her fields, because she knows she must take very good care of them so they will produce a bountiful harvest. For the future, she would like to buy additional hectares of agricultural land and also construct a house, so that her children can feel secure and enjoy the tranquility they deserve. This is her first loan with MFP, and she assures us that her word means more than any paper she can sign, and she will make all of her payments without any delays. She is also very enthusiastic about working with her communal bank, where everyone received her with open arms. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy 500 coffee plants and some sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 500 coffee plants and some sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Adjouavi

texts.fr: Née en 1973 au Bénin, G. Adjouavi  est mariée à DJOSSOU Vissin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de quinze ans que Adjouavi s’est installée avec son mari au quartier Hindé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Adjouavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Adjouavi  prépare de la bouillie (faite à base de d'amidon de maïs et du sucre) qu'elle vend depuis douze ans dans son quartier à Hindé. Adjouavi fait ses provisions à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Adjouavi désire augmenter le volume de ses ventes et accroître sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Adjouavi sollicite l’aide financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Benin, Adjouavi G. is married to Vissin DJOSSOU. The couple has two children, both at school. It is almost 15 years now since Adjouavi settled down with her husband in the Hindé district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple shares the various family expenses. Adjouavi did not go to school. She makes "bouillie" (a type of gruel made from corn starch and sugar) which she has been selling for 12 years in the Hindé district. She gets her supplies in Cotonou. She is an old customer of ALIDé, having already had four loans; all these loans have been repaid on time. Adjouavi wants to increase her sales volume and her customer base; for this reason she is seeking financial help from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and sugar

loans.name: Ena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ena del Rosario L. B. es una mejer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada. Ella inicio vendiéndole frescos y gaseosas con una tía, luego con la ayuda de su suegra quien le regalo el carretón, el termo, los baldes, la refrigeradora y materia prima para poner su propio negocio.  Es así que desde hace ocho años inicio su negocio el cual ha ido creciendo actualmente ella invertirá en azúcar, frutas, baldes y azúcar.
 
L. como muchas mujeres nicaragüenses quienes por situaciones económicas no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria y sus padres pues le proporcionan algún oficio, ella prendió el arte de hacer joyas es decir es orfebre actividad que realizo hasta que por la situación económica busco otro manera de sobre vivir. En la actualidad ella sueña con poder estudiar alguna carrera técnica aunque  su sueño es estudiar derechos internacionales.
texts.en:
Ena del Rosario L. Bermudez is a strong woman, a hard worker, and an entrepreneur. She started selling fruit drinks and soft drinks with an aunt, later with the help of her mother-in-law, who gave her a cart, thermos, buckets, a refrigerator, and the raw materials to make her own business. The business began eight years ago, and it has continued growing. Now, L. will invest in sugar, fruits, buckets, and ice. L., like many other Nicaraguan women who could not study in a university for economic reasons and whose parents supply them a trade, took to the art of making jewelry. She worked as a gold and silver smith until the economic situation forced her to find another livelihood. Presently, she dreams of studying a technical career although her dream is to study international law.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, fruit, buckets, and ice

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es carpintero y elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, trabaja en una carpintería como empleado asalariado.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa El carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra Herramientas (taladro, martillos, desarmadores, etc.) para realizar arreglos y trabajos independientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con el primer crédito pudo comprarse una herramienta manual.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a carpenter and he makes furniture of all types and also does general carpentry. He works in a carpenter shop as a wage-earning employee. His residence is located in the Villa el Carmen zone of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase tools (a drill, hammers, screwdrivers, etc.) to carry out carpentry work and independent work and to improve his income. This is the second time that he has requested a loan from Impro. With the first loan he bought a hand tool.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools such as a drill, hammers, and screwdrivers for use in his carpentry work.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products and also planting and selling different kinds of vegetable in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her shop. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa I. is from the village of Labakid. She is 41 years old. Adelfa is married and has five children; three of them are still studying while the other two are already married. To make a living, Adelfa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Adelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou S., 27, is married and lives with two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer, while her husband works in construction. They both make $3 (US) of profit a day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sou S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $900 to purchase fertilizer. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 43 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 Philippine pesos (PHP) upon selling an adult animal.

In 2009, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gulnaaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaaz belongs to a city called Lahore which is famous for its gardens. She lives in a three room brick house with her family in the area of Mughalpura. 
She is a working woman who sells clothes to financially assist her family. She purchase clothes from wholesale markets of Lahore named with “Ichra & AnarkA.” and sells to her neighboring clients and to her nearby market. She is doing this business for the last 10 years and earns a reasonable amount of income every month. 

Her husband works in Pakistan railways and drives an auto rickshaw after his office job. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son left his education after completing 12th standard and started work. He works in a private company on monthly wage. Her daughter is 14 years old and studying in 9th standard. 

Gulnaaz has applied for a loan for the third time from Kiva partner, Asasah  for her cloth selling business. With the loan amount she will buy clothes in bulk quantity which will help her in increasing her income.  In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Gulnaaz.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Michael M.w.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Feredugu R.C. Primary School. This school was founded on the 9th of September 1960 by the Catholic Mission to foster education in the Chiefdom. Currently, the school is staffed with eight teachers and has 400 pupils. 

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Michael M.W. D. (who is sitting in front) is their leader and headmaster at the school. The fifty-eight-year-old Michael was born in Kambia, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty-eight years now. He is married to a teacher and they have eight children - two are in secondary school and one is in college; the rest are now grown-ups and living on their own.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mr. D., leader of this group, has requested this loan in order to construct a dwelling for his family. “This loan will ease some of my difficulties,” said Mr. D., “and will be a great development aid for my family,” he concluded.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials for the construction of a family home

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en:
Yesenia is a 37-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband and children in Ipis, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. A dedicated mother and businesswoman, Yesenia is originally from Nicaragua. When she first arrived in Costa Rica, she was looking for work cleaning houses. Over time, she started a family and became a naturalized Costa Rican citizen. Now, Yesenia runs a business selling plastic products such as garbage bins, baskets, tubs, soap dishes and toothbrushes. 

Yesenia travels throughout her community in order to sell her products to neighbors, acquaintances and family members. She offers her clients a catalogue full of items she sells. Yesenia then collects and places the orders. When she receives the products, she makes deliveries. She also maintains an inventory of products she knows to be popular. She hopes to use this loan to invest in various plastic products in preparation for the Christmas season, when she expects to experience an upsurge in demand for her products. Recently, her main obstacle has been a lack of working capital, necessary to make investments in inventory. 

In general, Yesenia carries out the domestic responsibilities of cooking and cleaning the house in the mornings. In the afternoons, she dedicates her time to her business, making sales, purchasing inventory or collecting repayments. A long-term goal for Yesenia is to one day own a centralized location where her clients would be able to peruse the various items she has for sale.

loans.use: To purchase plastic household products.

loans.name: Yadira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yadira De Los Ángeles tiene 48 años, su actividad es una librería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable ya que es la primera vez que realizara créditos con la Fundación, ella es muy trabajadora porque la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitarle los diferentes productos que ella proporciona. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como cuadernos, lápices, reglas, borradores, hojas y otras cosas.
texts.en: Yadira De Los Ángeles is 48 years old. Her business is a stationary supplies and book store. She has had this business for more than 6 years. She is a very responsible person and this is the first time she has had a loan with the Foundation. She is very hardworking and the majority of her clients come to request the different products that she offers. She is requesting the loan so she can buy materials such as notebooks, pencils, rulers, erasers, paper, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Férmina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fémina    tiene 4 hijos   en edad escolar.
Ella   tiene una pequeña despensa en el km 7 Ciudad Nueva, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.

Hoy día el es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como: harina, fideos, arroz, carne, panificados, enlatados.
texts.en:
Sra. Férmina has four school age children. She has a small food pantry along Km. 7 in Ciudad Nueva. Her sales continue to increase, allowing her to generate a good income. With the help of her husband and her entire family, she has been able to move forward with great sacrifice and effort.

Today she is a successful businesswoman with many loyal customers because of her kindness. Férmina has demonstrated that she is a responsible and honest person with her commitments, so she has been provided with the necessary support.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise for her food pantry such as flour, noodles, rice, meat, baked goods, and canned goods.

loans.use: Purchase  flour, noodles, rice, meat, baked goods, and canned goods

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema Z. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is currently in school. Rehema has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 2 years, where she sells food.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a fridge. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Rehema hopes to own a motor cycle. Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by knowing how to work hard.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio D. taller D. bordados D. imágenes, ella borda diferentes imágenes para los diferentes santos y también para las diferentes fiestas que existe en la ciudad D. Cusco, la socia lo realiza por pedido, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el taller D. bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos y telas.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la crianza D. cuyes, para la futura venta, venta D. pasto D. manera ambulatoria,  dos socias son cosmetologas, otra D. ellas tiene un snack cafetería y otro socio una carpintería. Todos los socios reinvertirán en sus negocios, como parte D. capital D. trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota D. manera responsable.
texts.en:
These people belong to the 'Progresando' (Making Progress) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Sabina is 53 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  Her business is a workshop where she embroiders pictures.  She embroiders images of different saints and also embroiders images for the different fiestas in the city of Cusco.  She does her work to order and would like to expand and improve her workshop.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials such as threads and fabrics.

The other members of the group work raising guinea pigs to sell, selling fodder as an itinerant salesperson, two of the members are cosmetologists, another has a café / snack bar and another is a carpenter.  All the group's members will reinvest in their businesses as working capital. 

Sabina is grateful for the loan and she pledges to make her repayments responsibly.

loans.use: To buy materials such as threads and fabrics

loans.name: Mitai

texts.en:
Mitai P. I. is 53, married, and has six children.  She owns a business venture, selling BBQ (sausage, chicken, and plantains).  Mitai has one year of experience in this business.  Mitai needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates, utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Mitai joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Mitai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates, utensils, and coal

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Calixto vive en casa de su sobrina en la zona  El Progreso, de la ciudad de  El Alto, es casado y tiene tres hijos, el señor es Artesano- Carpintero  y su esposa es artesana, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen, es el primer crédito en IMPRO  también con KIVA.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de madera Nogal, muy buena madera para la fabricación de muebles y productos artesanales de madera.
texts.en:
Calixto lives in his niece's home in the El Progreso zone of the city of El Alto. He is married and has three children. He is a craftsman-carpenter and his wife is a craftswoman. They support themselves with their incomes. This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

He will use this loan for the purchase of Nogal wood, which is a very good wood for making furniture and wooden craft products.

loans.use: the purchase of Nogal wood for furniture and craft products.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married, and has 5 children.

In 2006, Jawad decided to open his own business so he opened a food market in the area where he lives. He is becoming well-known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install an external ceiling, redecorate his shop and buy a generator. He is aiming to have his business grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Install an external ceiling, redecorate his shop, and buy a generator

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
K. Abdu lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her siblings. 

Abdu has a business making and selling bricks.  She has been in this business for nearly ten years, and works 7 days out of every week. Abdu sells her products from home.  She also generates additional income through plaiting hair.

Abdu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more firewood. Her goal is for her business to grow well. 

Abdu lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more  firewood

loans.name: Meti

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Meti G. 29 let. Meti uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata kotoriy toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: This young man is married and has a child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved wife and child.  Meti G. is 29 years old.  He has been working as a herdsman for seven years. Currently, he needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to expand his business.  He started this business with his older brother who is also a herdsman.

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Mil's Group

texts.en:
There are ten members making up this village bank loan. Mrs. Mil is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group loan will use their money to support their different purpose. 
Mil was born in 1975.  She is a widow with two children: one is a farmer and the other attends a local school. Mil is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and corn for a living. She wants to grow corn in the dry season, but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for cultivating corn.

loans.use: to cultivate corn

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 31 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa; esta casada con Elmer 36 años de edad y tienen 04 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Gloria y su pareja Elmer son el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Gloria es campesina y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, barbasco y hojas de coca plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 11 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old and originally from the District of Santa Rosa. She is married to Elmer, age 36, and they have four children. Gloria and her family live in their own home in the community of Pampa Miraflores, an annex of the District of Santa Rosa. Gloria and her partner Elmer are the breadwinners of their family. When she was a young girl, her parents taught her how to work in the fields. Gloria is a farmer and has four hectares of land on which she grows coffee, barbasco, and coca leaves since these plants are native to the rain forest zone of the Apurimac River Valley. She has been working on her land for eleven years. During the harvest season, she has the help of her children and the labor of workers who can gather fruit very rapidly. What he enjoys most about her job is harvesting her crops because she feels the months of hard work are rewarded with the quality of her output. She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the field to the collection centers located in the city of San Francisco. These places offer the best prices for her products. Her main challenge is not having sufficient income to pay her workers in advance so that they can help her with the harvest. For this reason, she is accessing the loans provided by MFP. Her priority at the moment is to plant more coffee since she has one hectare of land that remains uncultivated.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Gloria feels the loan will be a great help in advancing her business. In her Communal Bank, she is well-respected by the other members. The loan of 1000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.use: To hire workers to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Daynor

texts.es: El señor Daynor es chofer y tiene una movilidad de transporte de pasajeros y su esposa es comerciante; con las actividades que ambos realizan cubren los gastos que tiene. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo, pues el que ahora está instalado en su vehiculo ha comenzado a fallar y esto es peligroso por el hecho de que transporta pasajeros. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  de Achachicala de la ciudad De La Paz, es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Daynor is a driver with his own vehicle for transporting passengers; his wife is a storekeeper. The work they both do covers their expenses.
Daynor needs the loan to buy a new motor because the one in his car now has started to break down, making it dangerous to transport passengers.
Daynor lives in a rental located in the Achachicala district of the city of La Paz. He and his wife have one child. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his transportation vehicle

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia Estela tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos, vigoron, cosa de horno. La ubicación de su negocio es cerca del parque central. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, inicio este medio de vida con mucho esfuerzo pues ha sido muy difícil, ya que algunas veces no vende todos sus productos. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que disfruta de conversar con sus clientes. Tiene2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que siempre está pendiente de brindarles lo más necesarios.  El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cacao, leche, chica, tiste, pinolillo, yuca, enchiladas, chingaste, hielo entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Sonia Estela, age 40, makes her living selling refreshments, "vigoron" (a traditional cassava-based dish), and "cosa de horno" (a cornbread-like baked food) -- her business is located near the central park. Sonia has been in this line of work for over six years; it took a lot of effort to get started, and it has been very difficult given that sometimes she is unable to sell all her products.  

Sonia is a very hardworking woman who enjoys talking to her clients. She has two young children in her care, and she is always focused on bringing them everything that they need. Sonia is asking for a loan to purchase cacao, milk, pinolillo (a corn-based product), cassava, ice, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase cacao, milk, cassava, enchiladas, ice, etc

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
María Trinidad es madre trabajadora de 30  años de edad esta casada y  vive en casa propia con 4 hijos que dependen de ella y su esposo. Ellos viven en el caserío Monte Grande (comunidad rural de condición baja y en pleno desarrollo), ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en Lambayeque.

María Trinidad se dedica a la venta de pan, el cual elabora (artesanalmente) y  comercializa todas las tardes en la ciudad de Mórrope. Maria Trinidad vende el pan en el centro de la ciudad y cuenta con una clientela establecida.  Su esposo también se dedica a la venta de panes.

María Trinidad solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de insumos como manteca y harina, para la elaboración de sus panes. Puesto que su demanda ha aumentado.

María Trinidad y su esposo tienen muchos deseos de superación y esperan algún día abrir su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Maria Trinidad is a hardworking mother.  She is 30 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her four dependent children and her husband.  They reside in the village of Monte Grande, a rural lower-class community that is in a development stage, which is located five minutes away from the city of Mórrope in Lambayeque.  

Maria Trinidad sells bread that she prepares by hand.  She sells her products every afternoon in the city of Mórrope.  Maria Trinidad sells her bread in the central part of the city and has an established customer base.  Her husband is also responsible for selling the bread.  

Maria Trinidad is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.  The funds will be used to buy supplies, such as butter and flour, for making her bread.  The demand for her goods has increased.

Maria Trinidad and her husband have tremendous desire to succeed and hope to open their own bakery some day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for baking.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisca tiene 58 años, su actividad es la venta de artesanía y cerámica. Tiene más de 20 años en este negocio, inició hace veinte años cuando no encontraba empleo y anteriormente su familia tenía a cargo el negocio, pero fue con el paso del tiempo que decide establecer su propio establecimiento, Maria aprovechó su punto de venta para ofrecer las mercancías más solicitadas por su clientela y con ello ha ganado mucha aceptación en su barrio. Este crédito es para la compra de pintura, lija, barro, pinceles y otros productos, preparándose para la celebración del día de la madre, pues le han hecho pedidos para esta fecha. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio logrando todos los días nuevos clientes, para aumentar sus ingresos y sacar a su hijo adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca, age 58, sells crafts and ceramics.  She started her business over 20 years ago when she was unable to find a job and her family was running the business.  With time she decided to set up her own establishment.  Maria took advantage of the sales point to offer goods that were in more demand by her customers, thus gaining significant acceptance in the neighborhood.  

This loan is to buy paint, sandpaper, clay, paintbrushes and other products, in preparation for Mother's Day, since she has already received orders for this date.  Her dream is to expand her business and reach new customers so she can increase income and help her son get ahead.

loans.use: To buy paint, sandpaper, clay, and paintbrushes for her craft business.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena, a married woman with one child who attends school, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport for her child attending school.

For the past four years, Lena has operated a curio-selling shop near the coastal beaches to attract tourists who are her potential customers. Lena's major challenge is seasonality. Peak season for her business extends from July to December, when tourists are in Mombasa for holidays; low season is from January to May. Lena dreams of establishing another curio shop in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Lena is now requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to purchase windows and doors to complete her house.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors to complete her house.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 32 years old, married and supports a family of four. He has been in the farming business for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 5,000. With his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, he plans to purchase farm supplies for his family farm. This will help in timely land preparation. Nicholas' future plans are to continue with farming and improve his family's living standards economically.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 24 años de edad, posee una sastrería en su vivienda, aprendió la costura en un taller que impartió clases de corte y confección, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00am a 6:00pm, más que todo cuando tiene bastante trabajo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en material telas de varias clases y colores, accesorios para la ropa (botones, ciper, broches) también algunos repuestos para las maquinas, con este financiamiento cubrirá la necesidad que tiene en el negocio y abarcar mayor la demanda.
Su principal objetivo es crecer con el negocio, ser auto sostenible, logrando independizarse de los préstamos para obtener una mejor ganancia y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Natividad lives with her husband and 24-year old son. She has a sewing business which she runs from her house. She learned about sewing in a dressmaking workshop. Natividad’s hours of work are from 7am to 6pm, and even longer when she has a lot of orders.

She is seeking a loan so she can buy different kinds of material in a range of colours, and notions such as buttons, zippers, and snap fasteners. She also needs spare parts for her sewing machines. With the loan money she will be able to buy what is needed for her business and better respond to her customers’ requests.

Natividad’s main goals are to expand her business, be self-sufficient, and succeed in paying off her loans so that she can earn more money and help her family.

loans.use: to buy material and notions such as buttons, zippers, and snap fasteners

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the "God Help" group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek  a loan of 800,000 Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Thereza is the leader of this group. She is 29 years old and single with one child who is attending primary school. Thereza sells firewood, charcoal, and palm oil. She has been running this business for six years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy some gallons of palm oil and a large quantity of charcoal to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and charcoal to add to her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like school supplies, jewelry, and decorations to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from hog-raising.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like school supplies, jewelry, and decorations to sell.

loans.name: Songama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Le groupe est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Rohetou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de bananes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Songama solidarity group was created on June 12, 2008. It consists of 15 women from the same neighborhood who mainly conduct small trade.

Mrs Rohetou, standing on the right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of two other children that their parents entrusted to her care. She sells bananas. After several years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to increase her working capital and develop her business. The profit from her activity will enable her to improve the living standard of her family (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and save more money.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Ngom

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui cultive du mil, de l'arachide et fait du maraichage.Il dispose de huit hectares qu'il exploite et dont une bonne partie de la récolte est destinée à la nourriture de sa famille qui est très large.Pour financer son activité d'agriculture, il pratique l'embouche bovine qui lui rapporte des revenus assez substanciels.Ainsi, il sollicite un pret de 150000F à l'UIMCEC pour acheter une vache qui sera engraissée et vendu au bout de quelques mois. Sona ambition est de creuser un puits foraghe dans ses chammps pour avoir de l'eau et faire du maraichage.
texts.en: The borrower is a peasant farmer who cultivates millet and groundnuts and does market gardening. He has at his disposal eight hectares that he cultivates and a large part of his harvest is used to feed his big family. To finance his agricultural activity he fattens cattle which brings in a fairly substantial income. Thus he requests a loan of 150000F from the UIMCEC to buy a cow which will be fattened up and sold in a few months. His ambition is to dig a well in his fields so that he can have water there and to do market gardening.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, a 39-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and spices including garlic and onions for the last seven years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy more snacks, beverages and spices. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.
 .

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & spices.

loans.name: Jennyruth

texts.en:
JennyRuth is 43-years-old and lives in Burgos St. Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is a widow with 3 school-age children. 

JennyRuth has a general store business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store.

JennyRuth has been a member of PMPC for 4 year. In the future, JennyRuth hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old, married, and blessed with one child.  To earn a living, he offers transport services.  He uses his cart to transport water, eggs and vegetables to specific customers.  He has engaged in the business for seven years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on savings and business management.  This has helped him to improve his business.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy another cart.

loans.use: To buy another cart.

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es: Juaquina tiene 39 años, es natural del pueblo de Santa fe, ahí vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Máximo de 50 años y de sus 03 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Juaquina, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende arroz azúcar, galletas, detergentes, entre otros. Es así que desde muy temprano se levanta para poder atender a sus clientes, asimismo agrega que empezó hace 02 años con este negocio, y asegura que le va bien con las ventas que realiza. Se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, por que gracias a ello sustenta los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Con el tiempo desea comprar un terreno por su localidad y así como comprar más víveres para implementar su bodega. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete seguir aportando sus cuotas puntualmente con los anteriores créditos. Agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por elegirle como presidente de la junta directiva. Con el préstamo solicitado de 2,000 nuevos comprará un terreno en su localidad e incrementar más productos para implementar su negocio como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, productos enlatados.
texts.en: Juaquina is 39 years old and she is originally from the village of Santa Fe. She lives there in her own home together with her husband, Maximo, who is 50 years old, and their 3 children. They are the reason for her efforts. Juaquina is a very hardworking woman and she has a small grocery store from where she sells rice, sugar, cookies, detergents, and other products. She starts her days very early in the morning to be able to attend to her clients. She adds that she has been in business for 2 years and she assures us that her sales are doing very well. She is very happy with her work, especially because this is how she is able to cover the educational fees of her beloved children. In time she wants to purchase a plot of land in her community and to purchase more products to supply her store. This will be her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to keep making her payments on time as she has with the previous loans. She is thankful to the members of her communal bank for electing her as the president of the board of directors. With the loan she requests, amounting to 2000 nuevos soles, she will purchase a plot of land in hr community and she will buy more products to supply her business, including: sacks of rice, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.name: Ana Carola

texts.es: La señora Carola se dedica a trabajar como camarógrafa y fotógrafa de acontecimientos sociales ( matrimonios y cumpleaños principalmente ) donde ofrece sus servicios, tanto de fotografía como de filmaciones de dichos acontecimientos se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace tres años y ya que los clientes le solicitan fotos de mejor calidad la señora vio como necesidad urgente la adquisición de dicha herramienta de trabajo razón por la cual solicito el crédito para una cámara profesional, ella es una persona joven y trabajadora, su deseo es poder tener su propio estudio fotográfico donde pueda ofrecer sus servicios a muchos mas clientes, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Carola works as a videographer and photographer at social events (mostly weddings and birthdays) where she offers her services. She has been producing event photos and films for three years. Since her customers are requesting photos of better quality, Sra. Carola urgently needs to acquire equipment for her work.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan for a professional camera. Carola is a hardworking young person. Her wish is to have her own photography studio where she can provide her services to many more customers. She is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a nurse, his elder daughter is a student and his younger one goes to kindergarten.

Bayarmagnai started his transportation business in 2001 with his own van. Since he is very experienced and his van is very convenient, he has many regular customers. Bayarmagnai is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to service his van since it is having some technical problems. Bayarmagnai is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I do everything I can to make my customers comfortable."

loans.use: To service his van

loans.name: Glenda Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Glenda tiene 29 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos.

Ella ya tiene 4 años que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo desde la edad de 16 años. Los productos que necesita para su actividad las compran en una ciudad que esta a treinta minutos del lugar donde vive.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 10 cerdos pequeños, para engordarlos y venderlos cuando ya estén listos. Con el acceso al préstamo ella comprara más cantidad de cerdos y alimento para engordarlos en mayores cantidades para que el precio sea bajo.

Glenda necesita tener más cerdos, ya que la demanda no esta siendo satisfecha, por que le buscan y ella no tiene suficiente y si los compra a buen precio, ella los venderá mejor y recibirá mejores ganancias. Ella desea contar con una granja de cerdos, donde pueda satisfacer la demanda y tener ingresos suficientes para ahorrar y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Glenda is 29 years old and has two children.  She has been raising pigs for four years.  Her parents taught her this work when she was 16.  She buys the products that she needs for her business in a town which is 30 minutes away from where she lives.

Glenda will invest this loan in buying 10 piglets to fatten and then sell when they are ready.  With this loan she will buy more pigs and also larger quantities of feed with which to fatten them so that she receives a low price.

Glenda needs to have more pigs as demand is not being satisfied.  People look to buy from her but she does not have enough.  If she buys at a good price, she will make better sales and better profits.  Glenda would like to have a pig farm where she can meet demand and make enough income to save up and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia Maritza; La socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 2 hijos ; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de carteras,ella confecciona las carteras y lo vende en una tienda en un centro comercial,la socia tambien vende productos de belleza como perfumes y cremas por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de carteras y venta de productos de belleza . La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales, la socia comprara cueros de colores, hebillas, argollas, lazos, telas, gamuzas, cierres, botones y otros materiales y tambien para comprar cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Maritza, 48, is married and has two children.  She is a retailer.  She continues selling purses that she makes and then sells in a store in a shopping center.  She also sells beauty products like perfume and creams and is able to support her children through these businesses.  She wants to expand and improve the purse sales and the cosmetics sales so needs a loan to buy materials like leather in assorted colors, buckles, rings, ties, fabric, suede, zippers, buttons and other materials and also to buy creams, perfumes and lipstick at wholesale.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make purses and also to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a una pupuseria, vive con su familia, lleva seis años en el negocio cuenta con varios clientes y ella depende económicamente de esta actividad. Actualmente necesita comprar gas por mayoreo y maíz además de unos ingredientes para el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para realizar las diferentes compras y mantener en su negocio todo lo necesario para la producción y venta de las pupusas.
Su aspiración con respecto a préstamo ejercer una buena inversión que le permita desarrollarse, pagando puntualmente las cuotas y al final que sus ventas mejoren.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her family and she runs a pupuseria (a shop selling 'pupusas', a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick, hand-made corn tortilla filled with a blend of either cheese, vegetables or meat). She has been engaged in this activity for 6 years, she has many customers and she economically depends on this activity. She currently needs to buy gas at wholesale price and some ingredients for her shop, and she is requesting a loan to invest it in different purchases to stock up her shop with everything she needs to produce and sell pupusas.
From the loan she expects it to be a good investment that will help her improving  herself, she expects to punctually pay her dues; finally she hopes that her sales will increase.

loans.use: To buy gas at wholesale price and maize.

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es: El señor José Alcides a sus 32 años de edad es padre de cuatro hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, debido a dificultades y problemas familiares, hace seis meses se separó de su esposa y actualmente cada uno tiene a su cargo dos hijos, es por esto que a el señor José Alcides le toca ser madre y padre a la vez de dos de sus cuatro hijos, debido a esto requiere de trabajar arduamente para conseguir los ingresos para el sustento familiar trabajando ordeñando vacas en una finca cerca de su vivienda en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral ubicado al oriente de Antioquia y adicionalmente en su finca produciendo leche con dos vacas lecheras que tiene. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos el señor José Alcides necesita comprar otra vaca lechera para incrementar así la producción de leche y con esto sus ingresos y bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: José Alcides, 32, is the father of four children who are 11, 9, 7 and 4 years of age.  Due to family problems and other difficulties he separated from his wife six months ago and each parent currently cares for two of the children.  As a result of this, José Alcides now must be both mother and father to two of his four children.  Because of this, he needs to work hard to earn income to support his family  milking cows in a farm near his house in the township of Carmen de Viboral located in east Antioquia and additionally on his farm producing milk from the two cows he owns.  In hopes of improving his income, José Alcides needs to buy another cow to increase milk production and with it his income for his children’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is a 38-year-old farmer. He lives in the village of Nabakhtevi with his family: his wife Marine and three children (10, 8 and 5 years old). The children go to school. Nikoloz and Marine are busy with family agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows. Marine produces cheese. Also they own 4 hectares of land, which is used for wheat, maize and haricot growing. They sell harvested products, as well as home-made cheese locally. 

Nikoloz requested credit for purchasing a mini-bus, which will be used for selling their products. Nikoloz will be able to sell products in nearby villages for a higher price. Also, when he has a mini-bus he will sell additional greengrocery products, purchased from neighboring farmers. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to spend more on their children’s education, as well as purchasing other household goods to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus to use for selling greengrocery products.

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es: Pedro de 66 años de edad y de estado civil viudo, es un hombre que se dedica a la fabricación de calzado para damas en materiales de cuero y también en sintético. Pedro inició su negocio en el año 2008,  una vez se capacitó en marroquinería, donde aprendió todas las étnicas para trabajar con el cuero y todos sus derivados logrando desarrollar su idea emprendedora.  Así fue como decidió identificar una línea en la cual lanzarse al mercado y esta fue  las sandalias femeninas e infantiles, las cuales distribuye a través de su hija en la ciudad de Cali y también fabrica botas que  comercializa en la capital de Colombia, Bogotá y que gozan de mucha aceptación entre sus clientes ubicados en almacenes aledaños,  a quienes vista para ofrecerles sus productos. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es insuficiente, porque su clientela crece y quiere ser siempre oportuno; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas, como cueros e insumos como hebillas, pegantes, para fabricar nuevos diseños e impactar a su clientela, que siempre espera de Pedro,   lindos modelos para comprarle.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 66 year old widower.  He makes women’s shoes using leather and synthetics.  Pedro started his business in 2008.  Once he was trained in leatherwork, and he learned all of the skills for working with leather and it derivatives.  He managed to develop his entrepreneurial idea.  That is how he decided to select a line to launch in the market.  This line was children’s and women’s sandals.  

He distributes them through his daughter in the city of Cali.  He also makes boots that he sells in the capital of Colombia, Bogotá.  He enjoys great acceptance from his customers in the surrounding stores.  He visits them to offer his products.

He currently does not have sufficient working capital.  His customers increase, and he needs to always respond quickly.  That is why he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy raw materials like leather and supplies like buckles and glue to make new designs and to have an impact on his customers.  They always expect to buy beautiful styles from Pedro.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like leather and supplies like buckles and glue.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 58 years old and married. She has ten children.
