She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Akenese needs a loan to expand her business.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Akenese will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy oil, a frying pan, plastic bags and salt.

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 48 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Joji has a bread retailing business in the Philippines. Joji requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bread to offer for sale.

Joji has been in this business for five years. In the future, Joji would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread to offer for sale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando has 4 years of experience in the food market business. He started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but he has now included many different products into his store. He is seeking a loan in order to begin selling gas tanks. He sees a major business opportunity in his neighborhood because there is not anyone who provides the gas necessary for kitchens. In poor sectors almost everyone uses stove ovens because they are cheaper and most cost efficient. Fernando is confident that with this investment he will be able to make a big difference in the lives of his 3 kids. One of them has already exceeded local expectations by attending college. Fernando hopes that he will be able to provide for the full education of his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Begin selling propane gas tanks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jerusha intends to buy hybrid maize seeds, fertilizers and beans for planting

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en:
Ramón lives in Santa Catarina. He is married with four children, and has always like being a businessman. For 15 years, he has worked selling fruits and vegetables, starting with very little merchandise. Little by little, he made his business grow, and now he goes out to sell in small places located on the outskirts of the city where he has been able to gain many customers.

Ramón is a very responsible, honest man, and now requires a loan of $1,100 which he will use to purchase merchandise to continue growing his business. He is committed to returning this amount in a period of 6 to 12 months. This is important for the growth of this business, and will help improve the life of this family. You can help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catarina es donde vive Ramón, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, siempre le ha gustado ser comerciante y desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, comenzó con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco hizo creer su negocio, ahora sale a vender a las localidades pequeñas que se ubican en la afueras de la ciudad donde ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

Ramón es un hombre muy responsable y honesto, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, tú puedes hacerlo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Mrs. Joaquina G. V. is 39 years old, single, and has 2 sons, 22 and 19 years old. The eldest son is currently studying in a local university, while the other one is finishing high school. Mrs. Joaquina is currently working as the main cook and as a fresh fish saleswoman in a co-owned restaurant near the Paraguay River. She has been in the business for over a year now, and the business is slowly growing. Mrs. Joaquina says that the restaurant is more decorated now, and she attends to more customers, including a defined lunch-time clientele. The restaurant's clientele mostly consists of people with a refined taste for fish from around the city. People from the city's surrounding areas also frequent her restaurant.    
Mrs. Joaquina is asking for a loan of US$400 to be able to fish better by acquiring better fishing materials. She plans on investing in a new canoe as well as a new net. Likewise, she plans to spend some of the money for buying fish such as the surubí and dorado that are very popular among her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of a new canoe as well as materials for a new net

loans.name: Amelia Carlos

texts.pt:
Amelia is a single mother. She lives with her son, she is young and with the help of her parents she was able to re-open a store that had been abandoned during the war. She joined the FDM fund in 2006, her first loan was of 250$ to open the small grocery store. Now Amelia is requesting a loan of 1.050.00$ in order to increase her inventory. This loan will be repaid in 6 months. Because the business has been doing well she has been able to improve the diet of her family, she plans on making sure her son attends school and finding a husband to complete her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia e mae solteira. Vive com o seu filho. Jovem muito dinamica, com o seu trabalho e o apoio dos pais conseguiu reabilitar uma antiga loja abandonada durante o periodo da guerra na sua zona de origem. Ela entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006 , tendo tomado nessa altura $250 para investir na mercearia.Ela agora pretende tomar $1,050.00 para poder comprar produtos nos armazens para rechear a sua mercearia. Ela pretende devolver este emprestimo em 6 meses.Porque o negocio esta a correr bem ela melhorou a sua dieta alimentar principalmente a de seu filho. que e um rapazinho bonito e saudavel, pois que a mae consegue suprir todas as suas necessidades.Planos futuros sao; assegurar uma educacao de qualidade para o seu filho e se tudo correr bem encontrar um homem com que case e constitu familia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Julia Gladys

texts.es:
Julia is a very hardworking and persevering woman. These virtues have brought her continual success over the years like the construction and improvement of her home so that she may provide a better place for her four children to live together with her. In the years past she has always seen a way to obtain considerable economic income and support her husband who, though he always works, often does not receive enough money to cover the expenses of their household. She obtained work through a team formed by a club of mothers who together began raising guinea pigs and installing guinea pig habitats in various homes. Julia is already working independently thanks to her dedication to daily improvement. She has also increased her population of guinea pigs. This fills her with satisfaction and moves her towards reaching her future goal of becoming the best exporter of guinea pigs in her country. Additionally, she opened a little shop close to her home a month ago. All these efforts are done to secure a better future for her kids, who have motivated her to progress in life and they are the reason she’s working for a secure economic situation. To fulfill her longings Julia requests a loan to invest in better habitats for her guinea pigs and buy alfalfa for feeding them. Let’s support Julia in her work; she’s a mother who always longs for the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Edith and Jay of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Julia, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, estas virtudes la han llevado a lo largo de los años a conseguir logros en su vida como el de construir y mejorar las instalaciones de su casa, para poder darles un lugar mejor en donde vivir junto a sus 4 retoños. En años anteriores siempre ha visto la manera de obtener considerables ingresos económicos y apoyar a su esposo que siempre trabaja y muchas veces el dinero que percibe es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos que genera su hogar.Ella procuró realizar un trabajo en equipo al asociarse a un club de madres que la animaron y en conjunto comenzaron un ciclo de capacitación para instalar en varias casas sus criaderos de cuyes, en la actualidad Julia ya es independiente y gracias a su dedicación cada día mejora; ya que aumentó la población de cuyes que poseía.Esto la llena de satisfacción y la lleva a trazarse una meta a futuro para convertirse en la mejora exportadora de cuyes de su país, adicionalmente a esto hace un mes abrió una pequeña tienda cercana a su casa, todos estos esfuerzos lo hace para procurarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos que siempre la motivan a seguir adelante y es por ellos que va por la vía segura de la superación económica. Para poder cumplir sus anhelos Julia solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mejores ambientes para la comodidad de sus cuyes e invertir en la compra de alfalfa para su alimentación.Apoyemos a Julia en su labor de madre que siempre anhela lo mejor para su familia.

loans.use: Improve the habitats for raising guinea pigs and buy alfalfa to give them better nourishment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, whose main qualities are her politeness and determination to develop, is a committed and cheerful mother. For the past seven years she has been selling pumpkin juice with apples, on a small tricycle which her husband, Zenón, adapted for the sale of her juices. These juices are an appetising and nutricious product in this area of the country. Elizabeth begins the daily preparation of her nutricious nectars at 2am, in order to then sell her product in the Main Square of her small town, Macari. She wishes to purchase another tricycle and thus increase her sales area for the greater convenience of her busy customers. In addition to this task, Elizabeth and her husband dedicate their time to caring for their three small cows, work which they carry out with great care and dedication which means they will achieve favourable results. The loan which Elizabeth has requested will be invested in another tricycle and the purchase of a small calf, and with these two investments her family's economic situation will be improved further still.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva translator

Su cortesía y empeño por progresar son las características principales de doña Elizabeth, madre empeñosa y alegre que desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de jugo de quinua con manzana, en un pequeño triciclo que su esposo, Zenón, adecuó para la venta de sus jugos, producto muy apetitoso y nutritivo en esta zona de su país.Elizabeth empieza la preparación diaria de sus nutritivos néctares a partir de las 2:00 de la mañana, para luego venderlas en la plaza de armas de su pequeño pueblito, Macari. Tiene el deseo de comprar otro triciclo y así ampliar su puesto de venta para mayor comodidad de su concurrida clientela; adicionalmente a esta labor, Elizabeth y su esposo, se dedican al cuidado de sus tres vaquitas, faena que desempeñan con sumo cariño y dedicación y gracias al cual van obteniendo resultados favorables.La solicitud que hace doña Elizabeth los invertirá en adquirir otro triciclo y comprar otra becerrita, y con estas dos inversiones busca mejorar aún más su situación económica familiar.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle and a small calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia is a happy mother who's 27 years old. She has been buying and selling Andean products (i.e. potato & chuño which is a freeze dried potato) for about 5 years. She goes and sells these products from door to door. She has been able to help her husband pay for all the family expenses. Above all, they would like to finish building their house. Even though, there's been a lot of financial difficulties, they are bound to finish it with a lot of effort. Alicia's biggest wish is to provide a roof for her little son, Luis, who is 4 years old. A house where he can play freely, and due to this she's working very hard. To make her dream come true, Doña Alicia is thinking about increasing her merchandise and therefore increasing her profit. With this in mind, reach to your heart and help Doña Alicia make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alicia, es una madre muy alegre de 27 años de edad, desde hace cinco años viene dedicándose a la compra y venta de productos andinos (papa y chuño) en forma ambulatoria, negocio con el que apoya a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de su familia, y sobre todo para terminar el refaccionamiento de su casita que con mucho esfuerzo y a pesar de las limitaciones económicas fueron construyendo.El deseo más grande de Alicia es brindarle un techo propio y seguro a su pequeño niño, Luis de cuatro años, para que pueda jugar libremente. Con este fin sigue trabajando persistentemente en su oficio.Para concretar su anhelo doña Alicia tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería, con este propósito en mente recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la petición de un préstamo.Vuestro desinteresado apoyo permitirá concretar los planes de Doña Alicia.

loans.use: To increase merchandise and variety of Andean products

loans.name: Nabwike

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Nabwike S.. In 2006 Nabwike established a poultry business, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku,’ you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital; you can start with 1 or 2 and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals or prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero I. is a strong woman. She lives in Benin City, where she sells cooked food, provisions and drinks to people in her community. She has been in this business since 2005. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Mrs.I. is requesting a loan of $450 so she can buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: To buy more provision and drinks for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B.  is a manufacturer of a local Gin (drink). He is married and has 3 children. Business is doing very well but he wishes to increase production and  sales.  

He is asking for additional capital to buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production of a local drink.

loans.name: Fridolin

texts.fr:
Mr. Fridolin K. is 60 years old, married, and the father of four children. To earn money he farms yams and pineapples in a field in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He barely meets the needs of his family because arable land is becoming scarcer and less fertile. With this loan, Fridolin hopes to buy tools and fertilizer to better farm his field and increase his yield. With income from his work he can improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Fridolin K. est âgé de 60 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, il cultive les ignames et les ananas dans un champ à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Il subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Avec ce crédit, Fridolin espère acheter l’équipement et l’engrais pour mieux cultiver son champ et augmenter sa production. Par les revenus de son activité, il peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase tools and fertilizer to better farm his field

loans.name: Antonio Luis

texts.es:
Luis Antonia has three children, two sons and a daughter whose ages are 22, 18 and 15, respectively. The house where they currently live is rented from another person. Luis works painting houses, apartments, etc. He also works in brick masonry, plumbing and electrical work, as well as a waiter with his wife who runs a catering service for various occasions. There is competition in his different fields of work; nonetheless, his advantage is that he has a firm client base and well as working with a friend of his who is an architect that requires his services. Luis is characterized by the quality of his work as well as his punctuality. With his current loan he will buy paint, paint thinner, and paint brushes to paint an entire two-story house. Luis responsibly makes his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Antonio tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son varones y una mujer, sus edades son de 22, 18 y 15 años respectivamente. La vivienda donde actualmente viven la alquilan de una tercera persona. Luis se dedica al pintado de casas, departamentos, etc. También ofrece sus servicios de albañilería, plomería, electricidad, también trabaja como garzón junto a su esposa que ofrece servicios de Bufett de comidas para diferentes ocasiones. Existe competencia en sus rubros, sin embargo su ventaja consiste en que tienen clientela consolidada, además que trabaja con un arquitecto (amigo) que requiere de sus servicios. Luis se caracteriza por la calidad y puntualidad en la oferta de sus servicios. Con la presente solicitud comprará pintura, thiner, brochas, etc., para pintar toda una casa de dos pisos. Luis cumple responsablemente con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
Señora María Zoila P. C. is 58 years old. She's a single mother. She didn't finish high school because she got engaged at an early age. She has a total of 6 children. Three are currently working and the other 3 are going to school. Her economic situation was not good to begin with so she started to do laundry (wash clothes by hand) of people she knew. She always wanted to start her own business but she never had the money to do so, but with this job she was able to save some money. She began by selling sandwiches and refreshments and some jewelry for gifts out of her house located in the district of San Pedro de Lloc in the state of La Libertad.

One of her friends recommended her to the Communal Bank called "La Libertad" and with the first loan she obtained she bought some jewelry (rings, necklaces, etc.)

She has been a partner with Manuela Ramos for about 6 years. She committs in paying this loan back within 6 months. She plans to purchase ingredients to make sandwiches and purchase refreshments (soda and beer). Her goal is to see her 3 kids graduate from school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Zoila P. C., tiene 58 años, es madre soltera, estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria no continuó estudiando porque se comprometió con un joven, tiene 06 hijos, 03 trabajan y 03 son estudiantes. Su situación económica no era muy buena por lo que Para ayudarse empezó lavando ropa a particulares, siempre pensaba en tener un negocio pero no tenía capital para hacerlo, con lo que pudo ahorrar de su trabajo se dedicó a la venta de tortas, gaseosa, cerveza y algunas joyas para regalos, en su casa en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Una amiga la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró joyas: sortijas, cadenitas, dijes. La socia viene trabajando seis años con Manuela Ramos y con el préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar adornos para la decoración de sus tortas, cerveza, gaseosa. Tiene como meta ver a sus tres hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make sandwiches and to purchase refreshments (soda and beer)

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La señora MERY, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA”, vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. chupetes elaborados a base D. frutas, gelatinas, bebidas D. la región como chicha D. maíz y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y sabores. Desarrolla el negocio en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360, lugar  donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará azúcar, frutas, bolsas para chupetes, vasos descartables, saborisantes para la preparación D. la gelatinas y gaseosas D. diversos tamaños, sabores y marcas,  para atender las exigencias D. los clientes.

Mery es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, cuenta con 39 años y tiene 1hija quien la apoya en el negocio. Hasta la fecha le va bien por el trato que da a los clientes. Desea, más adelante, tener una distribuidora D. chupetes.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the group called Luz y Esperanza, which means Light and Hope. She lives in San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. Mery has a business selling pacifiers which she makes from fruit and gelatin. She also sells various sodas and local drinks maD. from corn.

Mery started this business from her home at 360 Jr. Santa Eufracia, where she serves her customers every day, many of whom are her neighbors. With the loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy sugar, fruit, bags for the pacifiers, plastic cups, flavoring, and sodas of different flavors and brands to meet the demands of her customers.

Mery is a cheerful and enthusiastic woman, 39 years old with one daughter who helps her with the business. Up until now Mery has done well with her business because of her good customer service. In the future, she would like to have a distributor for the pacifiers to reach a wider market.

La señora MERY, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto "LUZ Y ESPERANZA", vive en la Región y Provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. chupetes elaborados a base D. frutas, gelatinas, bebidas D. la región como chicha D. maíz y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y sabores. Desarrolla el negocio en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Santa Eufracia Nº 360, lugar donD. diariamente acuden los clientes, que en su mayoría son vecinos D. su barrio. Con el préstamo D. S/ 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará azúcar, frutas, bolsas para chupetes, vasos descartables, saborisantes para la preparación D. la gelatinas y gaseosas D. diversos tamaños, sabores y marcas, para atender las exigencias D. los clientes. Mery es una mujer entusiasta y alegre, cuenta con 39 años y tiene 1hija quien la apoya en el negocio. Hasta la fecha le va bien por el trato que da a los clientes. Desea, más adelante, tener una distribuidora D. chupetes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUGAR, FRUIT, BAGS, DISPOSABLE CUPS AND SODAS TO BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep M., her husband, Mr. Toem Oeurn (shown at the left in the photo), and their four children live in Chroy Ambel Village in Kandal Province. He is a teacher and makes $30 per month. Three of their children are employed in different businesses while the youngest one is attending the local school.

Mrs. Tep M. owns a grocery store business with a lot of customers and demand. Since her business is going well, she would like to buy more grocery products to add to her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Thet Eng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Trapeang Reang Village in Kampong Cham Province make up this village bank and Mrs. Thet E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells grocery goods to the local villagers. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to meet the customers' demand.

Her husband, Mr. Oem Vibol, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Thet E. is 57 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the younger one is 13 years old and attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for re-sale

loans.name: Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Madame T. Dzigbodi est née le 8 juillet 1956 à Kpéte-Ele, une ville située à 145 Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est veuve et mère d’un (1) enfant.  Elle a pour activité le commerce de pagne dans le marché d’Agoè au nord de Lomé.  Avec dix ans d’expérience dans le domaine, elle connait bien ce commerce.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagne afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients et tirer de bon revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Dzigbodi T. was born on July 8, 1956 in Kpéte-Ele, a city that is 145 kilometers from Lomé city. She is a widow and has one child. She sells lengths of brightly colored African cloth in the Agoè market in the north of Lomé. With ten years of experience, she knows this business well. With this first loan, she will be able to purchase 10 pieces of cloth so that she can serve her clients and increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lengths of brightly colored African cloth

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe Santiago R. S. tiene la edad de 46 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la señora es comerciante de productos AVON desde hace diez años, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales estudian, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la condiciones de vida, para darle un hogar a sus hijos. Este señor trabaja  como talador (servicios de moto sierra) desde hace veinte años, con el apoyo de su esposa ha logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Con esta solicitud es la séptima la cual va seguir mejorando su vivienda, para eso tiene que comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, hierro entre otros para terminar su casa con las condiciones debida y segura para su familia
texts.en:
Señor Felipe Santiago R. S. is 46-years-old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who has sold Avon products for 10 years. They have two children, who are in school. Felipe's plans for the future are to increase his quality of living to give a home to his children. He has worked as a logger (offering chainsaw services) for 20 years. With the support of his wife, he has managed to construct part of his house. With this request, which is his seventh loan, he will continue improving his home. For this he has to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement, and iron, among other things, to finish his house with decent and safe conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish building his home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth J. is 55 years old and she is a widow with 8 children. She sells smoked fish, hawking the fish within her community. She hopes to expand her fish business. She is requesting for the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. sells fish. She hopes to expand this business by meeting the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Iyabo is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. She says, "Thanks" to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Huon's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members. Its leader, H., 41, has two children: both of them are attending school. She is married to Thy, 42, who is a local farmer, planting crops in a big field inherited from his parents. H. has been a local wine distiller since 2000. She always buys the paddy rice from farmers to stock her stall in bulk. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor.

To help meet the family's needs, H. is also raising piglets in her pigpen behind her house because the leftovers after distilling can be made into pig feed. Recently, H. plans to have another pigpen for her pig-raising so she is looking for a loan to buy more piglets for her pigpen.

The other four members are:

H., 46, who earns a living selling fish and is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for transport;

H., 35, who has a battery-recharging service and is taking out a loan to buy a motorbike for her business;

C., 29, who plants vegetables and is taking out a loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetables;

and P., 37, who owns a grocery store and is taking out a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for her store.

They are all living in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her pig pen

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Кароматов Нурулло проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 25 лет,не женат. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует на центральном рынке коврами. Опыт в данной сфере составляет семь лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы оплатить аренду за торговую точку. Это даст возможность работать без издержек. А кредит будет погашать в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurullo K. lives in the Gissar district. He is 25 years old and single. He is an entrepreneur and sells rugs at the central market. He has seven years of experience in this business. Nurullo plans to obtain this loan in order to pay for his retail outlet lease. This will enable him to work without expenses. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay rent

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Agée d’environ trente-cinq (35) ans, Mme Kokoè A. est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Très soucieuse du bien être de son foyer, elle entreprit très tôt la préparation et la vente du jus de caramel pour soulager les charges de son ménage, son mari étant sans emploi stable. Actuellement, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker les matières premières. Les revenus serviront au maintien et à la survie de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Kokoè A. is about 35 years old, married, and the mother of four. Very concerned about the well-being of her family, she soon started an enterprise, making and selling jus de caramel in order to alleviate household expenses, since her husband is without stable employment. Currently, she’s requesting financing to stock up on basic ingredients. The revenues will go toward caring for and the survival of her whole family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell "jus de caramel"

loans.name: Komlan Edouard

texts.fr: Monsieur A.  a appris la soudure, en 2004 il a ouvert son propre atelier de soudure qu’il a appelé «ETS TOUS UNIS ». Il fabrique des portes de maison, des grilles qu’il vend. Son matériel de travail est vétuste ce qui fait qu’il accuse parfois du retard dans l’exécution de son travail. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des outils de travail. Il est marié à une femme qui est  couturière, il est père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A. has learned how to weld. In 2004, he opened his own welding workshop he called "ETS TOUS UNIS". He makes doors and gates for homes and sells them. His equipment is dilapidated, which results in him appearing to be late sometimes in carrying out his work. He's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy work materials. He is married to a woman who is a dressmaker. He is the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work equipment and supplies

loans.name: Marl Nesly

texts.en: Marl Nesly R. is 25 years old. She is happily married with 2 children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver in their village. They both worked hard for the education and other primary needs of their children. Marl has been involved in a variety store business for almost a year. She wants to expand it further to generate a much higher income, enough to support their family needs. She is now applying for her third cycle loan from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She is looking forward to more improvements in her business from the assistance granted by the organization.

loans.use: To procure additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her locality. She serves local dishes like fufu from cassava, banku from corn dough, etc. She sells from morning till evening. Eva has been in business for three years. She buys foodstuffs such as cassava, maize, vegetables and other ingredients from surrounding towns.

Eva is 23 years old, married and has two sons. According to her, both are currently in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Suhum, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Eva works very hard to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff

loans.name: Donatile

texts.en: Donathile M. is a 33-year-old married mother of three children (ages 8, 7, and 1). She runs a small food business where she earns about 260,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month. Although this is her first loan with Vision Finance Company, she has managed to employ three people in her business. Donathile has run her business for two years now and is requesting a 500,000 FRW loan to buy juice, milk, and mayonnaise to help with her product offering.

loans.use: Buy juice, milk, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Rhelna

texts.en:
Rhelna R., a resident of the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental, is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rhelna owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main income is derived from the selling of "copras" or coconut fruit. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rhelna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase more products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Rhelna’s fourth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of sausages, bacon, hot dogs and chicken.

loans.name: Ángela Benita

texts.es:
Angela R. es una dama muy alegre que se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa desde hace cuatro años incursionando en este negocio con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesto por sus cuatro hijos los cuales debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias porque están estudiando.

Su establecimiento lo posee en el departamento de León y actualmente ha buscado la manera de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por lo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la ropa para su respectiva comercialización y de esta manera continuar en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Angela R. is a very happy woman, who has been selling clothing for 4 years. She is venturing into this business in order to earn a living. Her home is made up of her 4 children, for whom she must offer the necessary conditions, because they are studying. She owns her establishment in the department of León and presently, she is searching for a way to improve the conditions of her business. She has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase clothes for her own marketing, and in this way she will continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 38 years old and married. She was born in the province of Cagayan. She has 3 children: Carmina, 13 years old a sophomore high school student, Willie Jr., 10 years old a grade 5 pupil, Ella Mae, 8 years old, she is a grade 2 pupil, all of  them are enrolled in a public school in their village.

She juggles housework with running a small grocery store in her own house together with her husband in order to provide a good education for their children. She hopes that her children will become professionals someday.

Filomena is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy some non perishable goods and additional items to sell in order to gain her income and to improve her business. She promises to pay back the loan as scheduled and she is entirely grateful for the opportunity that KIVA lenders are providing for her in order to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con el progreso D. su familia, vive en su casa propia y su anhelo es que mantener su hogar tan unido como siempre. Se dedica en la administración D. dos autos, los cuales alquila a algunos transportistas D. pasajeros para que trabajen por el día en rutas cercanas al distrito donD. ella vive. Lleva 5 años en esta labor, por lo tanto sabe seleccionar muy cautelosamente a las personas que trabajan con sus autos. Lo bueno D. su trabajo es que no tiene que realizar ninguna actividad, sólo estar pendiente D. las rutas D. los carros, pero considera que el abuso D. los policías D. transito perjudican el normal funcionamiento D. sus vehículos y trata D. lidiar con ellos continuamente. Para un futuro cercano desea adquirir un carro adicional para incrementar sus ingresos e invertirlo en la educación D. sus hijas.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando responsablemente en sus pagos junto a su banco comunal, donD. la consideran como una D. las líderes del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados invertirá en la reparación D. las fallas mecánicas que presentan  sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Bertha is 50 years old. She is a hard-working woman who is committed to the progress of her family. She lives in her own house, and her wish is to keep her home as united as always. She manages two cars which she rents out to several passenger carriers so that they can work during the day in routes near the district where she lives. She has been working in this field for 5 years, for this reason she knows how to cautiously select the people who work with her cars. The good thing about her job is that she does not have to perform any activity, only to pay attention to the car routes, but she thinks that the abuse of the transit police is detrimental to the normal functioning of her vehicles and she tries to fight with them constantly. In the near future she would like to purchase an additional car to increase her income and to invest it in her children's education. This is her fourteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she promises to continue to work responsibly to make her payments, together with her communal bank, where she is considered to be a leader of the group. The thousand soles requested will be invested in repairing her vehicles' mechanical problems.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her cars

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M. is 49 years old. Her husband’s name is Ly Smael, age 52, and he is shown in the photo above. To earn a living, this couple owns decorating equipment which they rent it out to people who need to apply make up or decorate for their parties or other ceremonies. The family typically generates a revenue of US$8 each day and have been in their business for seven years.

Currently, Ly M. is running her service very well and has a lot of customers who recognize the good service she provides. She will use her loan to accumulate a larger quantity of her decorating materials in order to better satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of her decorating materials

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia owns a stall selling charcoal. She doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from her suppliers because she buys from the same place she works, on the outskirts of Kampala. On average, she serves 20 customers a day. Her challenges include defaulters and the rainy season because, when it rains, very few customers come for charcoal.

Sofia is a 35-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 2 and 10 years and she takes care of additional family members. All her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she lives with four people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Sofia has been in her business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years, now on her 17th loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is 42 years old and married with six children between the ages of eight and 27 years. Four of her children go to school. Vicky resides and rents a two bedroom house where she stays with five people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water at home. Vicky sells bitengi (African wears) and jewelry from the Democratic Republic Of Congo, which is her home country. Working seven days a week, Vicky sells to customers from all walks of life. On average she receives 25 customers per day. She has been in this business for seven years, working with the same group of people. Vicky has also been with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her fourteenth loan. She decided to join MCDT because it was near her home and also because she could obtain timely loans. Vicky would like to use this loan to buy more bitengi and jewelry. She aspires to see her business grow larger and to start selling exclusively on the wholesale market.

loans.use: To buy more jewerly and African wears.

loans.name: Willingness Group

texts.en: Seeta D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Willingness. She is 29 years old, a single mother of two children aged 3 and 6 with nursery and kindergarten iii education levels. She is a senior student in college but decided to get into business. Seeta lives and works on 16th Street, Sinkor, south of the Liberian capital Monrovia. Her business is the sale of drinks. She buys items like soft drinks and mineral water from producers and retails to residents of 16th Street, Sinkor. She has been running this business for 5 years, and hopes to expand to a larger shop in the future. Seeta sells at an ideal location and sells at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. She started by selling with 3,000 LRD that was given to her by her fiance. Seeta needs this loan to purchase more soft drinks to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and providing shelter for them.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to improve her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie K.. She is 45 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has four children: one boy and three girls, one in secondary school and three in primary school.

Marie has been a LAPOSL client for some time now, and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Marie sells bagged rice at the Wharf in Tombo. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing extra inventory. With her new loan she hopes to add more stock to her business.

With the increase in profit, Marie plans to feed her children and repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. sells electrical appliances at Pedu, near Abura in cape coast. He is married. Samuel has been selling electrical appliances for quite some time now. He is responsible for paying school fess and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more electrical appliances for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and to invest into his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more electrical appliances for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his shop and to buy more vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Richard Kandie

texts.en:
Richard Kandie is a 27-year-old man married to Evanshia Sambu who is also 27 years old. Richard and Evanshia have been blessed with two children: Edmond Kandie and Mercy Chelimo who are 5½ and 4 years old, respectively.

Richard’s primary business is a hotel (this term is used locally to mean a food service establishment), which is two years old and yields a profit of Kshs 26,000 per month. He gets additional income from farming which comes to about Kshs 3,000 per month. Richard’s customers are mainly residents of Kabarnet Town and those visiting the town.

Mr. Kandie plans to use the Kshs 20,000 from KADET limited to purchase stock for the hotel. This loan marks his first loan from KADET. Whatever profit he earns he plans to use to boost his business by expanding his hotel to be able to accommodate about 100 customers per sitting. He also plans to offers accommodation or rather lodging services to his customers, which he doesn’t do at the moment.

Richard dreams of expanding his hotel business to a five star hotel. He also hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

Richard describes himself as hard-working and determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the hotel.

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Rorn K. is 42 years old and she lives in Samna Khmau village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Chem Gneang, is a construction laborer.

This family has a problem because it is the time to do farming but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Sa Rorn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and to hire laborers for plowing the field.

Sa Rorn K. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a construction laborer, another is attending the public school, while the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Sincere Business Organization Group

texts.en:
Sincere Business is a group of 5 borrowers led by Boakai S.. He is 41 years old and is single with two children. One of his children is one month old, and the other is one year old. Boakai is a high-school graduate but could not continue his education beyond that due to a lack of financial support.

He and his family live in the Cow Factory Community, Jamaica Road, on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. He sells from a table on Randall Street in central downtown Monrovia. Boakai’s business is the sale of cosmetics. He buys wholesale and sells retail to customers. He has been running this business for more than 5 years and hopes to become a big business man. Boakai started by selling children's toys with funds given to him by his mother. In his business, he faces the challenge of a shortage of funds to use as working capital. He encourages customers by selling quality goods, and a good manner of approach. Boakai needs this loan to purchase more cosmetics for resale.

He dreams of giving his children a good future by sending them to school, and wants to build a cosmetics store.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Boakai is the one holding the sign. Uriah D. is inset at the lower right. This is the second time that the Sincere Business Organization has been listed for funding on Kiva, but the first time with Boakai as the group's leader. The prior listing for the group is at http://partners.kiva.org/lend/140043.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en:
Saudah is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children aged between 6 months and 21 years. Six of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a six-roomed house where she lives with ten people. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water.

Saudah fries samosas (fried or baked triangular-shaped pastry shells with a savory filling), chapattis (unleavened flatbread, similar to tortillas) and kebab (pieces of meat roasted or grilled on a skewer or spit). She uses public transport to and from shopping and incurs extra transport costs while distributing her samosas, selling to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She also distributes to different shops and schools nearby.

Saudah buys wheat flour, cooking oil and baking powder from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala. She works seven days a week and, on average, she receives about forty customers a day.

Saudah works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business seventeen years and with MCDT for eight years. She is servicing her seventeenth loan working with the same group members.

Saudah’s monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication. Her business challenges include the expenses of cartons of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil.

Saudah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start buying directly from manufacturers.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, cette femme exerce depuis 2000 le métier de la couture dans son propre atelier qu’elle a ouvert à Vakpossito qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Pour accroître ses recettes, elle a associé à son commerce la vente de  tissus Bazins qu’elle expose parfois devant son atelier pour attirer ses clients. La vente de bazins lui réussit bien elle souhaiterait l’agrandir c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 bazins de grande qualité.
texts.en:
Akou is 40 years old and since 2000 she has been a seamstress with her own workshop that she opened in Vakpossito, a suburb of Lomé. To increase her income, she expanded her business to sell Bazin fabrics, which she sometimes hangs outside of her workshop to attract customers. The sale of Bazin fabrics has been successful and she would like to grow that part of her business. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 pieces of high-quality Bazin fabric.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Bazin fabric

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49-year-old widow woman raising 4 children. Two of her children help her by contributing income from their jobs to manage the heavy expenses of life. 

For the past 15 years, Mariam has worked as a farmer to support her family. She owns a large plot land where she cultivates all types of vegetables and a variety of trees. 

Today, Mariam is requesting $1,200 to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant summer vegetables in order to augment the harvest and thus her income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for summer vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used shirts to sell

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Marcos, por que  así se llama el municipio y  las integrantes están muy orgullosas de Radicar en San Marcos, pues consideran que es un poblado muy interesante en donde predomina el comercio. Las integrantes son Francisca G. 
( venta de productos por catálogos), Luisa M. (venta de perfumes por catálogos), Natividad  Albisto (venta de cosméticos), Adela Hernández ( venta de cosméticos),Maria Juana (venta de abarrotes), Yoady E. (venta de perfumes por catálogos), Leticia U. (venta de perfumes por catálogos), Antonina  Damián ( venta de refrescos y dulces), Yaxiltun B. (venta de producto por catálogos), Gabriel Ramírez ( tiene un cibert), Maria Guadalupe ( venta de artículos para belleza) y Ada Nely ( venta de medicamentos).


Luisa M. es la representante  del grupo ella es casada y se dedica a la venta de perfumes por catálogos de Fuller y Avon, los productos que mas  vende son perfume, crema y cosméticos, pero como no tenia dinero  decidió  pedir el préstamo por que quiere surtir mas para ampliar sus negocio, además nos comenta que obtiene buenas ganancias al vender estos productos, pues no pierde al invertir en ellos, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de seguir luchando para  sobresalir 
poder  lograr otros sueños.

Nos comenta que con el préstamo comprará una gran variedad de perfumes y se sinte muy emocionada, ya que será de gran apoyo el recurso para poder invertir en su negocio.

Luisa  nos comenta que están trabajando unidas todas para alcanzar sus objetivos y tener más oportunidades y envían saludos a esas personas que hacen posible sus sueños de seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called San Marcos, named after their municipality which the members are extremely proud of representing. It´s an interesting village where trade and commerce dominate. The members are made up of the following individuals: Francisca G. (sells products from catalogs), Luisa M. (sells perfumes from catalogs), Natividad Albisto (sells cosmetics), Adela Hernández (sells cosmetics), Maria Juana (sells groceries), Yoady E. (sells perfumes from catalogs), Leticia U. (sells perfumes from catalogs), Antonina Damián (sells refreshments and sweets), Yaxiltun B. (sells products from catalogs), Gabriel Ramírez (owns a cyber café), Maria Guadalupe (sells beauty products) and Ada Nely (sells medicine). Luisa M. is the representative of the group. She is married and sells perfumes from Fuller and Avon catalogs. Her most popular items are perfume, cream, and cosmetics. Since she didn't have money, she decided to seek a loan in order to be able to obtain more products and increase her business. In addition, she commented to us that she makes a good living selling these products and so she wouldn't be losing anything by investing in them. She considers herself a hardworking woman with a will to keep fighting to move ahead and fulfill more dreams. She says that with the loan, she will be able to buy a greater variety of perfumes and she is very excited, since that would be a a great new investment towards her business. Luisa says that she and her group are working together to realize their goals and enhance their opportunities. They wish to salute all the individuals out there that are helping them fulfill their dreams and improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase certain cosmetics, such as perfumes, creams, deodorants.

location.town: Localidad de San Marcos, Municipio de San Marcos,

loans.name: Bulamu Bwoka Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Twenty years is the time widowed N. Fazira has spent in her food and charcoal selling business in Kavule, Mukono. Bent upon succeeding in everything she does, she has gone out of her way to get herself firmly rooted in this business.

Fazira’s long-haul experience has played into her hands. Knowing that the odds are not in her favor without a man, she has worked vigorously and hard to provide for her six children. Fortunately all of them are now in school.

With this loan, Fazira wants to buy more bags of basic foods and charcoal that she envisages she will, in turn, sell to her increasing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase basic foods like maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Rukiizi Abagambakamu Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
In the deep village of Rukiizi, Kyenjojo, exists a hardworking, customer-friendly, and determined gentleman who goes by the name of B. George. He has been running a produce-selling business now for close to three years.

The happily married father of ten children maneuvered through tough times before getting to where he is now. In a week, he makes 50,000 shillings and his dream is to put up his own maize mill in his village.

This loan will help George to purchase more crops he trades in like rice, maize, beans and peas.

loans.use: To purchase more crops to sell like rice, maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Fidelia tiene 43 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Fidelia es la compra y venta verduras. Ella compra verduras por temporadas y por otras épocas ella misma siembra y cosecha sus productos para vender. Su esposo Marco es carpintero y de esta forma aporta al gasto familiar.

Fidelia participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual al momento de pagar sus cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas. 
      
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the community of Rumichaca, in the city of Urubamba. Her primary economic activity is buying and selling vegetables. She buys vegetables in certain seasons, and in other times she plants and harvests the products she will sell. Her husband, Marco, is a carpenter. This is how they support their family. Fidelia participates in a communal bank and it is going very well for her because she is a responsible person and is punctual with her repayments. She needs this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. This group member is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through this loan. She also promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Mrs. Koeun E. is a 26 year old married woman and is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Satya Vong In, are farmers who own 2.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support the farming crop, Mrs. Koeun E. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow her farm. Aside from farmers, Mrs. Koeun E. is also grocery seller at home while her husband is a furniture maker (tables, chairs-----) who is able to earn a small income to improve the family living. This couple has two children, who all are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: John Litiema

texts.en:
John Litiema, a 61-year-old industrious man from Shinyalu town, Western Kenya, is married to Anjeline, a businesslady in the same town. They have two children, Rodgers and Rosemary, who are in secondary school.

John operates a carpentry workshop in Shinyalu market centre where he constructs household items such as tables and beds. He joined Kadet to access loans for his business after a friend introduced him to the organization, and he is now requesting his second loan after completing his first one without default. At the moment, John wants to diversify into poultry farming, and he plans to use this loan to buy poultry feed. He believes that by starting this other business, he will generate more income and improve his living standards.

John's longterm goal is to start a dairy farm to supply dairy products in Bungoma town.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed for his diversified business.

loans.name: Genty

texts.en: Genty K. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste, and cooking oil  and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish to fry and sell.  Genty is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora T. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Cora is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cora is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending  business. Her husband Jeffrey L., 34 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are four and eleven years old. Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9000 PHP helped her to earn a monthly profit of 6500 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing 18,000 PHP which she intends to add to her own savings to purchase a fishing boat and to use as operating capital so that she could continue to earn enough and save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. Gemma L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and use as operating capital

loans.name: Joshua Nyongesa

texts.en:
Joshua Nyongesa O. is a 35-year-old man, and is married to Mary Kayanga Chebai who works with an insurance company firm. They have two children, ages 13 years and 10 years respectively. They live in Maili Saba which is one kilometer from Kitale town. To make a living, Joshua sells car spare parts. He has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 12,000 KES per month.

Joshua was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES with KADET LTD.  With this loan he plans to purchase car spare parts.

He hopes with the income he gets, it can be used to expand the business and turn it into a wholesale enterprise and see his children get a better education.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Nerys Noedita

texts.es:
Mejía está localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  su gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos, se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía.

Aquí  encontramos a la señora Nerys, tiene 42 años, actualmente esta soltera pero hace mucho tuvo una relación de la cual tuvo 5 hijos, de los cuales  4 ya son mayores de edad y una niña menor de edad, todos estudian en universidad y colegio.

Es una ama de casa que para poder sobrellevar los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos tuvo que dedicarse al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, ventiladores, camas, aspiradoras entre otros artículos)  de una empresa que se llama la Gran Cadena. Su forma de venta es atreves de un catalogo de sus productos,  una vez que complete el cupo adecuado envía estos pedidos a la empresa y recibe los pedidos que luego entrega a sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra semanal o quincenalmente. Trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana  en las mañanas.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos de este mes. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace cinco ciclos,   es la secretaria tarea que cumple muy bien y le gusta el Banco por los beneficios que recibe.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Mejía is located a few kilometers outside of the city of Portoviejo, a city where most of the residents engage in farming activities such as growing and selling coconuts. The members of the Mejía Communal Bank meet every fifteen days.

Sra. Nerys is 42 years old and currently single, but she has been in a long-term relationship that resulted in five children, four of whom are adults while her youngest daughter is still underage. All of her children are either university or high school students.

Nerys is a homemaker who manages her own business in order to cope with the household expenses and the cost of her children’s education. She sells household goods such as blenders, irons, fans, beds, vacuum cleaners, and other products from her store called “Gran Cadena” (Great Chain). Her sales are generated by catalog. As soon as she reaches the appropriate quota, she sends her orders to the company and then receives the merchandise so that she can deliver them to her customers. Nerys extends credit and then collects payments on either a weekly or biweekly schedule. She works three or four days per week during the morning hours.

This loan will be used to pay for this month’s orders. Nerys has been a member of her Communal Bank for five loan cycles. She serves as the group secretary and has performed very well in this position. Nerys also enjoys the benefits she receives from her Communal Bank.

loans.use: Pay for the merchandise that her customers have ordered this month

loans.name: Gina Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
Aquí conversamos con la señora Maritza, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 24 – 20 y 8 años,  el menor vive con ella y estudia en la escuela.

Trabaja en una casa haciendo los quehaceres domésticos, pero en las noches y en los días libres se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios), visita a sus clientes los sabados y domingos en el día ya que en estos días cobra porque deja a crédito, también en las noches realiza sus ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar mas de sus productos ya que tiene su capital invertido y tiene varios pedidos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal por cinco años y está muy a gusto ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido cumplir con sus clientes. Sus sueños son tener un bazar y dedicarse por completo a su negocio.
texts.en:
In Los Cerezos neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo the 'Emprendedora De Los Cerezos' community bank meets every fortnight.  This is a marginal urban area which is very densely populated.

Here we speak to 41 year-old Maritza.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 24, 20 and 8.  The youngest lives with her and is attending school.

Maritza works as a cleaner in a private house but in the evenings and on her days off she sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories).  She visits her customers on Saturdays and Sundays to collect the money for the products which she has left with them on credit.  She also carries out her sales in the evenings.

This loan is to buy more products since her capital is invested in the business but she has several orders to fill.  She has been a member of her community bank for five years and she really likes it because, thanks to the loans which she has obtained, she has been able to fulfil her customers' demands.  Her dreams are to have a store and to commit herself completely to her business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, perfumes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace cinco años cerca a la parada de una línea de minibuses,  siendo este su principal mercado,  los choferes de la misma parada son los que le compran, es muy conocida por la exquisitez de sus platos. No cuenta con dependientes en la actualidad sin embargo se esmera por crecer y ser el ejemplo para sus hijos. Ella vive en la  casa de sus papás, se levanta muy temprano para cocinar e ir a su venta, es muy trabajadora y responsable, con el dinero del credito comprara material de construccion para la remodelacion de su cocina y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Claudia has sold food for more than five years close to a bus stop. This is her principle market. The drivers at the stop buy from her and she is well known for her exquisite dishes.  She doesn't have any dependents right now but she nonetheless strives to grow and be an example for her children. She lives in her parents' house and gets up very early to cook and go sell. She is very hardworking and responsible. With the money from the loan, she will buy construction materials to remodel her kitchen. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to remodel her kitchen and buy groceries

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George Ondingo is 44 years old, from Kibuye in Kisumu city, married to Mary, and they have five children: Lucy, Eunice, Kevin, Vivian, and Linet.

George is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first one. George intends to use the money to buy timber, velvet-type material and sheets of foam for making sofa sets (couches). He intends to use the profits to boost his wife’s business too.

His dream is to open up other workshops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: Buy more timber, velvet upholstery farbic, and foam sheets so that he can construct sofas.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Silvestre de 44 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Marisol ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de café, cacao y hojas de coca de la provincia de La Mar - Ayacucho, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una social muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 34, is a very kind and simple woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Silvestre, 44, and their 3 beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life . From an early age Marisol has worked alongside her parents in agriculture.  Over time she has managed to buy her own farm and is now one of the largest producers of coffee, cocoa and coca leaves in La Mar - Ayacucho province.  Her buyers travel from a distance to obtain her crops.   What she likes about her job is looking after the crops, which she does with great care.  She has spent 20 years doing this work and thinks that the hardest part is transporting her products to the city of San Francisco, because it it is very difficult to find trucks that are willing to carry the heavy sacks of crops. 

Over time, she wants to buy new land with which she can increase her production. This is her sixteenth credit with MFP, she makes sure to pay all her installments on time, and has always been very punctual.  She is a very cheerful member of her community bank and shows great solidarity. With the 1200 New Soles she is requesting, she will buy more manure and fertilizers to improve her crop productivity.

loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Chhuneng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhuneng C. (pictured with her loom), 41 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sokun Sam,  44 years old, live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15  kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters.    

Chhuneng has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. This is a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. 

She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is 40 years old active lady, manages her household works in an effective way. She lives with her family in a small city called Sahiwal. Sahiwal is famous for its agriculture industry and locates in Pakistan.  
She is married to A. L. who has a business of selling crockery. He has a little shop in the market through which he offers his customers different kind of crockery like dinner sets, glass sets etc. He is operating this business for over 20 years and well known among his customers for his good behavior and quality items. 
Azra is the mother of 2 daughters; both are enrolled in a local school and are studying in 5th grade. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan he will purchase more crockery to put in his shop for selling. 
Azra is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to more profitable position and in result she will be able to provide better quality education to her daughers. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell

loans.name: Yisela

texts.es: Yisela, de 29 años, vive en casa de sus abuelos en compañía de ellos, sus dos hijos y de su esposo; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Hace 5 años atrás, Yisela, decidió vender productos de belleza, en el entorno de su hogar, siendo sus primeros compradores sus familiares de su casa, y poco a poco ofrecía a más amistades, es por eso que hoy en día todas sus vecinas de su barrio la reconocen como tal.  Por ello, Yisela antes de salir a la calle se asegura de cargar su bolso con productos de belleza y sus catálogos, para que de esa manera logre vender más que la campaña anterior. Con la ayuda de su esposo puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de sus hijos.  Se siente muy contenta con la actividad que desarrolla; por ello desea ampliar su negocio y diversificar con otros negocios también.
