Es el 34avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para acceder a posteriores créditos, pues quiere continuar progresando con su taller. De obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yisela is 29 years old and lives with her grandparents at their house as well as with her two children and her husband. Together they strive each day to get ahead. Five years ago, Yisela decided to sell beauty products from home. Her first customers were her relatives and over time she offered them to more of her friends. Today all of her neighbors in the area know her for this business. Prior to going out on the streets to sell, Yisela makes sure that her bag is filled with beauty products and catalogs. By working in this manner, she is able to sell more than in the previous season. With the help of her husband, Yisela is able to cover the household expenses and support their children. She is very happy with how her business has developed. For this reason, she wants to expand her business and diversify with other products as well.

This is her 34th loan with MFP. Yisela promises to complete her payments on time so that she eligible to access subsequent loans to help with advancing her business. With the loan she obtained, she plans to buy more beauty products so that she can continue developing in her work.

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling in a shop and from home to her neighbors. Asha faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in the future. She hopes to access more loans to educate her children in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kokadje (La Transparence) Group

texts.fr:
Kokadje est un regroupement de femmes de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, Hamdallaye, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe Kokadje fait l’achat et la vente de parures de toutes sortes : (des colliers, des perles, des bracelets, des boucles d’oreille et du nez), des  d’habillements : des pagnes wax, des bazins et  des brodés.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Kokadje ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 8 ans. Le groupe kokadje est a son seizième prêt de groupe et tous les 15 premiers ont été bien remboursés.
Awa Traoré  qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat et la vente des parures et habillements. Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au bord du marché de Hamdallaye avec un hangar.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de perle pour confectionner toutes sortes de parures. Elle s’approvisionne au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre après avoir confectionner  en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. En plus elle veut acheter  des pagnes wax à Bamako à un prix abordable pour revendre en détail au comptant et en crédit.
Awa Traoré  elle,  compte réaliser 130 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour remboursement le prêt et faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir agrandir  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Kokadje is a group of women from the town of Koutiala who live together in the same neighborhood, Hamdallaye, in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-spouses. On average they are 40 years old, married and have less than 5 children each. 

This group sells all kinds of jewelry (necklaces, pearls, bracelets, ear and nose rings), as well as clothing (wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), damask fabric and embroidered fabric. To increase their activity, the Kokadje group  members decided 8 years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their sixteenth loan and the previous fifteen have all been properly repaid. 

Awa Traoré, one of the group members, buys and sells jewelry and clothing. She is very much in demand because she has a good spot next to the Hamdallaye market with a warehouse. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of pearls with which she will make all sorts of jewelry. She obtains her supplies wholesale at the Kouiala Grand Market, and re-sells, after having worked on them, on a retail or cash basis to customers who are mostly women. She also wants to buy wax "pagnes" cheaply in Bamako to re-sell on a retail basis for cash or credit . Awa Traoré individually expects to make 130,000 CFA francs, which will be used to re-pay the loan and to meet the family's everyday expenses. The group wants to strengthen its partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase its activity.

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Lolita is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Lolita raises fish for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing net. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda tiene 20 años y nació en la ciudad de Quellouno de la provincia de Convención. Actualmente, Griselda vive en la comunidad de Cotowincho de la provincia de Urubamba y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad de económica principal de Griselda es la elaboración de chicha y la venta de cerveza, ella tiene un pequeño local donde expende sus productos y está más o menos equipado con las necesidades básicas. Griselda en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar cerveza. 

Griselda pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años. (La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde los socios se reúnen cada treinta días para realizar sus actividades correspondientes.)
texts.en:
Griselda is 20 years old and was born in the town of Quellouno in the Convención province.  She currently has three sons and lives in Cotowincho, in the Urubama province.  Griselda makes chicha and sells beer.  She has a small stall from where she sells her products and it's more or less equipped with the basic necessities.  She needs this micro loan to buy beer.

Griselda is a member of the “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” communal bank of the Arariwa Association, and has been working with her fellow members for ten years. (The Cotowincho Community is located ten minutes from the city of Urubamba, where the members meet each month to perform their respective tasks.)

loans.use: to buy beer for resale

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.fr: Atsoupi est une jeune femme active, dynamique  de 37ans qui vend du charbon, du sodabi (boisson locale faite à base de vin de palme très appréciée au Togo) et des produits de premières nécessités.  Son mari est conducteur de camion et ils ont 04 enfants en charge. Il ya 12ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Zafi, Ahepe et Lomé et revend à Anfamé (un quartier de Lomé).  Elle veut voir son activité prospérer, s’occuper mieux de ses enfants  avoir sa propre maison et être plus tard un grossiste dans la vente de ses produits c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier  prêt pour acheter  du charbon de bois, du sodabi et des produits de premières nécessités.
texts.en:
Atsoupi, age 37, is an energetic woman who sells charcoal, sodabi (a local beverage made with palm wine, very much appreciated in Togo) and staples. Her husband is a truck driver, and they have four children to support. She's been running this business for 12 years. She gets her supplies in Zafi, Ahepe, and Lomé, and resells in Anfamé (a neighborhood in Lomé).

She wants to see her business bolster, take better care of her children, and have her own house. Later, she wants to become a wholesaler. This is why she's seeking this first loan, in order to buy charcoal, sodabi and staples.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, sodabi (a local beverage) and staples

loans.name: Siyabonga Group

texts.en:
Liona C. is the leader of Siyabonga Group. She is a 35-year-old widow with one child who is aged 13 and still attending school. She sells clothes and blankets at a flea market situated at Chacha Business Center that is served by MicroKing Gweru Branch. She has been operating at the flea market for six years and she currently has one employee. The main challenge she faces is that of lack of sufficient funds to restock in time. For now she is targeting to stock more clothes and blankets for the winter season that is just starting.  

Liona requested this loan through MicroKing with the intention of purchasing clothes and blankets for her flea market. Liona sees the loan amount as a gateway to increased sales and profitability that will improve her family's diet and wealth creation. She aspires to have a big shop and a car in the future. 

Note: In the picture, Liona is the lady sitting in the front row in a red blouse.

loans.use: To buy clothes and blankets for winter sales.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia, D. 69 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para tener una vejez tranquila. DesD. muy joven, Hortencia supo lo que quería hacer para ganarse en la vida, desD. entonces incursionó en el negocio D. venta D. artesanías D. cuero remojado, las cuales elabora con sus propias manos, para luego llevarlas a vender por los principales mercados D. la ciudad D. Lima, que es donD. tiene más venta. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es participar D. las distintas ferias que se llevan a cabo en la ciudad, lleva 42 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos a los puntos D. ventas, por se estructuras muy delicadas y corren el riesgo D. cuartearse o romperse. Con el tiempo, espera poner una tienda muy granD. D. artesanías, donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales para elaborar sus preciadas artesanías D. cuero remojado.
texts.en: Hortencia, 69 years old, is a lovable and hard working woman.  She lives in her own house and wishes to be able to work very hard and have a peaceful old age.  From the time that she was young, Hortencia knew what she wanted to do to make a living.  Since then she embarked on the business of selling crafts from soaked leather, which she makes herself and the takes to the main markets in Lima for sale.  What she likes the most about her work is participating in the various fairs that occur in the city.  She has been in this business for 42 years and finds the transport of her products to be the most difficult part, for they are delicate and run the risk of splitting or breaking.  In time, she hopes to open a large crafts store where she can sell in more comfort.  This is her third loan with MFP, she know that she needs to pay her installments on time and plans to do so.  She is a loved member of her community bank.  With the 1,500 new soles she will buy materials to make her precious leather crafts.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make soaked leather crafts.

loans.name: Danny Alfredo

texts.es:
Danny Alfredo  tiene 31 años, Es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Danny se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando y comprar un carro para el negocio.

Le gusta mucho hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Danny Alfredo is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Canton of Ventanas, part of the Province of Los Ríos.

The members of the “El Recreo” Communal Bank live in the Canton of Ventanas, located in the San Vicente de las Lomas precinct. The people of this communal bank work in short-cycle farming and grow corn, rice, beans and soy.

Danny works growing corn, rice and soy on his parents’ lands. He makes his purchases in Ventanas and makes his sales at the daily markets, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. The support from this loan will help him financially to meet his needs. The challenges he faces are the competition and changes in weather. His dream is to buy lands to continue growing, and to buy a car for his business.

He likes playing sports a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Delgermurun

texts.en:
Delgermurun is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 10 and 12 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) districts. 
She sells clothes at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her husband works as a plumber at a local company. 
Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract at Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. When Delgermurun first began her business in 2003, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time.
In 2005, however, Delgermurun had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is 3,300,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT), and she sells clothes at her own two stalls.
For the past 8 years, Delgermurun and her husband have been successfully improving their living conditions gradually. For example, they built their own small house in 2010 and then they bought a used car with 8,000,000 MN of their business earnings in January, 2011. So, Delgermurun’s working capital decreased.

With this loan of 2,500,000 MNT, Delgermurun will purchase more clothes from Ereen City, China. Delgermurun wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Joeria

texts.en:
Joweria lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  Joweria has a food stall business.  She has been in this business for 8 years and works 7 days out of every week. Joweria sells her products at the market by means of retail.    

Joweria has requested  for a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more items for her stall such as a basket of tomatoes, onions, pawpaws and oranges. The main business challenge for Joweria is transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to start selling on wholesale only .  

Joweria lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jeny Perlita

texts.es:
La  señora Jeny es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Recién lleva 3 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica al servicio de alquiler de Habitaciones (cuartos), tiene en su casa más de 20 cuartos los cuales alquila a personas muy responsables que le cumplen puntualmente con sus pagos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 planchas de triplay, 15 tapajuntas, 2 kilos de clavos de una pulgada, y cubrirá el servicio de mano de obra del carpintero que realizará trabajos en su casa para dar mantenimiento a las habitaciones.
Gracias a este negocio puede ayudar a su esposo.  La inversión que hizo para construir todos estos cuartos, le permitirá asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, quienes podrán estudiar sin ningún inconveniente.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos otorgados a su persona.
texts.en:
Jeny is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Entrepreneurial Women") communal bank of the Calleria District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and married with two children.

Recently, she has participated in 3 loan cycles with the Manuela Ramos organization. Her work is renting rooms. In her home, she has more than 20 rooms, which she rents to very responsible people who make their payments punctually. 

With her new loan for 1,200.00 Peruvian new soles, she will buy 10 sheets of plywood, 15 pieces of flashing, and 2 kilos of 1-inch nails, and she will also pay for the services of the carpenter who will carry out maintenance on the rooms in her house. 

Thanks to this business, she is able to help out her husband. The investment which she made to build all of these rooms will allow her to provide a secure future to her children, who will be able to study without any hindrances. 

She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the loans granted to her as an individual.

loans.use: to buy plywood and other construction materials.

loans.name: Jakeline Zarauz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jakeline; la socia tiene 29 años; la socia es soltera y tiene 1 hijos, de 8 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra y vende vacas y toros; la socia desea comprar vacas  terneras, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de dos vacas terneras.  

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Jakeline, a member of “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”, a Communal Bank located in Yungaqui, a district of the Anta province in the Cusco department.

Jakeline is 29 years old, she is single and she has an 8-year-old child. She engages in buying and selling small animals. She buys and sells cows and bulls, and she would like to buy calves. She is requesting a loan to buy 2 calves.

She is very satisfied with and thankful to the support she will receive through this loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 49, resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to George, a driver and mechanic, and mother of five children, two of whom are employed, one in college and the other two are in high school. By the grace of God, Imelda has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. For most Filipino parents, like Imelda, a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Imelda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Imelda's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1500 on sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Imelda dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Bëg Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bëg Diam est créé le 14 décembre 2008, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui sont sœurs, amies et voisines;elles exercent les mêmes activités de petit commerce et d'embouche.

Madame Ndéye la responsable est âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée mère de huit enfants et a deux autres qui lui ont été confiés; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de diverses marchandises, elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche, elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en boubou teinté noir avec couleurs rose jaune.


Elle s'approvisionne dans un pays frontalier en Mauritanie et revend dans son quartier.


Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus.

Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne avec les bénéfices obtenus.
texts.en: The solidarity group Bëg Diam was created on December 14, 2008. It comprises eighteen women who are sisters, friends, and neighbors; they all have the same work in small-scale commerce and in livestock farming. Ms. Ndéy, the group's official, is 54 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, plus two others who have been entrusted to her. She runs a small business selling a variety of merchandise. At the same time, she fattens livestock. She has good experience. In the photo, she is the one standing at the far right and dressed in a boubou dyed black with pink and yellow. She gets her supplies from the bordering country of Mauritania and resells them in her district. Her loan will be used to bolster her business in order to earn a lot of revenues. She wishes to save more money with the profits obtained.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tugume Group

texts.fr:
Thomas est un commerçant âgé de 38ans qui habite  la localité de Mumuri au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de produits de boutique(haricots,riz,savons,biscuits,huile de palme,sel…) depuis 8ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année des études primaires. Il est marié a Henriette et père de 1 enfants qui etudie en 1ere annee primaire.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantite de produits de boutique( haricots,riz,savon,huile de palme,sel…) a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUGUME».
texts.en:
Thomas is a merchant, 36 years old, who lives in the town of Mumuri in the middle of the country in Gitega Province. He has been doing commerce in grocery items (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) for eight years. He is also a farmer. He attended school through the 5th grade. He is married to Henriette and is the father of one child, who is in the first grade. 

The Kiva loan of 250,000 Burundi francs that Thomas obtained will allow him to increase his capital while buying a bigger quantity of grocery items (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Thomas is a member of the community group “TUGUME”.

loans.use: to increase capital while buying bigger quantities of store goods (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi sells cooking utensils and slippers at Kukwa. She attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has three children. 

Asi has been selling utensils for five years. She assists her partner to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to acquire more cooking utensils for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward building a shop.

loans.use: to acquire more cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
Mr. You is a 28-year-old single man who resides in Kompong Speu province. Presently, Mr. You lives with his mother and he occasionally assists his mother in her crop-planting business according to the season, rainy or dry season, when he has extra time from his sales business. To earn a living, Mr. You is a charcoal seller and he spends most of his time transporting his goods to sell in the market place. 

Mr. You would like to ask for a loan in order to purchase charcoal for resale and with any remainder, he will to buy a few sacks of fertilizer so his mother's rice crop will grow well. In the future, he hopes he will be able to afford a better trailer to carry his charcoal, and also hopes to expand his existing house. 

Note: Mr. You and his mother are in the photo together in front of their house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale and buy a few sacks of fertilizer for his mother's rice crop.

loans.name: Mandiaye

texts.fr: C'est un commerçant, il habite dans une région du Sénégal. Il s'active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Avec ce prêt il va faire une embouche en achetant des moutons et des chèvres destinés à la vente. Mais aussi, ce crédit est utilisé pour acheter des poissons qu'il va revendre sur le marché.Le but de ce prêt est destiné aussi a l'achat de nourriture pour les bêtes. Il compte acheté un champ dans sa localité pour avoir une espace afin de mieux entretenir ses troupeaux.
texts.en: This borrower is a trader and lives in a region of Senegal.  He has been in business for more than 15 years.  He will use this loan to buy livestock to fatten.  He will buy sheep and goats which he will later sell.  He will also use this loan to buy fish, which he will re-sell on the market, and feed for his animals.  He plans to buy a field in his town so that he will have a space where he can better look after his animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fish

loans.name: Magomero Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38-year-old Elena from Gweru. She is married with four children, of whom three attend school. Elena runs a Flea Market business selling clothes, floor polish, and fish.

Elena has been in this business for one year. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capital. Elena has requested a loan of $400 to buy bulk stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the family's general welfare and at the same enable her to send her children to better schools. 

She is also planning to open a floor polish manufacturing plant.

loans.use: For buying clothes, floor polish, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Gledys Sonia

texts.es: La señora Gledys en la zona del plan 3000, la cliente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos al por mayor y menor los cuales es comercializado una mayor parte en la localidad de Monteagudo y otra parte en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, la cliente vive en la casa de su hermana junto a su esposo pero el cual se encuentra trabajando en la localidad de Monteagudo, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de mostradores para poder exhibir sus productos así también la cliente pretende comprar mercadería al por mayor de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos. El sueño de la cliente es poder ser directora de la línea de cosméticos por catalogo donde ella trabaja y de esta manera poder generar mayores ingresos de lo que viene percibiendo.
texts.en:
Señora Gledys is part of plan 3000. She sells cosmetics both wholesale and retail for the most part in Monteagudo and Santa Cruz. The member lives with her husband, who works in the Monteagudo area, in her sister's house. The loan is to be used to purchase metal counters to display her products and the member also wants to buy merchandise wholesale to generate higher income. The member's dream is to be a director of the cosmetics line catalogue she works for and in this way generate a higher income than she currently receives.

.

loans.use: to buy metal counters and have working capital.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 40-year-old divorced woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for seven years. Agnes has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, de 66 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, esta casada pero se divorcio hace mucho, es madre de siete hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ahora ella vive en su casa propia a lado de su nuevo compromiso con quien comparte sus días trabajando mucho y brindándose el apoyo necesario para tener un estilo de vida como ellos se merecen. El trabajo de Rosalina consiste en la venta de ropa usada y plásticos, compra en grandes cantidades y se va por los pueblos y caseríos de las riveras del río Ucayali en donde realiza su negocio al contado y a cambio de algunos productos o animales. Lleva trabajando con este negocio hace siete años, y lo hace a lado de su esposo. Le es muy rentable ir por los caseríos y río a realizar su venta ya que gana el doble de lo que gana, cuando vende al contado gana menos ya que cuando los cambia por animales es mejor ya que acá en la ciudad lo duplica triplica el monto. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que siempre tuvo un espíritu libre y aventurero, antes de empezar con este trabajo ella se quedaba sola en su casa ya que su esposo viajaba mucho y un día decidió viajar junto a él y así no quedarse sola, además siempre tenía que depender de los ingresos de su esposo y ahora es independiente en su economía. Ahora ella desea mantenerse en el nivel que esta y poner un negocio en su casa para así trabajar acá nomás. Este será el préstamo numero 14 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con su trabajo, es un socia fundadora y siempre esta muy al pendiente de cómo están sus compañeros de banco. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores prestamos. Como es una socia muy antigua, siempre esta al pendiente de que sus demás compañeros de banco comunal sean puntuales y así es ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas mercadería para ir por el río, ropa de segunda, además de bandejas, platos, vasos y mas para llevar por el río a seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 66, is a good, kind and very responsible woman.  She’s married but she was divorced many years ago.  She’s the mother of seven children who are all now independent adults.  She now lives with her new companion who she shares her days with working much and giving each other the support they need to have the life style they deserve.

Rosalina’s work consists in selling used clothes and plastic ware.  She buys in large quantities and then goes to towns and hamlets along the Ucayali River banks to sell for cash or in exchange for a few animals or products.  She’s been in this business seven years and she does it alongside her husband.

It’s quite profitable for her to go to the towns along the river to sell because she earns twice what she spends.  When she sells for cash she earns less than when she trades for animals because back in the city she doubles or triples the amount.  She likes he work very much because she’s always had a free, adventurous spirit.  Before starting this work she’d stay home alone because her husband traveled a lot and one day she decided to go with him and not stay home alone.  Besides, she always had to depend on her husband’s earnings and now she’s economically independent.  Now she wants to maintain the level she’s at and set up a store at home and work just here.

This will be MFP loan #14 so she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with her work.  She is a founding member and is always watchful of her fellow members.  She commits once again to make her payments like she’s done in previous loans.  Because she’s a longstanding member, she’s always watching over the other members to make sure they are punctual and that’s how they have all become very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy more merchandise to sell along the river: second-hand clothing, trays, plates and drinking glasses to take to sell along the river and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy more clothes as well as trays, plates and plastic drinking glasses.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felipa; La socia tiene 39 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo; la socia ahora se dedica al negocio de tejidos,ella teje chompas,gorros y pantalones de lana,ella lo vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tejidos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana,palitos de tejer e hilos al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Felipa, is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  Now she works in the knitting business.  She knits wool sweaters, caps, and pants, and sells them independently from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  With this business she gets her child ahead.  Felipa wants to expand and improve her knitting business.

She is requesting the loan to buy wool, knitting needles, and yarn wholesale.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means.  Also, she is committed to making her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy wool, knitting needles, and yarn wholesale.

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, ella tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores y dos de 17 y 9 años de edad,  ambos estudian  en colegio y el menor en escuela y aun viven con ella, los mayores ya son independientes.  Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una ama de casa para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a  sus hijos con los gasto de los estudios se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, y accesorios para damas), estas ventas olas realiza al mismo tiempo que hace la venta de ropa. Trabaja 4 días a la semana sobre todo por las mañanas, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas y perfumes, bisutería. Lleva casi dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the María Monserrate communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and it’s nationally and internationally known arts.  This is the place of the famous straw hats.

Margarita is 41 years old and lives here.  She’s married and has four children, two are grown up and on their own, and the others are 17 and 9.  Both attend school and still live at home.  Her husband works as a mason.

She’s a housewife, but sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories) in order to obtain her own income and be able to help her children with their schooling expenses.  She also sells clothing and works four days a week, mostly in the mornings.  She sells on credit and collects on the weekends.  She buys her merchandise in Picoaza.

She will use the money from this loan to buy creams, perfumes, and costume jewelry.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for two years and likes how quickly she can get the loans.  Her dream is to have a store within her home.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La Señorita Amanda es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 19 años, es soltera vive con sus padres. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de hamacas, colchas, frazadas en la ciudad de Formosa Argentina hace más de 4 años.
Desde pequeña empezó a trabajar en esto ya que su papá es macatero (vendedor ambulante), y fue él el que le inculcó ya que toda la familia trabaja en esto. Cuenta que Además se dedica a la artesanía fabricando por ejemplo frazadas, hamacas, colchas ya que su mamá es artesana. Nos comenta que su sueño es poder ser una gran comerciante y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hamacas, colchas, frazadas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
Señorita Amanda is from the city of Carapeguá.  She is 19 years old and single, and lives with her parents.  She has been working selling hammocks, bedspreads and blankets in the city of Formosa Argentina for more than four years.

She began working in this way when she was little, as her papa is a street vendor and it was he who instilled this work in her, as all the family work in this way.  She also works doing handicrafts, making blankets, hammocks and bedspreads, for example, as her mama is a craftswoman.  She tells us that her dream is to have a large business, and in this way be able to support her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of hammocks, bedspreads and blankets, with which she will be able to stock up and meet her customers' needs.  She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for this opportunity for progress that they are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks, bedspreads and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Sara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Sara, vive con sus dos hijos en casa familiar, ella tiene su negocio de productos básicos como: aceite, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, café instantáneo, jabón, champoo, ya tiene un año de tenerlo en su casa y debido a la demanda de sus clientes todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar su inventario y comprar los productos de primera necesidad como: jabón, detergentes, lejía, frijoles, azúcar, de esa forma podrá mejorar sus ganancias y tener más clientes.
El sueño de Sara es mantener siempre estable su negocio y cada día ir creciendo para ofrecerles variedad a sus clientes y  que su familia vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sara lives with her two sons in their own home. There she has a grocery store where she sells basic items such as oil, sugar, instant soups, instant coffee soap, and shampoo. She has had this grocery store for a year now and due to client's demands she works Monday through Sunday. She does not have a schedule of set working hours.

She will use the loan to increase inventory and purchase basic products such as soap, detergent, bleach, beans, and sugar to increase profits and have more clients.

Her dream is to maintain a stable business, expand it every day to offer clients better variety, and for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: buy soap, detergent, beans, sugar.

loans.name: Ognatan Group

texts.fr: OGNATAN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Félicienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Félicienne est veuve, mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Félicienne vit seule avec ses enfants, les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Félicienne. Pour cette raison, Félicienne vend du riz, des ustensiles de cuisine par la méthode de distribution depuis huit ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe OGNATAN, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et des ustensiles de cuisine.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a subcontractor at a construction firm. She and her company install floors in Hackensack, New Jersey. 

She will use this loan to purchase equipment so she can work more efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her construction company.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Living in a poor country where work opportunities are scarce has never been an excuse for Janet who has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years.Janet is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 21 years old and lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is blessed with two children who are her greatest motivation in life. She perseveres because she wants to provide a better future for them. Janet was unable to study to have a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. 

Janet has always had an affinity for farming. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her dairy cows. Her cows produce between 10-15 liters a day and this helps her support her family. Janet also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs. 

That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she will be able to purchase high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Janet is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production over the previous year and also build a modern house. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Janet believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Janet’s way out of poverty.
During this Christmas season you can change the life of Janet with a loan!

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Keang, who is 53 years old and married, has six dependent children, four of whom are studying. Residing in Kampong Thom province, Keang makes a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. She earns about USD15 per day and can save about USD6 each day after daily expense. 
She is now requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for daughter. She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to study Bachelor of Administration and to own a decent laptop.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees for her daughter studying Bachelor of Administration.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, a mother of 3 and age 28, is a used clothing vendor. She sells this clothing and generates some income to care for her children as she is a single parent. She has been trained by the staff in simple business and book keeping principles. She wants a KIVA loan of $625 to improve her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.en:
Norma has been making school uniforms for five years. Her husband’s income wasn’t sufficient and the lack of money to satisfy the family’s needs was one of her motivations to dedicate herself to this occupation. She started out with one sewing machine making just a few uniforms, but little by little she sold more and got more clients. Eventually she was able to buy another sewing machine and now she employs another person to help her meet the demand from her clients.

Now Norma requires a loan in the amount of $475, which she will use to buy more industrial sewing machines. With these new machines she hopes to quicken her production and continue growing as a small business owner. She needs your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business. She thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años, la señora Norma se dedica a elaborar uniformes escolares, el salario que su esposo recibe era insuficiente y la falta de recursos para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia fue uno de los impulsos que la motivaron a dedicarse a este oficio, ella empezó con una sola máquina y haciendo pocos uniformes, y poco a poco fue vendiendo más y consiguiendo más clientes, después le fue posible comprarse otra máquina y ahora tiene la ayuda de otra persona pasa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

En estos momentos, Norma requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizara para comprar máquinas de coser industriales con las que espera agilizar su producción y continuar creciendo como microempresaria, ella necesita de tu ayuda, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en: Khosiyat K. has been in trade since 1990. She started her business by selling the material for national dresses, but this kind of business required an assistant. At first, her children helped her, but then they entered high school. Therefore, she turned to an easier business. Previously, Khosiyat worked at the middle school for 24 years, and it is very important for her to educate her children. Her husband is a dentist, but unfortunately in Tajikistan it is still not a profitable job, so Khosiyat educated her children herself. Now Khosiyat has 8 grandchildren, and they are used to their granny buying them different kinds of sweets and toys.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
"I need to build a room on my house so that it will be more comfortable for my family because they made these houses with only 2 bedrooms, a kitchen and bathroom and we can no longer fit. In fact, one of my kids has to sleep on a couch because there's no space to put another bed." I'm asking for $1,000 to build a room.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito construir un cuarto en mi casa para que sea más cómoda para mi familia ya que esas casas las hicieron solo con 2 recamaras, la cocina y el baño y en realidad no cabemos de echo 1 de mis hijos tiene que dormir en un sillón por que no hay espacio para poner una cama más”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs.Jovita C. is 53 years old and is married to Mr. Arnulfo Robles. They have 5 grown children and come from a very humble family. Her mother used to work at the same line of business (butcher shop) and her dad use to work in construction.

Jovita has a small butcher shop where she exclusively sells cow's giblets ( intestines, tongue, liver, heart, etc.). With her work, she has been able to educate her children who actually study and work. The income generated by her business has not been enough to give her the possibility to invest on her home. She has applied for credits of the Fundacion Paraguaya before and was able to buy a truck that helps her sell her products in different cities.

Today, she is eager to acquire a new loan which she will like to invest in repairing her house. That way she can have a better selling location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jovita C. tiene 53 años está casada con el señor Arnulfo Robles, tienen cinco hijos mayores, provienen de una familia muy humilde, su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad y su padre se dedicaba a la construcción de obras. Jovita tiene una pequeña carnicería donde vende exclusivamente menudencia de vaca (tripas, lengua, hígado, corazón, etc.) Con su trabajo logro educar a sus hijos quienes actualmente estudian y trabajan , ya que los ingresos generados con su trabajo no le da la posibilidad de invertir en su vivienda, ella ha solicitado créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad, y con los que pudo comprar una camioneta con la que sale a vender sus productos en diferentes ciudades. Hoy día ella está deseosa de adquirir un nuevo préstamo que desea invertirlos en la refacción de su casa, para así lograr tener un salón de ventas mejor ubicado.

loans.use: Repair the infrastructure of her shop.

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan is 44 years old and is married. Her business is selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, snacks, eggs, etc. Aan usually earns $20 per day in profit. Her husband is a driver. He usually earns $1 per day, therefore she has to work hard to cover their daily needs.  She is a member of MBK and needs IDR 1,000,000 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Rosario is a cheerful and loving mother. She is a native of the city of Lima, but decided to reside in Juliaca for family reasons. Since she separated from her husband, she has looked for a way to bring up her 11-year-old daughter, Valeria, successfully. To do this, she decided to sell second-hand wallets, select merchandise that she brings from the city of La Paz, and offers them to her friends, neighbors and a large amount of clients. Additionally, she creates beautiful handicrafts which she hopes to continue working on with greater strength and intensity until she can open a large store. To materialize her plans Rosario is requesting this loan, which thanks to your generous heart she will be able to invest in her new project.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario, es una alegre y amorosa madre, es natural de la ciudad de Lima pero por cuestiones familiares decidió radicar en Juliaca. Desde que se separó de su esposo buscó la manera de sacar adelante a su hija Valeria de 11 años de edad, para esto decidió dedicarse a la venta de carteras de segundo uso, mercadería selecta que trae de la ciudad de la Paz y los va ofreciendo a sus amistades, vecinos y gran cantidad de clientes, adicionalmente realiza hermosos trabajos manuales, labor al que desea dedicarse con mayor fuerza y ahínco, hasta lograr tener una gran tienda de manualidades.Para concretar sus planes Rosario solicita un préstamo, que gracias a tu generoso corazón podrá invertirlos en su nuevo proyecto.

loans.use: Purchase capital for the production of her handicrafts.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal Z. and his wife (his wife is pictured) own and operate a hardware/home goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Jamal and his wife have raised three children here in Khachmaz and have been operating this store for the last three years. They are currently looking for funding so that they can increase and diversify their inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify their inventory stock.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Her perseverance, willingness and eagerness for a better future are Flor de Maria biggest characteristics. She's a mother of two young children. She has been through a lot of hard times including physical abuse from her first living partner. At that time, it was her first child, Juan who's now 10 years old, who gave her motivation to move ahead. With the savings she had, she decided to purchase a shoe sewing machine and opened a workshop where she put in practice everthing her father had taught her about sewing shoes. Thanks to her hard work, dedication and great workmanship, she has been able to manage a succesful business and was able to built her own house. After 8 years of being separated from her first partner, she decided to give herself a second chance at love. She thought she knew this person, but at the end it didn't work out. She did have a little girl from this relationship. Flor de Maria decided to give herself to her business and to try to make it even more successful.

She has hired 3 workers who give her all the support she needs while she takes care of all the distribution. Due to her huge motivation to move ahead and her huge clientele, she now realizes she needs to request for a loan. "Your assistance will be a good investment in the hands of this hard-working mother."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño, voluntad, y las innumerables ganas de superación de Flor de María, son sus principales características, ella es madre de dos pequeños niños, en el transcurso de su vida ha pasado por muchos momentos de privaciones y angustias, sufrió los maltratos físicos y posterior abandono de su primera pareja, desde entonces solo tenía una razón para progresar su pequeño niño Juan de 10 años.Con los ahorros que tenía decidió comprar una máquina de coser calzados para abrir su taller de fabricación de zapatos poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos de su padre en esta labor.Gracias a su esfuerzo, perseverancia, sus excelentes trabajos y novedosos modelos de calzados ha logrado tener éxito y ha podido construir su propia casita. Ahora después de ocho años de haberse separado de su primer compromiso decidió darse una segunda oportunidad, creyó conocer a la persona perfecta con el que tuvo una pequeña niña, desafortunadamente las cosas tampoco resultaron y después de este segundo episodio Flor de María está decidida a dar lo mejor de sí para seguir adelante con su pequeño taller de calzados. Poniendo en práctica su proyecto contrató a 3 trabajadores quienes le apoyan en la fabricación de sus hermosos calzados mientras ella se encarga de la distribución al por mayor.Sus inmensos deseos de progreso, la gran cantidad de clientes y el enorme número hacen necesario su solicitud de un préstamo. “Tu aporte desinteresado será una buena inversión en las manos de esta luchadora madre”.

loans.use: To purchase more basic material

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru:
Abduhakim Djumaevich G. lives in the Sharinav region in Tajikistan. He is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a High School education. He is a farmer. He owns a piece of land, on which he grows potatoes. When the potatoes are ready, he sells most of it on the market and keeps a small portion of the crop to provide for his family. This profit from the business is used to provide for the family as well as to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the next year. Abduhakim plans to use the loan to purchase high quality seeds and ferilizer. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гулов Абдухаким Джумаевич проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 47 лет, женат. Имеет 5 детей.Имеет среднее образование.Занимается земледелием. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Засеивает землю картофелем. Получаемый урожай использует для своей семьи и большую часть продает на рынке. Это дает доход для его семьи, часть которой он использует на жизнь , а остальную часть для посева в новом сезоне. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a cheerful woman who is much-loved by her family and in the workplace. She is originally from the district of Arequipa, but due to work issues, she now lives in the city of Juliaca. She finished her technical degree, but because of the lack of job opportunities, she is not able to put her profession into practice. A few years ago, she and her husband separated. Now, this diligent mother of a charming 8-year-old girl decided to sell party gowns and suits. Thanks to her patience and her wide selection of the most exclusive styles, her shop is now greatly frequented, allowing her to considerably improve her profits. Lidia plans on purchasing a greater variety of party accessories and exclusive gown and three-piece suit designs, with the aim of satisfying all of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia es una mujer muy alegre y querida dentro de su entorno laboral y familiar, es natural del departamento de Arequipa pero por cuestiones laborales radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, terminó una carrera técnica pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede desenvolverse.Hace algunos años se separó de su esposo y actualmente esta diligente madre de una encantadora niña de 8 años decidió alquilar un local y poner su tienda de alquiler y venta de vestidos y trajes para fiestas, gracias a la paciencia con la que atiende y a la selección de los más exclusivos modelos de vestidos con los que cuenta en su establecimiento, está siendo muy concurrida y visitada, permitiéndole mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.Lidia tiene pensado adquirir mayor variedad de accesorios para fiestas y diseños exclusivos de vestidos y ternos, con el fin de complacer a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase a greater quantity of apparel to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
When Luisa started her business a year ago, she was not certain about its future. At that time, she didn’t have access to capital, and she had invested all her money buying stock.

Fortunately, she received a loan from FSMA that allowed her to increase and diversify her inventory and move her business forward. Currently, Luisa offers a large selection of sheets, curtains, and shoes to buyers in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal.

Luisa explains that her business helps her to keep her four children in school. The entrepreneur hopes that if her business continues to grow, she’ll be able to buy her own house someday.

loans.use: To bed linens, window curtains, and other goods for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Click this link to view Yolanda's first loan

Yolanda is a member of the Village Bank Kutimuy which means "return" in Quechua.

Yolanda is married, 22 years old and has one child. She and her husband make milk products such as natural yogurts, ice-cream and babies' milk, which they sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Yolanda's business has grown little by little, and now has a very large production and variety of products.

Yolanda needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US725), which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, firewood and bags.

Yolanda's dreams are to formalize her business into a small manufacturing business, have a center of production, and to have her own house and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy sugar, firewood and bags.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
After completing high school, Cristina has achieved financial independence. This has turned her into a self-assured, diligent and hard-working woman who is prepared to succeed in life. At the young age of 22, Cristina currently earns most of her income from making fabrics. She began this work with the help of her aunt Inés, whom Cristina adores and thinks of as a second mother for the immense support Inés has provided at every opportunity.

Cristina is an intelligent woman with a strong will and dedication. By making the best use of her time spent between fabrics and books, she is pursuing her university education. She keeps in mind that the detail in her fabrics can become very complex and require hours of work. Critina is requesting a loan to have more working capital, which she will use to purchase a greater variety of wool. She also will continue realizing her talents with great skill and creativity in the form of her dress fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Su independencia económica desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios han convertido en una mujer segura de sí misma y de lo que está dispuesta a alcanzar en la vida a Cristina, joven diligente y trabajadora que a sus 22 años encontró en la arte de tejidos, su principal ingreso económico. Emprendió esta labor gracias al apoyo de su tía Inés, a quien quiere y considera como una segunda madre por el inmenso apoyo que en todo momento le brindó.

Cristina es una mujer inteligente que con voluntad y dedicación viene siguiendo estudios superiores aprovechando su tiempo al máximo y equilibrándolo entre los libros y el tejido, teniendo en cuenta que el detalle de estas prendas puede resultar muy complejo y demandar largar horas de trabajo. El préstamo que Cristina requiere le permitirá contar con mayor capital, dinero que lo invertirá en adquirir gran variedad de lana y seguir plasmando sus conocimientos con gran destreza y creatividad en sus prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Investment capital for purchase of selection of wool to continue weaving dress fabrics for sale

loans.name: Ni Made Indah Sutant

texts.id:
Made Indah Sutanti was still young when married to Nengah Koden. Since then Made Indah Sutanti was given capital to run the food stall and also the activities to increase family's income. Since capital was low, her items had no variations, and had very low volume. Through Traditional organiztion in her village, who is already included in Dinari foundation, Made Indah Sutanti obtained a loan. From this loan Made Indah Sutanti could expand the food stall by obtaining additional stall needs, and add several variation. From this business Made Indah Sutanti could obtain profit of Rp40,000-50,000. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). From this Made Indah Sutanti could help Nengah Koden income, and their 3 year old child. Her hope is that in future the business could expand and obtain increase income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Made Indah Sutanti masih dalam usia muda sudah dipersunting menjadi istri Nengah Koden.Sejak itulah juga Made Indah Sutanti diberi modal untuk mengurus warungnya sekalian menjadi kegiatan yang dapat menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Karena belum mempunyai modal usaha warungnya maka barang dangannya tidak bervariasi dan jumlahnya pun masih sedikit. Melalui Lembaga Adat yang ada di desanya yang sudah bergabung menjadi binaan Yayasan DINARI, Made Indah Sutanti mendapat pinjaman dana. Dari pinjaman dana ini Made indah Sutanti dapat mengembangkan usaha warung dengan melengkapi kebutuhan belanja warungnya, serta menambah berbagai macam variasi kebutuhan warungnya. Dari usaha inilah Made Indah Sutanti dapat memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 40.000.- s/d Rp. 50.000.- dari usaha inilah Made Indah Sutanti dapat membantu pendapatan Nengah Koden dan seorang anaknya yang masih berumur 3 tahun. Harapan kedepannya usaha ini dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memperoleh penghasilan lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To increase capital for additional variation in her food stall (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi variasi dagangan di warungnya)

loans.name: Telmith

texts.es:
La señora Telmith, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras y frutas como naranjas. Por las tardes vende juanes y asados en su casa. La venta de las verduras lo realiza en la ciudad de Tarapoto y en su misma comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de semillas como culantro y tomate para sembrar en su chacra. También comprará cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.

Telmith tiene 30 años. Es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y su meta es comprar un terreno en Tarapoto para poder construir su casa y más adelante vender abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ms. Telmith, member of the Communal Bank "Virgen del Pilar", lives in the Region San Martin, Province of Lamas, district of Zapatero and caserío of Nuevo Celendin. Ms. Telmith sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges. In the afternoons, she sells home made food from her house. Ms. Telmith sales vegetables in the city of Tarapoto which is within her community. With the loan of S/. 800, which she will pay in 6 months, Ms. Telmith will invest in the purchase of seeds such as tomato to plant and grow at her small farm Ms. Telmith will also buy hogs to then sell them. Ms. Telmith is 30 years old, and she is a hard-working woman with many desires to continue to prosper and her goal is to buy land in Tarapoto to be able to build her house and and in the future sell staple food.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pigs

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run T., 24, is married with two young children and lives in Phnom Penh. (Her husband is shown in the picture at their home.) They also support an elderly parent at home.

Run T. grows many kinds of vegetables at her home and makes around US $2.00 each day. Her husband sells sand and makes about US $3.00 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice and crops very high. Run T. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a water pump for irrigating her crops. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Nath

texts.en: Mrs. Nath A. lives in Poek village in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children; one attends the local school and the younger child is too young to attend school. She is a laborer and her husband, Mr. Kim Korn, is a farmer (pictured on the left). They own a plot of land and cultivate rice. They face a problem in their field because of poor soil. Thus, Mrs. Nath A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the field to make her crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the soil in the field to make the rice crop more productive

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves C. es cliente antigua de la institución, es bastante cumplida y trabajadora.Se dedica a la venta de comida en su zona, recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos y en su  venta. Con la compra de una licuadora y un horno, la señora  en alguna medida mejorará sus ingresos pues ampliará su gama de productos, se debe mencionar que es una familia muy unida y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nieves C. is an old client of the institution and she is very reliable and hard working. She works selling food in her neighborhood and she receives support from her husband who helps her in the preparation of the food and its sale. With the purchase of a blender and an oven she will improve her income as she will increase her range of products. It should be mentioned that it is a very united family and responsible in making payments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an oven, blender and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Together with his wife, Pavel intends to develop their business of pig-raising in Orhei town. They keep their animals in the yard of their house and also they store the necessary fodder there. So the purchase of fodder is the purpose of this loan from MICROINVEST.

Pavel does not have any experience in this field; his business is in the start-up phase. This is his first loan ever, not only with MICROINVEST. The future plan of this client is to increase the number of pigs and then sell them on the local market, but also to raise a new breed of pigs.

loans.use: to increase the number of pigs he raises

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 64 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y se siente en la responsabilidad de mejorar no solo su vida sino también la de su hija, con la que comparte el cuarto donde pasan sus días. Los 30 años que tiene Maria en el negocio de la venta de ropa, la han convertido en la vendedora más conocida de la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, su puesto es el más visitado por los clientes que buscan ropa de calidad a bajos precios, a los cuales siempre atiende de muy buen humor, ella es una vendedora por naturaleza y disfruta mucho haciéndolo, anhela para el futuro de su negocio, poner una tienda muy grande donde pueda surtir mejor las prendas que vende.
Maria tiene muchas dificultades consiguiendo ropa, ya que es muy exigente en sus pedidos, pero igual se las arregla para que no le falten los modelos más novedosos del mercado, para lograr sus metas esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho y no decae en su idea de salir adelante. Es el cuarto préstamo que adquiere Maria en MFP, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que siempre separa parte de sus ganancias para pagar sus cuotas, es muy respetada en su banco comunal, ya que es la socia de mayor edad. Con este nuevo préstamo, Maria planea incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería, invertirá los mil nuevos soles en la comprar ropa, para surtir mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Maria is a 64-year-old woman, very happy and hard-working, who lives in a rented room and feels responsible for improving not only her life but that of her daughter as well, with whom she shares the room where they spend their days. Maria has been selling clothing for 30 years which has made her the best-known retailer of the Sunday market in Juliaca. Her stall is the most popular with customers looking for good quality clothing at low prices. She is always pleasant with her clients, a natural-born saleswoman and she enjoys her role. Her greatest wish for her business is to have a very large store where she could better stock the clothes she sells. Maria has a hard time finding clothing as she is very demanding, but she always manages to have the most fashionable clothing in the market. In order to achieve her goals she is prepared to work hard and she clings to her idea of becoming prosperous. This is Maria's fourth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual in her repayments as she always sets aside a portion of her profits to repay her loan. She is very much respected in her community bank as she is the eldest member. With this latest loan, Maria will increase the amount of clothing she has for resale; she will invest 1,000 soles to buy clothing in order to better stock her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 47 years old and her business is hog fattening. She was in the business when she got married, but it stopped. As a widowed woman she needs to double her time in the business to give her children the best. Her initial loan from ASHI will be her starting capital to establish this business again.

She worked as cook in her neighborhood for additional income to cover the daily expenses of the family. She planned to have a piggery in the future and when it generates more income, then it will help for the studies of her youngest daughter in college.

loans.use: purchasing 2  piglets

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil A. is a 57-year-old butcher who sells meat in a small butcher shop.  He has worked there for the last eight years. Shamil sells mutton and beef, which are very popular among Azerbaijani people. Early in the morning farmers bring to his butcher shop sheep and calves, and at that point Shamil and his son begin their work day. Shamil always sells fresh meat which makes his shop very popular. Now Shamil would like to purchase a refrigerator for his store to keep meat cool during the hot time of the year.  Shamil, his wife, and their three children count on your help.

loans.use: purchase refrigerator

loans.name: Aurelia De

texts.es: La familia de Aurora está compuesta por cuatro personas, sus tres hijitos menores de edad y ella, toda la familia vive en casa que es propia. Aurora se dedica al comercio de frutas en su propio puesto que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado central de la localidad en la que vive. El nivel de competencia en este rubro es de término medio ya que hay otras personas que también se dedican al comercio de frutas. El crédito fue destinado para la ampliación de su vivienda con lo cual tendrá mayor espacio para que sus hijitos puedan dormir mejor. Respecto a su historial crediticio tuvo deudas anteriormente pero las mismas fueron canceladas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Aurora's family is made up of four members: her three young children and herself, and the whole family lives in their home owned by them. Aurora works selling fruit from her own stand, which is located in the central market in her neighborhood. The level of competition is about average since there are other fruit sellers in the market. The loan was targeted to expand her home to create space for her children to sleep better at night. Her credit history is such her past debts were all paid timely.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the house

loans.name: Toek

texts.en: Mrs. Toek S. is a villager in Phos village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Mun Tha, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Toek S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to drive and transport her vegetables to sell in the local market. She is 39 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive and transport her vegetables to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Ilinka

texts.en:
Ilinka was born in 1952. She comes from Karanovac, Petrovo, where she lives with her husband.

Ilinka and her husband, who is retired from his career, are very busy with farming, keeping pigs, and maintaining a nursery. They have two or three pigs, and these provide piglets every year, which Ilinka and her husband raise and sell. In addition, every season, Ilinka and her husband sell the vegetables they grow in their nursery. They have loyal customers for all the products they produce.

Ilinka has requested her first loan from MCF WWI in the amount of 1,500 KM, which she wishes to use to purchase more pigs. She hopes to find pigs at a low price so that she can buy more of them. The couple hopes to increase their income in this way, since they receive only a small amount from Ilinka's husband's pension.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es:
La señora Maria Asunción A. B. tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria completa,  tiene 2  hijos de 14 y 15 años, que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio se inicio hace 2 años,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en implementar su ferreteria la misma que su hijo lo administra en tacorita.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá  en implementar su ferreteria  y remodelar sus utencillos de cocina para la venta de su comida.
Maria tiene como sueño tener su ferreteria mas implementada para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Asuncion A. B. is 50 years old, and lives in the district of Esperenza, in the province of Trujillo, in the district of La Libertad, in Peru. Maria finished grade school, and has two children, a 14 and a 15 year old, who depend on her economically. Maria has run a business selling food out of her home for the past two years. She received her first loan of 300 soles from the community bank Bellavista II, and invested it in starting a hardware store like the one her son runs in Tacorita. She will invest this loan of 500 soles in fixing up her hardware store and getting better kitchen utensils for preparing the food that she sells. Maria dreams of further setting up her hardware store so she can grow as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fix up hardware store and buy kitchet utensils

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
