      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мархабо - женщина 38 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей.Закончила ВУЗ и по специальности работает таршим кулинаром в кондитерском и самбусочном цехе города Худжанда. Она вместе  дочерью Мухаё также поле работы работает на дому,она шьёт национальные платья.Хочет получив кредит купить вышивальную швейную машинку.На снимке сама Мархабо поле работы шьёт платье на заказ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Marhabo is 38 year old woman, she is married and has two children. She graduated from university and is working by profession as a senior chief in a confectionery and sambusa department in the town of Khujand. She and her daughter Muhayo together after work sew national Tajik dresses at home. She wants to take out a loan and buy an embroidery machine. On the photo Marhabo is after work making a custom dress.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Currently all her children are schooling. She has been a local manufacturer of soaps for three years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en: K. Rebecca is a businesslady who has been involved in the sale of fishnets to fishermen in Mukono District for over 10 years. She buys the nets in Uganda and, in most cases, delivers them to her customers’ homes – hence staying in close contact with them. Rebecca is a married lady and the mother of seven children, ages 8 - 20 years and all in school. She needs a loan to be able to buy more fishing nets since, whenever she buys in bulk, she is able to make more profits. This enables her to pay school fees for her children and for general upkeep.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets to sell

loans.name: Justa Marleny

texts.es:
La señora JUSTA MARLENY D. P., tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos de 14, 20, 11 y 12 años de edad,  quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
JUSTA  se dedica a la venta a la venta de salchipapas, hamburguesas, los fines de semana y tambien en las verbenas de los centros educativos o fiestas.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de una parrilla.
Este crédito de 900 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, bancos y utensilios de cocina para que pueda adecuar un espacio en su domicilio y poder vender diariamente sus anticuchos, salchipapas, salchipollos, etc.
JUSTA sueña con tener un restaurante en su casa para obtener mayores ganancias para poder educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: compra de mesas, bancos y utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Choeun A. is a young married womA. age 22, and she and her husband have one lovely young child. Choeun A. has owned a medium size farmland on which she plants rice. As another source of family income comes from her husband's running a taxi service; he pick up tourists who want to visit Angkor Wat Temple, or anywhere else in town. Choeun A.'s husband has always hired a neighbor's taxi at highest price to operate the good service he provides. He right now wants to own a taxi but he has not yet money to buy it since his family financial is just enough for his family's daily needs. He has told his wife about this and they have decided to seek a loA. from HKL for capital to buy a motor taxi(Tuk Tuk). With the owning taxi will help them to cut down the cost of hiring. Note: Choeun A.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motor taxi

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 45 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas a quienes les trata de brindar una educación de calidad para que sean buenos profesionales a futuro. Gracias a la venta de cosméticos pudo incrementar los ingresos económicos que percibe como docente. Ella  se inició como promotora de ventas de cosméticos hace cinco años y desde entonces se hizo conocida en la institución educativa donde trabaja, ya que sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, quienes le hacen numerosos pedidos. Vender es lo que más le agrada a Martha, pues ayuda a las personas a mejorar su imagen, pero lo difícil es realizar las cobranzas cada quincena, pues tiene que estar pendiente de sus clientes con el fin de no perjudicar su capital de trabajo. Sus planes a futuro son de abrir un espacio de belleza dentro de su casa, donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y adicionalmente brindar servicios de decoración, pues le gusta las manualidades y las decoraciones. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está muy comprometida con su banco comunal, donde es conocida como una persona responsable y solidaria. Los dos mil soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza con la finalidad de tenerlos en stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 48 years old. She and her husband Carlos have three children and are thankful for their harmonious relationship. Loreta runs a fruit vending business, selling bananas while her husband is busy in their rice fields. She believes that patience and humility are necessary in fulfilling life dreams.

Loreta hopes to fulfill her dreams by working hard in her business and improving sales activity through financial assistance from lenders amounting to PHP5,0000.

loans.use: Improvement to her fruit vending business

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
La socia Hipolita; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad la socia vive con su novio y tienes 4 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, ella vende ponches calientes de todo tipo, también inicio la venta de helados caseros, nuestra socia esta incrementando poco a poco su negocio y expandiéndolo; la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar una heladera.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido y agradece infinitamente esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Hipolita belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Communal Bank, which is located in the Andahuaylillas district five minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 34, and she lives with her fiancé. They have four children. She alternates her small business activities. She sells warm punches of all kinds. She also started selling homemade ice cream. She is increasing her business little by little and expanding it. She needs a loan to buy a refrigerator. She promises to make all of her payments on the established timeframe. She is infinitely grateful for this help.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M. is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed them on his property. 

His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Mahammad applied for 1606 AZN to buy animals so that he may breed them.

loans.use: Purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo quien, es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 4 hijos.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida al paso pero por las noches, ella es muy buena preparando salchipapas (salchichas con papas fritas) y pollo broaster (pollo frito con huevo batido y papas fritas). Para ello, Roxana acondiciona un espacio afuera de su vivienda, pues está ubicada en una zona bastante transitada, por lo que tiene muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es brindar una buena atención a sus comensales, para que se sientan satisfechos y regresen a su negocio. 
Su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante especializado en la venta de pollo a la brasa, llamado “pollería”.  

Con MFP ya tiene 13 préstamos, es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta es que sus compañeros son responsables y tienen una buena asesora de crédito que los incentiva a seguir adelante. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina, en ello invertirá 1500 soles; con lo restante mandará a construir un local más adecuado para su negocio, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roxana, 40, lives with her husband, who is a sales clerk, and her four children. For the past 4 years she has sold prepared food from a sidewalk stand at night. She is very good at preparing salchipapas (sausages with fried potatoes) and pollo broaster (fried chicken with scrambled eggs and fried potatoes). To do this, Roxana equips a space outside her house because she is located in an area with lots of foot traffic so she has a lot of customers. What she most likes about her job is to provide good attention to her diners, so that they will feel satisfied and return. Her wish for the future is to have a restaurant specializing in the sale of roasted chicken, called “pollería”. She has had 13 previous loans with MFP and is a member of a communal bank. What she likes about it is that her fellow members are responsible and they have a good credit advisor that motivates them to continue forging ahead. With the funds requested on this occasion she will buy new tables, chairs and cooking utensils. She will invest 1500 soles in that; with the remaining money she will have a more adequate site built for her business where she will be able to better attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and to build a site for her business.

loans.name: Silvia Yaquelin

texts.es: Silvia, se dedica a la comercialización de productos como el té, flan, gelatinas, refrescos y otros, viene trabajando hace 10 años en el rubro de forma autónoma desde hace 3 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y estudian y los otros 2 solo estudian y dependen de sus padres, los productos que comercializa los trae de la ciudad de La Paz ya que la distribuidora con la que trabajaba la señora Silvia se mudo para esa ciudad y es desde allá que hace traer sus productos. La comercialización de sus productos los realiza en los mercados de La Ramada y Primavera teniendo clientas fijas, también distribuye sus productos en algunas otras provincias como Montero y Guarayos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ya logro comprarse un terreno donde a construido su modesto hogar. en un futuro quiere que su negocio crezca mucho mas, para lo cual necesitara un vehículo mas grande, actualmente tiene una vagoneta corolla en el cual distribuye todos sus productos con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Silvia markets products such as tea, flan, gelatins, soft drinks, and other products. She has been working for 10 years and has managed her own business for the past 3 years with the support of her husband. Silvia has four children; two are working while the other two are students who are still financially dependent.

The products she markets have to be shipped in from the city of La Paz because her distributor moved to that location. Silvia distributes her products at “La Ramada” and “Primavera” Markets, which have established customers. She also distributes her products in some of the other provinces such as Montero and Guarayos. Through the efforts invested into her work, she was able to buy a piece of land where she plans to build a modest home. In the future, she wants to grow her business even more and purchase a larger vehicle. She currently drives a Corolla station wagon to distribute all of her products with the help of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Katusenvule Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
S. Isma is the leader of his group in Lugazi. He is a married man with five children, all of whom are in primary school. In total, he takes care of six dependants. 

For the past six years, Isma has been in the business of selling produce, mostly beans and maize from Buloba. He admits that his main challenge is not having enough capital, although he is trying to fight this with the help of loans. He is able to make 35,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) in weekly profits and, once he enlarges his business, he hopes to increase this amount.

Isma needs a loan to be able to buy more beans and maize for resale, since such transactions help his business expand. He has worked hard to win his customers’ trust. His major goal is to ensure that he is able to pay his children’s school fees to the highest level of education. He would also like to build houses for them as they grow up.

loans.use: Buying more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mourad

texts.en: Since 2000, Mourad has owned and operated a computer shop in his town.  He proudly explains that students visit his shop to do research and that the local children also like to play games at his shop.  Currently, Mourad is seeking a loan in the amount of $700 to buy internet cards and new game programs to attract more customers.

loans.use: To attract additional customers by purchasing internet cards and games

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es: Fulgencio es casado, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad de nombre Escarleth, la que habita en casa de su papá junto a su familia, conformada por su esposo y una bebita de 2 añitos, don Fulgencio labora en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza, esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC y espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva  para poder completar la construccion de un cuarto de 4 x 3 mts cuadrados en su casa y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Expresa que cuando termine de cancelar este credito solicitara otro para continuar mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Fulgencio is married and has an 18-year-old daughter, Escarleth. Escarleth and her family, composed of her husband and 2-year-old daughter, live with her parents. Fulgencio is employed by Juigalpa's mayor's office as a maintenance man. He is requesting his first loan from AFODENIC and hopes to have Kiva's support to finish building a 4x3 meter room in his house to improve his family's living conditions. He states that he will request an additional loan to continue improving his house when he finishes paying back this onel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 32 years old. She owns a shop where she sells rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for two years now. She also has a photocopying machine which she uses as part of her business activities to generate additional income. Joy hopes to expand her business in the future. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

Joy is married; her husband is doing well in his own business and they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of shoes and other items

loans.name: Mlandizi Kati Group

texts.en:
Sofia H., age 33, is married and has one daughter, who is 1 year old. She has a motorcycle spare parts shop in Mlandizi, which is about 50 kilometers from the city center. She has been in this business since 2000. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily.  From this business, she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $148.

This will be Sofia’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner.  She used the previous loans to buy more spare parts to increase her stock and has paid back the loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock still more.
	
Sofia will share this loan with her subgroup of  Mlandizi Kati group, which totals seven members. These members deal in selling vegetables, drinks and clothes and have shops and a boutique. The members of the same group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.  

In the picture, Sofia is the tallest lady.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah A. is thirty-nine years old, married and blessed with a son.  She sells cloth has been doing so for over two years.  Hadijah is using this loan to purchase more cloth to expand and increase sales.  She also offers tailoring services. Her hope is to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth to expand and increase the sales.

loans.name: Hadba

texts.en:
Hadba is a 34-year-old married man and the father of three children. In 2005, he opened a grocery store in his town in the Bekaa Valley. He decided to open his shop because he saw a need for such services in the region. His wife also helps him in his grocery store sometimes and, together, they pay for their family's expenses. He offers foods, such as dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, canned food, and candies, to his clients. 

Hadba is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to fill his shop with the needed merchandise to increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase mechandise.

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a widow who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns about USD$5 per day from selling fresh fish at the market. 

Mrs. P. has three children: one is now married and lives outside of family home, while the other two are no longer in school and are employed at different jobs. Since the current income of the family is not enough, Mrs. P. has a goal to buy a piece of farmland where she will plant different kinds of crops for extra income.

Her goal is not possible because she doesn’t have money yet. Therefore, Mrs. P. is looking for assistance from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $1,000 to be used to buy a neighbor’s farmland to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a neighbor’s farmland to grow crops.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata ,D. 60 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella vive en una alejada comunidad D.  la  selva cuzqueña, donD. tiene su casa que es propia.DesD. muy pequeña aprendió las técnicas agricolas necesarias para obtener una productiva cosecha, y  le quedó la idea D. tener su propio terreno D. cultivo. En la actualidad siembra cacao y noni(fruto con propiedades curativas) , ya que  para ella , son productos naturales que tienen mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Cada día se despierta desD. muy temprano, y se dirige  a su chacra para brindarle el cuidado respectivo; su horario D. trabajo comienza a las 8 D. la mañana y se extienD.  hasta las 6 D. la tarD. .Por lo general siempre contrata a peones que le facilitan el trabajo, sobretodo en tiempo D. cosecha, y comercializa sus productos  en el mercado D. su comunidad, y  obtiene regulares  ganancias.En el futuro desea instalar una tienda D. comestibles , pues desea tener mayor cantidad D. clientes .Este es el  cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP,  y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente , además agradece a su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tiene cada uno D. sus integrantes.Honorata tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en el  mantenimiento D.  sus plantaciones D. cacao y noni , y para lograrlo comprará abono e insumos, con la finalidad D. mejorar la calidad D. sus productos.
texts.en:
Honorata, who is 60, is married and has four children. She lives in a remote rain forest community near Cusco, where she has her own house. From an early age, she learned agricultural techniques necessary for a productive harvest, and retained the idea of having her own arable land. She is currently cultivating cocoa and noni (a fruit with healing properties), because she recognizes that natural products are in high demand, nationally and internationally. Every day she wakes up very early and goes to her farm to proviD. the necessary care; her work schedule begins at 8 am and runs until 6 pm. Usually, she hires laborers to carry out the hard work, especially at harvest time. Honorata sells her products in the local community market and gets regular earnings. In the future, she hopes to install a grocery store, in order to have more customers. This is her 4th credit with MFP, and Honorata promises to continue to make her payments on time. She also thanks the communal bank for the responsibility displayed by each of its members. Honorata plans to invest the loan in the maintenance of her crops, and to do so, she will buy fertilizer and other inputs, in order to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE AND FERTILIZER FOR THE CARE OF HER CROPS

loans.name: Irene Janeth

texts.es: Irene Janeth tiene 31 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene esta actividad, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sacrificarse para ganarse el pan de cada día. Sus inicios fueron muy duros ya que no tenía mucho apoyo de parte d su familia, pues no tenían el capital suficiente y es por medio de los financiamientos es que ha podido salir adelante, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar su condición económica. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jabón y sopas. Sueña con realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and has been running a general store for more than eight years and has always enjoyed working to earn her daily bread. It was difficult for her to get started, especially because she did not have her family’s support. They did not have the necessary capital, but she has used loans to help her get ahead. She has always concerned about getting ahead economically and will use the money from this loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, detergents, soap, and soups. She would eventually like to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells cloths and cosmetics in Abura. She is married to a security man. Adiza has received junior high education. She uses her income to help her spouse take care of the family.

Adiza will use this loan to purchase additional cloths and cosmetics to sell. Adiza plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloths and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene un puesto de venta  en la zona de bajo irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, donde vende azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc., al por menor.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, refrescos y otros al por mayor)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El análisis socioeconómico la califican para poder optar a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Julia has a sales stall in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz. There she sells sugar, rice, noodles, and more in small quantities. Her home is also located in the Irpavi area in La Paz. The loan will be used for working capital to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and other wholesale items. This is her first loan from IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner). Her good credit history qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, soft drinks, and other wholesale items

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is from the village of Luna. She is 52 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns a general store selling a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month. 

In 2006, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rebecca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 35 years old. She is married; her husband is a peasant. She has four children. Her children go to school.

Mary is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant. She is requesting a loan so she can stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide food and other essential needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Oyundalai

texts.en:
Oyundalai J. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest two daughters, aged 19 and 18, are university students while her youngest daughter, age 12, attends a local secondary school. 

Oyundalai operates a electron products repair service center, with help of her husband. She began her business next to a grocery shop in 2003. Since then, she has built a stable operation of repairing and performing maintenance on the local people’s electron products. She purchases her raw materials from Erlian, China's border city. Her business is in good spot in the area and she has become popular amongst her customers. They business earnings are the only source of family income. She has used her earnings to pay for her children's tuition fees and on household consumption. Oyundalai is a very modest and hardworking person and is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials and tools for her repairing center.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man with two children, both attending school. He lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and food.

Jonathan has been operating his motorcycle transport business (boda boda) for the last six months. His potential customers are passersby who need a ride.

Jonathan decided to work with Yehu so as to obtain a loan to boost his business. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to pay a deposit for the purchase of another motorcycle. He cites seasonality as a major challenge in his business. His major goal is to own a car in the future.

loans.use: To pay a deposit for the purchase of another motorcycle

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian S. is a 37 year-old green grocer.  She is married to Munyoki and they have four children aged 10, 13, 15 and 18 years-old respectively. Lilian has been operating a green grocery business for the past 14 years and her monthly income is Kshs. 25,000 which she uses to support six members of her family.

Lilian plans to increase the stock of her business and plans to purchase a bag of tomatoes, a bag of cabbages, a bag of onions and bananas. She intends to increase her stock with the profit expected from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to become a supplier of green vegetables in her home town.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes,onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Erika Esperanza

texts.es: Erika Esperanza ella tiene 34 años, es casada. La señora Erika se dedica a brindar el servicio de video juegos ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años, ella empezó por la necesidad de obtener un medo de ingreso para su hogar, ya que además que la mayoría de sus clientes son niños. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor controles, discos y reparar algunos nintendos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio bien establecido que puedan brindar mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: Erika Esperanza is 34 years old and married.  She works in video game services, which she operates out of her house.  She started this business 4 years ago and began it out of a need to earn an income to support her household.  The majority of her clients are children.  Her credit would be invested in the purchase of more controls, discs, and to repair some of the Nintendos.  Her dream is to have a well established business that is able to earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de verduras, granos y menestras en su domicilio, el negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso que le permitiera ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia y velar por la calidad de vida de sus padres, que son de edad avanzada. 

Este negocio es de mucha ayuda también para los vecinos de su caserío, ya que este queda muy alejado del pueblo central y ellos no tienen alimentos de primera necesidad al alcance de la mano. Debido a que la mayoría de vecinos de la zona son agricultores y reciben sus pagos los fines de semana ella ofrece sus productos al crédito y al contado, este sistema esta teniendo mucha acogida.

Rosaura ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva. Con ese crédito puedo ampliar su negocio adquririendo mercadería con lo cual pudo satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ahora ella desea seguir implementando su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con su negocio a través de Kiva, la ayuda recibida ha renovado sus ganas de salir adelante y progesar. En su comunidad ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada, sus vecinos la consideran una mujer trabajadora, responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 53 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in the village of Quemazón, a rural area in the district of Mórrope, in the province of Lambayeque, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosaura has been selling greens, grains and mixed vegetables in her home for several years.  The business was born of necessity as she needed to make an income which would allow her to help support her family and look after her parents' quality of life as they are elderly.

This business is also of great help to the neighbors in her village since the village is very far from the central town and they don't have basic foodstuffs in easy reach.  Owing to the fact that most of her neighbors are farmers who receive their wages at the end of the week, Rosaura offers them products on credit and for cash.  This system is very popular.

Rosaura has already had a loan financed by Kiva.  With this loan she will be able to elxpand her business, acquiring merchandise with which she can fulfil her customers' demands.  She wants to continue building up her business which is why she is requesting a new loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles which will help her to achieve her goal.

She is very happy and grateful to the people who are collaborating in her business through Kiva.  The help she has received has renewed her desire to get ahead and make progress.  In her community she is quite a well-know and respected person.  Her neighbors consider her to be a hard-working, responsible and trustworthy woman.  Her greatest wish is to be able to provide her parents with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her home-based sales business

loans.name: Ada Francis

texts.es: Ada Francis tiene 37 años. Su actividad es la elaboración y venta de bloques. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, ya que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda.  Sus Padres eran los que anteriormente se hacían cargo del negocio lo cual ha sido de gran provecho, así lograron enseñarle este medio de vida a su hija, Ada tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. La mayoría de sus productos los vende de contado, la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su negocio por que ofrece sus productos a un precio favorable. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como arena, piedrín, cemento, ladrillos entre otros.
texts.en: Ada Francis is 37 years old.  She has a business making and selling concrete blocks.  She has had this business for more than 10 years.  She has been working with the Fundación for 10 years, and the loans have been a great help to her.  Her parents were previously in charge of this business, which has been a great benefit to her, and so she taught this trade to her daughter.  Ada has 2 dependent children.  She sells most of her products on a cash basis, and most of her customers come to her business because she offers her products at a favorable price.  This loan is to buy raw materials such as sand, stones, cement, bricks, and other items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. Eight years ago, he quit school and started working as a janitor with his father‘s friends. After getting the experience that he wanted, he began working independently on a freelance basis. He needs to develop his business, so he is asking for a loan of $1200 from Ameen s.a.l., a Kiva field partner, to improve his business and purchase more of the tools and supplies he needs. In the future, he plans to continue expanding his business and start taking home projects.

loans.use: To improve his janitorial business and purchase more tools and supplies

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El señor Sixto tiene 49 años de edad, se dedica en la venta de colchas (venta en forma ambulante) en la zona de Capiatá y Alto Paraná; tiene clientela formada y quiere solicitar el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías mediante la compra de colchas, sabanas, toallas y otros.
 Esta temporada de fin de año es una buena oportunidad para colocar sus mercaderías y así incrementar sus tarjetas de cobranza.
 El cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1999 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito. Tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sixto is 49 years old. His work is selling bedspreads (which he sells as a mobile vendor) in the area of Capiatá and Alto Paraná. He has a steady customer base and would like to request the loan to increase his stock of merchandise, through the purchase of bedspreads, sheets, towels and other items. 

This season at the end of the year is a good opportunity to place his merchandise and thus increase his receivables. This client has worked with the Paraguaya Foundation since 1999 and has an excellent credit history. He has his own home, and he needs to increase his income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Buying bedspreads, sheets, towels and other merchandise

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province is the location of this six member group loan. Mrs. N. S. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She is also a fisherman. In the rice field, she has a problem because it is time for rice growing and she needs some money to support this. So, to improve production, Mrs. N. S. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed. She is a widow with two young children aged 1 and 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Inés; ella tiene 63 años de edad, casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes la socia vende todo tipo de productos entre ellos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia lleva años en este negocio y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante y se siente feliz ya que este negocio le trae muchas satisfaciones y aparte la socia cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes como golosinas, fideos, productos de primera necesidad entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Inés is 63 years old, married, and has six children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells all types of products, including basic needs items like rice, sugar, and milk. She has been in this business for years and it is how she gets her family ahead. She is happy because this business brings her a great deal of satisfaction and she also has the help of her children.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more products for her business such as sweets, pastas, basic needs items, etc. so that she can have more variety to offer to her customers.

Inés is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her business such as sweets, pastas, basic needs items, etc. so that she can have more variety to offer to her customers

loans.name: Dominga De Los Angeles

texts.es: Dominga De Los Ángeles tiene 50 años, su actividad es la venta de carne, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida, con muy poco capital de trabajo pues su con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Ella solicita este medio de vida para la compra de pollo, huevo y carnes. Sueña con mantener siempre activo su medio de vida.
texts.en: Dominga de los Angeles is 50 years old and she has a butcher shop. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She started this business with very little working capital but with a great deal of effort she has been able to succeed. She has always enjoyed to work and to support her family. She requests this loan to purchase chicken, eggs, and meats. She dreams of always having an active lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, eggs, and meats.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He has been doing car bodywork for so long that he has good experience in this field. In 2007, Haidar opened his own workshop. Now he is well known and has an excellent reputation.

Haidar is requesting a $2400 loan to install a new ceiling and shutters for the shop. He is aiming to develop and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install a new ceiling and shutters

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Loice faces the major challenge in her business of the high cost of transporting charcoal. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina P. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Merlina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Merlina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa nació en la ciudad D. Cusco (Capital Arqueológica D. América), ella tiene 58 años D. edad y vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació. Nicolasa tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes en su domicilio donD. venD. productos  D. primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nicolasa pertenece al banco comunal “Conzume III” D. la Asociación Arariwa y ya son varias veces que se presta crédito pero en esta oportunidad Nicolasa requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital D. negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Nicolasa was born in the city of Cusco, which is known as the archaeological capital of the Americas. She is 58 years old and lives in the same city where she was born.

Nicolasa has a small grocery store in her home where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items. She has already been in this business for three years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Nicolasa is a member of the Communal Bank “Conzume III”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has requested loans on several occasions. For this opportunity, Nicolasa needs a loan to increase her business capital. She wants to buy more merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other products.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Alpha P. Bangura's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the RC Primary School, Boys Junior in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1973 by the Roman Catholic Mission to educate the children of Lunsar and it environs. Presently, the school has 15 teachers and 636 pupils.
This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.
Alpha P. B., aged 58, is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. Born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, Alpha now lives and works in Lunsar. He has been in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He is a widower and has seven children – five adults and two attending secondary schools. Mr B. has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy house-building materials. Your loan will go a long way in helping Alpha build a dwelling house, as he is in dire need of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials

loans.name: Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Milagros De Los Ángeles posee un negocio que es venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante, que desde hace 20 años realiza. Ella comenzó con muy poca ropa para poder mantener a sus hijos, con esfuerzo alcanzo a comprar más mercadería y fue así que obtuvo una gran variedad de clientes.  La compra de su mercadería es de contado específicamente en el mercado de Managua pues es aquí donde resulta mucho más favorable. El crédito que está solicitando es para invertir más en su negocio como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes para niños y faldas.
texts.en: Milagros de los Ángeles has had a business selling used clothing on foot for the past 20 years.  She started with very little clothing in order to be able to support her children.  With effort, she was able to buy more merchandise, thus acquiring a great variety of customers.  She buys her merchandise using cash at the Managua market, as she gets better prices there.  The loan requested is to further invest in her business with the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and dress clothes for children.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and dress clothes for children.

loans.name: Pablo Bismarck

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua el señor Pablo tiene el compromiso de velar por el bienestar de su familia por lo que labora a diario con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar. El señor Pablo requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda como levantar una pared que está en mal estado y para esto requiere la compra arena, bloque, cemento, hierro y el pago de la mano de obra. Para comprar estos materales des construcción ha solicitado el crédito esperando le sea otorgado y de esta manera llevar a cabo la obra de construcción.
texts.en: In the city of Managua, Pablo is committed to improving the well being of his family and for that reason works every day with the goal of sustaining his home. He wants to improve his living conditions. In particular, he wants to erect a wall that's in poor shape, which will require the purchase of sand, concrete block, iron rods and will also require labor costs. To buy these construction materials, he has asked for a loan, which he hopes is given and will thus enable him to complete this project.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 55 años es viuda y vive con su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más 10 años y medio tiene su propio negocio, que es su fuente principal de ingresos, es así que posee una tienda donde vende, frutas, dulces y alfalfa en un local que alquiló y que se encuentra cerca de su casa. Su hijo es quien más la apoya en el negocio, ya que durante las mañanas es cuando hay más ventas y sola no se abastece para abastecer a toda la clientela. Las ganancias que acumula al final del día ella los administra para derivarlos en los gastos de su casa así como en volver a invertir en su negocio. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, le hace ser una persona independiente y por ello anhela aumentar su negocio con más productos. Ante esto, pide de su colaboración para que pueda intensificarse en su trabajo y ganar más dinero. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, y esta muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque comparte experiencias con sus demás compañeros del grupo a las cuales considera que son de su confianza, por lo que esta muy animada de continuar adelante con su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de frutas y dulces.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 55, is a widow living with her son in her own house.  For over ten and a half years she’s had her own business which is her main source of income.  She has a store where she sells fruit, candy and alfalfa in a rented locale located near her house.  Her son is her main help at work since sales are highest in the morning and she can’t tend to all the customers by herself.  She administers her daily profits channeling them toward household expenses or to reinvest in the business.  She enjoys her work very much.  It makes her an independent person and because of this she wants to expand the business with more products.  In light of this, she’s asking your collaboration so that she can intensify her work and earn more money.

This will be loan #5 with MFP and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank because she shares experiences with her fellow group members who she considers are worthy of her trust.  Because of this she is motivated to continue forward with her commitment to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy fruit and candy.

loans.use: to buy fruit and candy to stock her business.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran comes from a small village in the Abasha District. This district is well-known in the country for maize and nut growing. Amiran is 37 years old and a farmer. He lives in the village with his parents, who are retired and actively involved in the family agricultural business, which is the primary source of the income for them. 

Amiran has one bull and a milk cow, which gives them approximately 20 kg of cheese per month. It is sold to local dairy product retailers. They also have nut trees and sell 180-200 kg nuts per season. Two hectares of family-owned land are used for maize growing, where in total eight tons of maize is harvested. Half of the harvested maize is sold to local retailers and the rest is used in the dairy farm. On another two hectares of land the family grows four tons of musk-melon and 20 tons of watermelons. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

With the requested loan Amiran plans to purchase fertilizers for the melon garden. According to his estimation, after proper fertilization he will get six tons of musk-melon and 25 tons of melons for the season. It will mean an approximate 20% increase in the family's income 

Amiran plans to use the increase in income to renovate their house, as well as to purchase a mini-bus, which will work in West Georgia for transportation of people between nearby towns. It will bring additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers for a melon garden

loans.name: Lemondoi

texts.en:
Lemondoi is 44. He is married and has seven children.

He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to settle the loan and expand his farming. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses.

He is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alba Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alba, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las prepara en su casa y sale a ofrecerlas casa por casa, este negocio le ayuda a mantenerse y poder contar con lo necesario para subsistir.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz y gas, pues son sus principales materiales para ejecutar el trabajo, con esta compra estará mejorando su servicio y producción para los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar las ventas, proveer para sus hijos lo necesario y en un futuro contar con su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente alquilan.
texts.en:
Alba lives with her family; she has two children who are 14 and 8 years of age.  She sells home-made tortillas that she goes out to sell door to door.  This business helps to support herself and to have what’s necessary to survive.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn and gas because they are the main supplies she needs to do her work.  With this purchase she will be improving service and production for her customers.  Her goal is to improve sales, provide what’s necessary for her children and, in the future, have her own house since she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy corn and gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 55 años edad, tiene seis hijas (cuatro son independientes y dos son dependientes) Julio nació en la ciudad de Huayopata (La Convención, Cusco). La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.

Actualmente, Julio vive en la ciudad Echarate y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Julio es un hombre trabajador, responsable, amable y trabaja como albañil en la municipalidad de Echarate en el área de obras. Julio tiene un negocio familiar con su esposa que consiste en la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad Julio requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, verduras, carne y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Julio is 55 years old and he has six daughters (four are economically independent, and two depend on him). Julio was born in the town of Huayopata (La Convención, Cusco). The town of Echarte is the capital city of the Echarte district, located in the La Convención province. It is an important business center for the Lares and La Convención’s valleys. The main activity is growing products such as fruit trees, coca leaves, coffee and cocoa.

Julio lives in the town of Echarate, where he engages in his economic activities. Julio is a nice, responsible and hardworking man working as a mason for the construction department of the Echarate municipality. Julio runs a food selling activity with his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used to by products such as rice, vegetable and meat.

loans.use: Tpo buy products such as rice, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong was born in 1968. She lives in Xom Vang village with her husband and two children. Her husband is a worker. He has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). Mrs. Phuong works in Thang Long industrial. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to have more income and so she wants raise pigs. Since 2006, she has joined in SEDA. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Kicwamba Tukore Group

texts.en:
A one-track-mind inclination and failing to think outside the box in a business as competitive as carpentry is a recipe for a crisis or failure. One has to be innovative, open-minded and have the ability to make decisions independently and under pressure to make progress. That's from the perspective of 46-year-old David, a been there, done that, down-to-earth father of four buoyant kids who plies his carpentry trade in Rukungiri. He has been in this business for close to 20 years.

David makes an array of timber products at his workshop, such as chairs, tables, desks, sideboards, etc. He, at length, resells most of his products to his clientele, new and old alike. The good quality of his products has won him laurels. He has been able to consolidate on his achievements in the past 16 years, albeit with hard work and determination.

Farming is his other side source of income. As a matter of fact, David says he took root in his carpentry business with savings from his farming business. This business' gross monthly sales revenue is the sum of Uganda shillings 250,000. David says he intends to use this Kiva Loan to purchase more timber for use at his workshop. He anticipates being able to make more of the aforementioned wooden products to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to use at his workshop.

loans.name: Migambi Group

texts.fr:
Concilie est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la localité de Bukirasazi. Elle fait le commerce des produits de boutique comme le sel, la farine, le haricot, le savon,etc depuis 16ans. Elle a commence ce métier après sa sortie d’école. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 550,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits de boutique(sel de cuisine,farine,haricot,savon) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« MIGAMBI».
texts.en:
Concilie is a 32-year-old shopkeeper who lives in the middle of the country in Bukirasazi. She has been selling small products, like salt, flour, beans, soap, etc. for 16 years. She started doing this after she left school. She attended school until the 6th grade. She is married and a mother of four, three of whom attend elementary school. The Kiva loan of 550,000 Burundi francs that she is getting will allow her to increase her means to buy large quantities of small products (salt, flour, beans, soap) for resale to make a good profit.
She is a member of the Migambi group.

loans.use: to increase her means to buy large quantities of small products (salt, flour, beans, soap) for resale to make a good profit.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a security man. She buys fresh fish from the market and comes home to fry them for resale at Kukwa. Some kenkey sellers, instead of buying fish to fry themselves, sometimes prefer to buy from people like her to sell with their kenkey. Some kenkey sellers also, because of the stress accompanied with frying of the fish, will to buy from someone like Aba. 

Aba also wants to increase her sales by acquiring a loan of GHS 500 (Ghanian Cedi) to be able to meet the demands of her customers. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to feed the family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to fry, to sell.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita has had a sewing business for almost 20 years. She is 62 years of age and married. Though sometimes she may feel too old to have this business still she enjoys sewing different kinds of clothes for kids, women and men. According to her, she could improve their standard of living through her business. 

She would like to buy additional garments and threads needed in her sewing business but her income goes to their household expenses and payment for electric bills, so that's why she is requesting a loan in the amount of P10,000. With this loan, she could improve the quality of her finished products so that she could sell them at a higher price. She hopes that she can encourage more customers to have a dress made by her.

She believes that through her hard work she could uplift her family's life-style into a better living standard, and she could save some for security purposes for when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy garments and threads needed in her sewing business

loans.name: Loyama Group

texts.en:
Musu  is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Kenema City 30 years ago. Musu is married to a businessman and the couple has 3 children. For many years now, Musu has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. 

This is the first loan that Musu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Musu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. she will buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de ciudad del Este, está integrado por 16 mujeres, las cuales se encuentran trabajando en el cuarto ciclo. Todas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos para sus familias y de esa forma poder darles un mejor futuro.
Una de las miembros es la señora  Lilian, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella, es decir, ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Dice que por medio de su trabajo logra ayudar a su familia y a la manutención de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, con lo cual podrá aumentar su variedad y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This is committee is from Ciudad del Este.  It is made up of 16 women who are now working on their fourth loan cycle.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city.  They got together with the goal of earning more income for their families and thereby being able to give them a better future.

One of the members is Lilian.  She sells vegetables for a living.  She says she has many customers who always buy from her.  In other words, she already has a solid clientele.  She says that her work allows her to help her family and to keep up her house.  

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables, which will allow her to increase the variety of what she sells and satisfy her customers.  She thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunities they have given her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, D. 63 años, es una mujer ejemplar. Hace 36 años murió Claudio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero ahora ella vive sola en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito del Tambo. El trabajo que se dedica desD. más D. 30 años. Es la venta D. ropa variada, en especial D. niños. Pues tiene mayo demanda y ya es conocida en ese rubro. Cuenta que sale a las diferentes ferias que se realiza en la ciudad D. Jauja, donD. ella viaja una vez por semana. Pero la temporada donD. tiene más clientela, es en navidad, durante la feria por fiestas que se apertura en la calle principal D. la ciudad D. Huancayo. Ahí llega a ganar el doble D. lo que invirtió por ello siempre espera ansiosa esa temporada. D. la misma forma, venD. bebidas típicas los fines D. semana en el mercado mayorista y alquila cuartos en su casa; D. esta manera tiene ingresos extras. Ahora su objetivo es dejar algo para sus nietos, cuando ella ya no este entre ellos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimotercer crédito con MFP,  donD. espera D. su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Cristina D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. ropa para venderla en las festividades por navidad.
texts.en: Cristina, 63, is an exemplary woman whose husband, Claudio, passed away 36 years ago.  They had seven children but now she lives alone in her own house in the Tambo district.  For over 30 years she has been selling clothing, especially children's clothing, for which there is more demand and she is better known.  She travels to the different fairs in the city of Jauja every week.  But the Christmas holiday is when sales peak, during the Christmas fairs on main street in the city of Huancayo.  She earns twice as much profit so she is always anxious for the season to arrive.  She also sells typical beverages on weekends in the wholesale market and rents out rooms in her house for extra income.  Now her goal is to leave something for her grandchildren for when she is not around.  She belongs to the communal bank "IDME" and this is her 23 loans through MFP.  She is counting on your support so she can continue toward reaching her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  Cristina plans to use the loan to buy clothing for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maris

texts.en:
Maris is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Maris has a shop where she sells timber & lumber in different sizes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of timber to sell.

Maris has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maris hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, D. 59 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, esta casada con su esposo con quien es madre D. cuatro hijos a quienes educo y crió, ellos ya son mayores y tienen familia propia, pero aun así comparten mucho con ella, tiene una casa propia en compañía D. su hija que aun tiene 35 años, su pareja vive en la chacra en donD. se dedica al sembrío y cosecha D. algunos productos. El trabajo D. Juliana consiste en la venta D. aguaje, ungurahui, camu camu, además en algunos productos procesa la materia prima y los convierte en derivados como masa D. aguaje y masa D. ungurahui, con estos productos realiza muchas cosas, entre ellas venD. alguna parte en la cuidad en el mercado y otra parte envía a la ciudad D. Lima en donD. sus productos son muy esperados ya que siempre tiene buenos clientes que están en espera D. sus buenos productos. Además trabaja  vendiendo chontas y pijuayo que también envía a la ciudad D. Lima, lleva con este trabajo 35 años y lo hace sola ya que siempre trabajó así, le va muy bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos y venD. bien, al principio era difícil poder enviar a la ciudad D. Lima por el mal estado D. las carreteras que hacían el viaje muy largo, pero ahora lo hace tranquila pues la carretera permite un envío rápido. Su plan es seguir creciendo y cada día poder avanzar mas y mas. Este será el sexto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera D. su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas D. cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos regionales ya que la demanda D. los mismo está creciendo mucho y debe aumentar la producción para su envío.
texts.en: Juliana, 59, is a good, kind and very responsible woman.  She is married and has four children who are now adults and have their own families, but still spend much time with her.  She has her own house and lives with a 35-year-old daughter.  Her husband lives on the cropland where they grow produce.  Juliana's work consists of selling aguaje, ungurahui, and camu camu, as well as products maD. from these raw materials such as aguaje pulp and ungurahui pulp.  These products can be used to make many things and she sells some of them in the city market.  The rest is sent to Lima where there is a high demand because there are many customers waiting for these good products.  She also sells chontas and pijuayo which she sends to Lima.  She has been in business for 35 years and works alone.  She has a good income because sales are good.  At first it was difficult to send goods to Lima because of the bad conditions of the roads which maD. trips very long.  But now the road can be used for express shipments.  Her plan is to continue growing and advancing day by day.  This is her sixth loan through MFP and she is counting on your support to she can reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She enjoys being a part of the commuanl bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  She plans to use the 1,500 PEN to buy regional products because demand is growing and she must increase her shipments.

loans.use: To buy jungle region fruits.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa nació en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo pero vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 26 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.  

Elisa desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a  la agricultura y ganadería, ella también se dedica a elaborar jora de maíz para hacer chicha de jora. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Elisa requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz.  
 
Elisa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Elisa pertenece al banco comunal “Pinkulluna” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Elisa was born in the city of Ollantaytambo and lives in the city where she was born. She is 26 years old, married and has two children from this relationship.

Elisa carries out her daily and business activities in the city of Ollantaytambo. She works in agriculture and farming, she also makes a traditional corn liquor from her the corn. She has been working in this business for 10 years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She needs the loan to buy corn.

Elisa is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this channel and is committed to fulfilling her payments according to the schedule. Elisa belongs to Asociación Arariwa's Communal Bank "Pinkulluna" in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Mónica Mirelly

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por su gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer.
  
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mónica, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  19 y 8 años de edad, el menor estudian en escuela y ambos aun vive con ella ya que el mayor es especial y requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo es empleado público.

Ella trabaja en una  empresa en la ciudad de Manta y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en su casa y también vende en su lugar de trabajo. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 15 días, su mercadería la compra en Manta, Guayaquil o Huaquillas según lo que necesita para vender.  Lleva más de 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

 Su sueño es darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Palabra de Mujer" meets every 15 days in the "15 de Septiembre" neighborhood of the city of Manta, a place that is known for beautiful beaches that attract national and international tourists in every season of the year.  Manta is known for its warm climate, cuisine, and many tourist attractions.

Here we meet Monica, who is 40 years old.  She is married, and she and her husband have two children aged 19 and 8.  The youngest is in school and both of them live with her, since the older child has special needs and requires a lot of care.  Her husband works for the government. 

Monica works in a company in the city of Manta, and she also has a business selling all types of clothing.  She makes most of her sales from her house, and she also sells at her place of work.  She sells on credit, and collects every 15 days.  She buys her merchandise in  Manta, Guayaquil or Huaquillas, depending on what she needs for her sales.  She has been working in this business for 5 years, and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because the loans have been very helpful to her. 

Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Yesica Walesca

texts.es:
Yesica Waleska de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 3 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia, su esposo trabaja como operario de maquina en una maquila, vive en una aldea del Negrito, Yoro.
Yesica  ha sido una persona muy  habilidosa, pues hace 6 meses  decidió establecer su propio negocio de sala de belleza. Ella realiza trabajos de belleza en la comunidad, hace cortes, peinados, tintes, alisados, manicure y pedicure.  Actualmente esta solicitando L.5, 000.00 de  préstamo para suplirse de producto como tintes, cremas, quita esmalte y una secadora de pelo. Ella es muy conocida  por la gente de la comunidad y la prefieren por su buen trabajo que realiza. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener ingresos y darles un mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yesica Waleska, 32, is married and has two children who are 13 and 3 years old.  One of them attends school and her husband works as a machine operator at an assembly plant.  She lives in the village of Negrito, Yoro.

Yesica has been a very skilled person because six months ago she decided to open her own business: a beauty salon.  She provides beauty salon services in the community.  She does haircuts, hair styling, hair coloring, hair straightening, manicures and pedicures.

She is currently asking for a L.5,000.00 loan to stock up on products like hair color, cream, nail polish remover and for a hair dryer.  She is very well known by people in the community and they prefer her because of the good job she does.  Her goal is to make the business grow to earn income and provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela, de 30 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de Artemio, su esposo desde hace 6 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Jefferson, al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chalampampa. Junto a su esposo se dividen las actividades que tienen que desarrollar. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, gracias a sus terrenos propios, que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo, pueden sembrar papa, olluco, habas y alverja. Cuenta que en temporadas de siembra grande, alquilan terrenos para continuar con sus sembríos. Pues llevan a comercializar sus cosechas a la capital del país, donde existe mayor demanda. De igual manera, se dedican a la comercialización de ganado, como: vacas, ovejas y cerdos, los que cuida con mucho esmero; ya que depende de su peso y calidad, puede obtener mejores ganancias. Ahora su principal objetivo, es comprarse más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Carlos” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.
