Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Carmela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Carmela, 30, is a tenacious woman.  She lives with Artemio, her husband of six years, and they have a son: Jefferson, who they care for in their own house located in Chalampampa.  She and her husband share the activities they have to carry out.  

Her main economic activity is farming.  She owns land that they acquired with much effort that they grow potatoes, olluco [a tuber], lima beans and peas on.  She relates that during seasons of large-scale planting they lease land to continue with their planting because they take their crops to the nation’s capital to sell where demand is higher.  They also are merchants of livestock like cows, sheep and pigs that she cares for with much dedication since their weight and quality depend on it and she can earn better profits.  Now, her main objective is to buy more farmland.

She belongs to the “San Carlos” communal bank and this is her 8th loan with MFP where she is very happy because she’ll have financial support and will thus feel sure to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her installment payments.  She enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible, supportive people.  If Carmela were to receive your support, she’ll use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her potato and olluco crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Claudia Leticia

texts.es:
la joven sra. Claudia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos. Claudia se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado,  tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en la calle del comercio,  lugar muy estratégico en donde transitan muchas personas de diferentes aldeas y caseríos, lo que le permite tener una muy buena clientela, El credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y zapatos.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
su meta es graduar a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Claudia, 25, lives in a common law marriage and has two sons. 

Claudia has been working as a retailer for more than three years. She has a clothes and shoe shop located in the main street, a very busy place where people of different village and farmhouses go to. Therefore, she has a great clientele.

She uses her income to provide for her family. Her dream is to have her sons graduate in order to become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Rabindra

texts.en:
Rabindra  is a 37 years old differently abled person from a village of Puri district,Odisha,India. He is a married man with a family of five.He is a man with strong will power and for this reason he has never looked back in life.He faced each and every adversities with great courage.He runs a cyber cafe where he has computer systems with internet facility and he also provides xerox services. Due to his good behavior and timely service he has a pretty good amount of customers.

Rabindra  is requesting for a loan amount of 25,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to purchase a digital camera and remodel his shop so that he can offer studio services to his customers.This will enable him to gain a larger customer base and increase his income.Rise in income will help him in having a better standard of living and provide better educational facilities to his only son.

Rabindra is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera and remodel his shop

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.en:
My name is Maria Elba C., I am a businesswoman with a store selling new clothing in the center of my city. I have dedicated myself to this business for years because it gives me income to cover my family\\\'s expenses. Now I need to supply my business because in this season my sales volume is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Maria Elba C., soy comerciantes cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicada en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy pants for women, men and children, skirts, childrens clothes, mens t-shirts, womens blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Esmer

texts.en:
Esmer is a 37 year old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married and has a child. 
Her main source of income is farming where she grows vines.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought seedlings to begin vine-growing.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos has a store where he sells clothes and cosmetics. He started this business with $300 he saved from a previous job. He invested in clothing and sold his products door-to-door while saving up to construct a store in his home. He hopes to use the loan as investment capital to purchase clothes and cosmetics at more affordable prices. He lives with his wife and two children in a wooden house that is in the process of being rebuilt with cement. He is optimistic about the future and his possibilities of continuing growth.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics at more affordable prices

loans.name: Pedro Marcos

texts.es:
Pedro is a young entrepreneur who started his own business selling tacos four years ago as a way to help his mother. With hard work and a lot of effort he has succeeded in growing his business, thanks to daily improvement in the good quality of the service and products he offers his clients.. Pedro is now married and has 2 small sons. They have been his motivation for continuing to improve and grow his business.

To cover current demand from his clients, Pedro is requesting a loan of $375 which he commits to repay within 6 months. He will use the $375 to buy the furniture and utensils he needs for his business. With your help, Pedro will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to grow his business. He appreciates the opportunity your support offers him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro es un joven emprendedor que inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace cuatro años, ayudado de su madre y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer, gracias a la buena calidad del servicio y productos que ofrece cada día su clientela es mayor. Ahora Pedro está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, ellos han sido su motivo para continuar mejorando y creciendo con su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Pedro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, los empleará en la compra de muebles y utensilios que necesita para su negocio. Con tu ayuda Pedro mejorara la calidad del servicio que ofrece y continuara creciendo, él agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda.

loans.use: Remodel his taco stand

loans.name: Martina Ernesto

texts.pt:
Martina is married and mother of 2. Her husband is a miner and works in a neighboring country. Martina cares for her children and home. She joined the credit program in 2006, her first loan was of $125. She invested in her small business of making school lunches. Martina saved the income from the lunches and has decided to begin contruction of her first home. She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy construction mateiral. Martina is determined and hard-working. She continues to work in her school lunch business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina e casda e tem 2 filhos. O seu marido e mineiro e trabalha num Pais vizinho. Martina e que cuida dos filhos e da casa a maior parte do tempo. Ela entrou para o programa em 2006. tendo tomado pela primeira vez, $125 para investir no seu pequeno negoci na altura que era o do fornecimento de lanches numa cantina escolar. Porque o negocio lhe corria bem ela foi subindo gradualmente de valor. Com os lucros do fornecimento de lanches juntando com outras economias ela resolveu iniciar a construcao de sua residencia que era de material precario. Assim ela quer tomar os $500 para a compra do material de construcao para a sua residencia em construcao. Martina e uma mulher determinada e empreendedora. Ela continua fornecendo lanches na escola com a qual assinou um acordo.

loans.use: Martine needs this loan to build her home

loans.name: Rubicelia

texts.es:
“I am worried because the weather will be cold soon and I have a window without glass in one room. I’d like to replace the window and also plaster the walls so my family is more protected, as I have young children. I am requesting $400 to put the glass in the window and plaster the walls in one room.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Me preocupa que se acerca el tiempo de frío y tengo una ventana sin vidrio en un cuarto, me gustaría ponérselo y también enjarrar las paredes para que mi familia este más protegida ya que tengo hijos pequeños”. Solicito $ 400.00 dlls para poner el vidrio de una ventana y enjarrar las paredes de un cuarto.”

loans.use: Replace the glass in one window and plaster the walls in one room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the capital for her work

loans.name: Anna's Maisha Group

texts.en:
Anna, age 48, is married with 5 children (ages 31, 28, 26, 20, and 16). Her 70 year old mother also lives with her family.

Anna works daily from 7am to 3pm as a food vendor. She started this business just last year in 2007, and now makes a monthly profit of about $135 from this business. She hopes for a loan to increase her sales and will share this loan with Asha, who owns a small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Marilu

texts.en:
Marilu, a thirty-year-old mother of four school-going children, sells diced pork in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She has been running this business for four years.

Marilu explains that the business is gainful and the clientele is growing. Currently, she has a monthly profit of about USD 200.00. Marilu will use her loan to invest in the purchase of more meat to keep satisfy her clientele’s needs. She says that she will work for the sake of her family as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase pork to resell in her community

loans.name: Magirane Oliver's Group

texts.en: Oliver together with her group members are requesting a loan to run their various businesses. Oliver has a retail shop in Wabusanke that she has owned for 2 years. She has 6 children that she cares for single handedly after her husband left her for another woman. Her dream is to see all her children complete school and get good jobs in future since they are all still in school. She intends to buy a fridge for her shop so that she can sell cold drinks in addition to the other goods like sugar, salt, bread, and biscuits.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for her shop

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity is a young and unmarried woman with one child. She is nineteen years old and has been selling groceries like tin fish, biscuits, tin tomatoes, spices, cocoa powder, Milo, etc. for seven years. She depends on middlemen to buy these items from Accra.

Felicity wants to use her loan to buy products from Accra herself as middlemen price the goods higher which reduces her income.

She is a member of the group called Stewards. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of Milo, cocoa powder, skimmed milk powder, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria Lisette

texts.es:
Miss Flor de Maria is a member of Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women”) Community Bank, located at Jr. Salaverry 597, Calleri District, Ucayali Province. She is 21 years old, single, and with insufficient income to meet her living expenses.

With the first loan of approximately $110 from Manuela Ramos, Ana Maria opened a small grocery store. Her store has grown since, selling cold soft drinks as well. In the mornings, she leaves early to work at her job, in the afternoons she runs her grocery store, and in the evenings she studies. With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase soft drinks, candies, and other general items of grocery to sell in her store.

Ana Maria is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support they provide in the running of her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Flor de Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 597, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años, es soltera, el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, Ana María con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido, también vende bebidas heladas, en las mañanas sale temprano a trabajar, por las tardes atiende su negocio y en las noches va a estudiar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas, golosinas, y abarrotes en general. Ana María esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos, por todo el apoyo que le dan para implementar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Matías

texts.es:
Matías is a humble 21 year old from the district of Arapa. The limited economic resources of his parents barely allowed them to finish their elementary school studies. Since then he has worked in agriculture and cattle-raising. But Matías felt a strong desire to find better opportunities to succeed. That is how, with the little he had, he left his little town. Now he is located in the city of Juliaca and started his business of providing mobile phones to people in his city to make calls. In the beginning, they were not his phones, but he began making income and he began acquiring them. Taking advantage of a strategic location where he could provide his phone services, he decided to also sell a great variety of sweets. Now, this young entrepreneur is very popular and loved in his town and he would like to touch your generous hearts with the hope of receiving help, help that he will invest to improve his candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Matías es un humilde joven de 21 años de edad procedente del distrito de Arapa, los bajos recursos económicos de sus padres apenas le permitieron concluir sus estudios primarios, desde entonces se dedicó a la agricultura y a la ganadería, pero Matías sentía un gran deseo de buscar mejores oportunidades de superación, es así que con lo poco que tenia decidió salir de su pueblito.Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, e inició su labor brindando llamadas a través de artefactos móviles a la población, en un principio no eran suyos pero conforme fue obteniendo ingresos los fue adquiriendo, aprovechando el lugar estratégico en donde brinda sus servicios de llamadas decidió también vender una inmensa variedad de golosinas, actualmente este joven emprendedor es muy popular y querido en dicha localidad y desea tocar vuestros generosos corazones con la esperanza de recibir ayuda, ayuda que será invertida para ampliar su puestito de golosinas.

loans.use: Investment of capital to increase his grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married and has two children, one who is two years old and a baby of seven months. In order to help her children get ahead, she began her business since she didn't have a job, her husband did not earn a good wage, and she had to purchase medication for her mother who has cancer of the throat and lung and does not have health insurance.

Maria Luisa needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, so that she may purchase more merchandise for resale, as well as a structure that will allow her to establish herself well in markets and protect her from the sun. With your help, she may grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es casada y tiene 2 hijos uno de 2 años y una bebe de 7 meses. Inicio su negocio ya que no tenia trabajo y con su liquidación puso el negocio, para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que su esposo no tenia un buen sueldo además tenia que comprar medicamento para su mama ya que tiene cáncer de garganta y pulmón y no cuenta con seguro médico. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos y conocidos y poco a poco fue generando clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mas mercancía para la reventa y una estructura para poder instalar bien su puesto en los mercados y protegerse del sol. Con tu ayuda Luisa hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena Begum baji is the wife of Muhammad Ashraf, and she lives in the city of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession. She is a housewife, and she notes that she prefers to do work around the house. Moreover, she is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in an oil mill, while another son sells plastic shoppers. Notably, she successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan to buy more plastic shoppers to expand her son’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following entrepreneurs: (1) Aneela Shaheen baji seeks a loan in order to buy cloth and thread for her boutique; (2) Sakeena baji is in need of a loan for her furniture business; (3) Rahat Baji requests a loan to buy more clothes for her clothing business; and (4) Waheeda baji would like a loan to buy wood to make more furniture.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest the funds into her own business. The members mutually guarantee the other members' loans so that the other members are responsible if one member does not repay.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses

loans.name: Lucrecia Nury

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia tiene 55 años de edad,  habita en villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad de 30 y 33 años de edad. Doña Lucrecia se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en donde ofrece ropa y cosméticos. Este negocio lo ha venido desarrollando hace ya  mucho tiempo, inició solamente con ventas de cosméticos ya que el capital era propio y no contaba con mucho dinero. Con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y hoy en día tiene una pequeña tienda en donde atiende a sus clientes y vecinos. Anteriormente tenía un negocio de ventas de bloques, pero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de 4 vitrinas de vidrio, para poder organizar mejor sus productos y tener una mejor exhibición de ellos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia is 55 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliación, and is single with 2 grown children (ages 30 and 33). Ms. Lucrecia works in the commerce industry. She owns a small store that offers clothing and cosmetics. Her business has been around for a long time. She used her own funds to get her business started and initially only sold cosmetics, because she didn’t have a lot of money. As time passed, her business grew and nowadays her store is frequented by neighbors and clients. Beforehand she had a block business but in search of better living conditions, she decided to dedicate herself to the clothing and cosmetic business. The loan will be used to buy four glass showcases. The showcases will, in turn, allow for better organization and display of her products.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four glass showcases

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun N., 54, and her husband, Mr. Sitha Phan, 55, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives in the family home.

Mrs. Khoeun has been selling fish since 1983 and has been selling rice for five years. She buys rice from Por Sat province for resale. Mr. Sitha has been a fisherman for fifteen years.

Mrs. Khoeun is requesting a loan to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn U. is a villager in Kraing Sromor village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a seller in the local market. She is a 51-year-old widow and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other three children are enrolled the school. They still do not enough money to make ends meet. Thus, Mrs. Choeurn U. requests a loan to buy timber to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy timber to repair her house.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
S. Akouvi est née le 31 décembre 1975 à Zowoula dans la préfecture des Lacs. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Elle a pour activité la vente de pagne et de mèche dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de  la ville de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 pièces de pagne et des mèches afin de pouvoir bien vendre pendant les fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Ms. Akouvi S. was born on December 31, 1975 in Zowoula, in Lacs Prefecture. She is unmarried and has a child in her care. She works selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and hair extensions in the Agoè district north of the city of Lomé. She gets her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 5 lengths of pagnes and some hair extensions in order to do well in her sales during the year-end festivals.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and hair extensions

loans.name: Luisa Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Esmeralda tiene 46 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en  el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria por su propio esfuerzo, quedo huérfana y no la apoyaron para poder estudiar, entonces estudió en nocturna.
Se comprometió con su pareja a la edad de 28 años y tiene un hijo y una hija, los que aún son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la cría y venta de animales de corral, dicha actividad la realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró comida para aves.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, nuevamente invertirá en comida para aves de corral.
Luisa sueña con tener una tienda grande en su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa Esmeralda is 46 years old and belongs to the "Grupo Solidario Azucenas" of Villa Hermosa. She lives in the district of Huanchaco in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She went to elementary school on her own accord, but when she was orphaned, she no longer had the support she needed so she studied at night.

She committed to her partner when she was 28 and has a son and daughter who are currently in school.

Her business comprises the raising and selling of small farm animals; she works out of her house.

With the first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought chicken feed. With this loan of 300 Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in more chicken feed.

Luisa dreams of having a big store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in chicken feed

loans.name: Puissance Group

texts.en:
Mr. M. operates a business, moving from one village to another, exchanging (bartering) school furniture, candles, sausages, and lamp oil for sacks of corn, peanuts, or manioc. His beginning capital in 1991 was US$ 160. The business prospered until 1995 when a truck carrying his goods from the village to Kinshasa over-turned during the rain, destroying the whole truckload.

As he did not have any other financial resources, his options for the future narrowed. After two years (in 1997), he re-launched his business with $100 in capital. Gradually Mr. M. has been able to stabilize his business with the profit he earns. Currently his business capital is about US$ 600. Last August he decided to join one of Hope’s groups called “Puissance,” meaning “Power” in English, and through the loan, Mr. M.’s business has been strengthened.

With his next loan, Mr. M. plans to deliver fresh fish, soaps, sugar, cans, etc. He wants to start farming in order to produce farm products. Mr. M. is 44 years old and the father of four children, aged between 6 and 26. All of them go to school.

loans.use: To reinforce his working capital

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Antes de construir su casa, Celestina trabajaba en un mercado ubicado en el centro de la capital. Ella tenía un puesto ambulante donde vendió verduras durante dieciocho años.

Gracias al gobierno en aquel tiempo pudo construir  su casa y a la vez un espacio para abrir una tienda.  Es así que decide abandonar su negocio en el mercado y se muda a su casa no solo para emprende un nuevo negocio, la principal razón fue proveerle un futuro mejor a su hijo menor quien tenia los deseos de estudiar en ese entonces en la universidad.

Hoy, desde hace seis años, vende golosinas y bebidas embotelladas Ahora ella vive con su nieto de cinco años, de quien se encarga de mantener y criarlo.

Viajar a su ciudad natal y construir un hotel de turistas esta dentro de sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Before building her house, Celestina worked in a market located downtown in the capital city. She had a pushcart where she sold vegetables for eighteen years. Thanks to the government, she was able to build her house and at the same time a space to open a store. This is why she decided to leave her business at the market and move to her home, not only to start a new business, but mainly to offer a better future to her son who wanted to go to college back then. Now, for the past six years, she has sold candy and bottled beverages. She lives with her five-year-old grandchild, whom she tends to and is raising. Her future plans are to go back to her hometown and build a hotel for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying drinks, sodas, and water for her business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 51years old and has a business making and selling fried bananas in his village to earn a living. She is able to make around US$9 every day, while her husband earns US$10 a day working as a farmer. He grows and sells cashew nuts for market wholesalers. This couple has four children, one of whom is a hair dresser and three who are in school. Kong S. would like to take out a loan to purchase hair dressing materials for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus A. has sold groceries such as milk, Milo, canned products and rice at Bantama, in Elmina, since 2004.

Theophilus has received a junior high degree, is married and has three children. His wife has the occupation of a fishmonger. He is responsible for providing financial support, food, clothing and other basic needs for the family.

His loan will be used to buy additional stock to increase the sale of goods to meet the high demand from his customers. Theophilus hopes to use the new profits from his business to support the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: Buy additional stock to meet the high demand from customers.

loans.name: Enesi D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Enesi M. from Kyela. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 15. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Enesi has been running a red palm oil business since 2005. Her business is to purchase red palm seed, extract them the oil, and sell it to those who using it for cooking and for making soap. She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enesi currently earns about US $200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US $400 in order to purchase more red palm seeds in bulk for oil processing. In the future, she plans to open a new location. Enesi thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase red palm seeds in bulk for oil extraction

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila G. is a sari-sari store (general store) owner. She sells variety of goods like rice, salt, vinegar, milk and much more to earn a living for her family. Her husband, Helbert G., is a farmer. They work together for the needs of their two children.

Prescila is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. The loan will also be used to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them to start and establish their own livelihood. It provides loans, training and insurance coverage to help small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is married and has three children. She was educated through primary school. Cecilia sells vegetables, canned tomatoes, beans and other food supplies at Ola in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a messenger. Cecilia uses her income to provide for the children. She will use the loan to purchase more food supplies to sell. Cecilia will reinvest her new profits back into the business.

loans.use: To buy food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem T., 44, is a local crop farmer who lives in Svay Art Commune of Pursat Province. In addition to her crops, she raises pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She also buys rice in bulk from farmers and puts it into her stock supply for resale, to gain additional income. Her husband, Mr. Bu Veng, 48, earns a living driving a motorcycle taxi and works for the train station. This is her second loan with Kiva and Hem T. will be using this loan to build a store in front of her house where she begin selling groceries. With the remainder of the loan she will purchase additional piglets to raise. She now has six children; two are married and four are in school.

loans.use: To build a store and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Vahob

texts.ru: Вахоб Майсабиров  1957 года рождения , женат имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. 5 лет назад он вышел на пенсию , тогда его друг пригласил  помогать ему столовой.  Со временем  он отделился и решил печь пирожки на улице.  У него есть собственная  маленькая уличная столовая. Также он является лесничим. Помогают ему дочь и невестка. В обеденный перерыв  у него много посетителей, и он доволен своей работой и благодарит за это Аллаха и КИВА.
texts.en:
Vahob M. was born in 1957. He is married and has five children. He has secondary education. Five years ago, he went into retirement, then his friend asked him to help with a market stall. In time, he went off on his own and decided to bake pirozhkis along the street. He has his own small street stall. He also reports for work as a forestry officer. His daugher and daughter-in-law help him. During the lunch break, he has many visitors. He is pleased with his work and thanks Allaha and Kiva for this.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy flour and different ingredients

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is twenty-eight years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Andrena owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $45 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Andrena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Andrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Andrena is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is a 42-year-old mother to two children, a boy and a girl. She is happily married to Gregorio, a fisherman who is 41 years old. She believes that poverty is an opportunity to strive for a better living.
In 1996, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, with hope of having access to capital for her business. For almost three years, she has had a fishing business in partnership with her husband. The business brings good income and sound profit for her family needs.
Now on her eighth loan, she proposes an amount of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for materials needed to renovate her fishing boat like wood, paint, nails, and labor expenses. A portion of her loan will be used as additional capital for her secondary business, a general store.
She dreams of sending her children to school up to college and building a durable and spacious house.

loans.use: To renovate her fishing boat.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona netamente pesquera ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ellos manejan un pequeño restaurante en donde atienden a los pescadores de la zona, el negocio les sirvió para comprarse un terreno en el que ahora están construyendo su casa, ellos ya están viviendo allí, pero los ingresos que perciben por el negocio no les han bastado para terminarla, su hogar aún necesita de techo, de puertas y de enlucido, y su ubicación cercana al mar hace urgente el término de su construcción ya que por las noches el frio puede afectar la salud de sus dos pequeños hijos de 9 y 5 años, debido a que el techo sólo esta cubierto por calaminas y su puerta esta conformada por dos delgadas láminas de madera.

Por este motivo ellos están solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 3100 nuevos soles que les ayude a terminar su casa y seguir trabajando en su pequeño restaurante, ellos desean que sus hijos crezcan en una casa que les brinde realmente seguridad.

Ellos ya han trabajado con nosotros cinco veces y han cancelado puntualmente sus créditos por lo que son considerados como unos excelentes clientes.
texts.en:
Manuela, 38, lives with her husband and their two children in the Santa Rosa district. It is purely a fishing region, which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. They run a small restaurant where they wait on the fishermen in the region. The business allowed them to buy a piece of land where they are now building their house. They are now living there. But, there has not been enough income from the business to finish the house. The house still needs a roof, doors, and plaster. The close location to the sea makes finishing the construction urgent. The cold nights could affect the health of their two children, who are 9 and 5, because the roof is covered by metal pieces and the door is made of plywood. That is why they are asking the Institution for a loan of 3,100 PEN to help finish their house and keep working in their small restaurant. They want their children to grow up in a house that gives them real security. They have worked with the Institution five times, and they have paid back their loans punctually. Therefore, they are considered to be excellent clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on their house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 3 hijos y estudio secundaria completa, vive en el sector  Alpacuyo I. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ovinos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de un toro para mejorarlo y venderlo en la feria de Ilave.

Su deseo es aumentar su ganado y poder vender a los mayoristas

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de toro.

loans.name: Crimilde Geraldina

texts.pt:
Crimilde Geraldina M. nasceu em Magude (Maputo) tem 31 anos de idade é separada mãe de 2 filhos. A primeira de 11 anos e o segundo de 7 todos vão à escola, responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 500.00MT mensalmente.


 Crimilde após concluir a 7ª classe muda de residência da sua terra natal para a Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, esta fica grávida do seu primeiro filho logo junta se com o seu esposo uma vez que este não trabalha, crimilde teve que fazer o curso de professorado durante 3 anos (tempo regular) para conseguir sustentar seus filhos. Apos a conclusão é afecta no mesmo distrito como professora do primeiro ciclo, é funcionaria permanente a mais de sete anos trabalhando das 7h as 12:30h auferindo 3.200.00MT mensalmente e não consegue poupar nada devido ao elevado custo de vida. Anos depois separa se do seu esposo, consecutivamente é cedida uma parte de terra na zona de expansão pelo seu patronato e inicia a sua obra com os dois primeiros empréstimos que obteve na hluvuku de 6.000.00MT e de 4.000.00MT. Hoje vive em sua própria casa ainda em acabamento.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de crimilde na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para comprar material de construção, o segundo de 4.000.00MT também foi usado para compra de material e este terceiro de 8.000.00MT será usado para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro empréstimo para a construção de um murro de vedação na sua moradia.
texts.en:
Crimilde Geraldina M. was born in Magude (Maputo). She is 31, separated, and has 2 children. Her daughter is 11 yeas old and her son is 7. Both attend school. She also supports her mother, sending her 500.00MT monthly. After finishing 7th grade, Crimilde moved from her hometown to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Suaziland. She later became pregnant with her first child and got married. When he stopped working, Crimilde completed a degree in teaching going to school full time for 3 years in order to support her children. Once she finished she worked in the same state as an elementary school teacher. She has held a permanent teaching position for the past 7 years, working from 7am to 12:30pm, earning 3,200,00MT monthly. She is unable to save due to the high cost of living. Years later she separated from her husband. Around the same time she received a parcel of land from her employer in the suburbs and began building her home with the first two loans that she received from Hluvuku fo 6.000.00MT and 4.000.00MT. Today she lives in her own home which she is still finishing. This is Crimilde's third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first loan was for 6.000.00MT which she used to buy construction materials. The second loan for 4.000.00MT was also used to purchase materials and this third loan for 8.000.00MT will be used for the same thing. She is confident that she will pay off the loan before it is due and request another loan to build a wall around her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, is 59 years old.  She is married to Bernardo Sr. and they were blessed with five children: John, is now working in South Korea;Flora, Vilma, Gema and their youngest is Bernardo Jr.- 16 years old, a high school graduate.  Four of them are already married.  They are residing in Sillawit, Cauayan City, Isabela.  

She mananas a typical village store for almost two years and she can earn a gross income of PHP1,000.00 a week. She decided to borrow a loan amounting to PHP18,000.00 from the KIVA lenders.  She will use the loan to purchase grocery items and beverages to sell in her retail store. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan for her to gain a prosperous and productive way of living.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Djiman Honorine

texts.fr: D. Djiman Honorine est née en 1973 à Abidjan en Côte d'Ivoire. Djiman Honorine vit depuis son enfance à Porto-Novo, Capitale administrative du Bénin. Djiman Honorine est mariée à AGONMA Joachin, un menuisier. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Djiman Honorine a arrêté les classes depuis le cours primaire et s'est mise à vendre des chaussures, des tissus et des glacières il y a de cela dix ans. Djiman Honorine s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et vient vendre ses produits en face de l'Eglise Sainte Anne d'Agbokou à Porto-Novo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Djiman Honorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Djiman Honorine is born in 1973 in Abidjan in Cote d'Ivoire.Djiman Honorine has been living since childhood in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to AGONMA Joachin, a carpenter. The couple has no children yet. The couple support each other with family expenses.Djiman stopped attending classes since primary school and began to sell shoes, fabrics and ice chests for ten years now.Djiman Honorine gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin and comes to sell her goods in front of St. Anne church of Agbokou in Porto-Novo. She is an old customer of ALIDe who has already benefitted from two loans which have been repaid correctly. In order to expand her working capital and better satisfy her clientele, Djiman Honorine is requesting a third loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pieces of fabric and pairs of shoes

loans.name: Homid

texts.en:
Homid is a hardworking entrepreneur from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He has operated his own car repair business for the past 10 years. Homid has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Tajikistan which means more business for repair technicians like Homid. Homid works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife have three children. Homid has requested a loan of $1500 US to expand his workshop. He is very thankful to everyone who has decided to support him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To expanding his workshop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Central, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde los mismo que los venderá en las feria de la zona, actividad que realiza una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es hacer estudiar a sus hijos y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. Juana lives in the community of Central Ancara and completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1½ years. Her first loan of 500 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep.

Juana is requesting a new loan of 500 soles so that she can buy additional sheep for fattening, similar to the ones she sold at the regional fair. She goes to market once a week. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with an education and continue working. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace ocho años tiene instalado en su casa un negocio de venta de productos de belleza y losería. Ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio surgió debido a que los ingresos que percibe su esposo trabajando como obrero agrícola no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio ha ido creciendo gracias al buen trato con el que Lily atiende a sus clientes. Ella está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza debido a la campaña navideña pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus dos hijos una educación de calidad con la cual se aseguren un buen futuro. Ella es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Lily is a 41 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children (ages 14 and 13) in the house of her parents, which is located in the district of Cayaltí and an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Eight years ago, Lily established a business in her home selling beauty products and earthenware. She says that the idea for this business came about because her husband’s earnings from his job as a farm worker are not enough to cover their family’s expenses.

Her business has grown thanks to the good service Lily provides to her customers. She is thinking about expanding her business by purchasing more beauty products for the Christmas season. However, she does not have sufficient capital in order to take action. Therefore she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Her greatest desire is to provide her two children with a quality education that will assure them of a good future. Lily is a cheerful and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est composé de quatre femmes (une veuve et 3 mariées) ayant en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles monogames dans  le quartier Pelengana Extension de la ville de Ségou 4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales et d’appartenance à une même Association traditionnelle des femmes du dit quartier.
Dans le souci de pérenniser leurs activités commerciales, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le   programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt de groupe. Tous les six prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 6 sacs de mil, 150 kg de haricot, 50 kg de riz, 20 pièces de pagnes fancy, 2 pièces de 30 mètres de bazin blanc, 15 morceaux de soude caustique, une dizaine de sachet de couleurs pour la teinture.  
Elles s’approvisionnent  en grain (mil, haricot, riz)  au marché château de Ségou et à Banankoro,  en pagnes fancy et  bazin au grand marché de Ségou. Quant aux autres articles ils sont achetés auprès de grossistes de la place. Le bazin est teint avant de le mettre sur le marché. 
La vente des articles de groupe se fait, la plupart du temps au marché château et à domicile  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.750FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso,  à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales, à la participation aux évènements sociaux (baptêmes, mariages, circoncisions et funérailles) et à  la constitution d’épargne.  
Leurs ambitions sont avoir, une concession à usage d’habitation, du matériel de travail de menuiserie pour leurs enfants et pour d’autres avoir du matériel agricole.
texts.en:
The group Tièssiri is composed of four women (one widowed and three married) who average 47 years of age and five children each living in monogamous families in the Pelengana Extension district of Ségou City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through ties of community, commercial work, and membership in the same traditional women's association of the aforementioned district.  Concerned about ensuring that their businesses will continue, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their seventh group loan.  The preceding six loans have all been properly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy six sacks of millet, 150 kg of beans, 50 kg of rice, twenty bolts of Fancy pagnes (colorful West African cloth), two 30-meter bolts of white damask, fifteen pieces of caustic soda, and about ten pouches of dyes.  Supplies of grains (millet, beans, rice) are gotten at the Château market of Ségou and in Banankoro; and supplies of Fancy pagnes and of damask are gotten from the big market of Ségou.  As for the other items, these are purchased from wholesale merchants locally.  The damask is dyed before being put on the market.  Sales of group items are made most of the time at the Château market and at home.  Cash or credit is accepted from customers composed of men and women.  The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 30,750 francs CFA that will be used to repay the Soro Yiriwaso loan, to cover family expenses, to assist with societal events (baptisms, marriages, circumcisions, and funerals), and to accumulate savings. Their ambition is to obtain a concession as a place to live, woodworking supplies and equipment for the children, and farming supplies for some others.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John owns and operates a general store with his wife Martha out of an all-purpose structure immediately adjacent to his house.  This is John's first loan from Kiva field partner LEAP.  John plans to use the 67,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy inventory for his general store.  He says some of his best-selling items are candles and batteries -- there is no electric utility that serves his neighborhood -- and foodstuffs such as rice and cooking oil.

John and Martha live in a suburb of Liberia's capital, Monrovia, and have six sons.  During the Liberian civil war, John had to flee to neighboring Côte d'Ivoire and was separated from his family for several years.  John and Martha's oldest son is now 25, and the youngest is eight. The older boys have completed high school, and John expects that the younger ones will too.  If he is able to afford it, John would like to be able to send some of his boys to university one day.

John's store started small, as a stall out in front of his house on land he owns.  As his store was the only one of its kind in his neighborhood, his business prospered.  He decided to build a freestanding storefront a few years ago and now hopes to expand further by building a separate rice store, and a cement shop.

loans.use: To buy items for resale at his general store.

loans.name: Tweweyo Group, Lugazi

texts.en: N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is married, with six children aged 12 - 17, and she takes care of some orphans. For the past 7 years, Sarah has had a retail shop in Nkata Island from which she is able to make a weekly profit of  50,000 UGX. She is grateful to her loans which enable her to have a variety of goods in her shop and, in the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler, which will enable her and her husband to better educate her children. Sarah needs to stock her shop with more goods such as books, geometry sets, pens, pencils and so on since this is the high season for such goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né le 09 Août 1978 à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa Berthé  est marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une  grande famille traditionnelle élargie  dans son village natal, relevant de la préfecture de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Berthé est un mécanicien de profession depuis plus de huit ans. 
Pour rendre service à ses nombreux clients d’acquérir des pièces auto sur place sans déplacement, il mène en plus de la mécanique cette activité d’achat-vente des pièces détachées d'occasion. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt individuel.Tous les prêts précédent ont été remboursé.
 Il compte acheter, des bielles, arbre à came, pistons, jantes, etc. Les marchandises (pièces) sont achetées sur places issues des démontages des véhicules pour être vendues  dans son magasin  sis au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Berthé was born on August 9, 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa, located approximately 6 km from the city of Sikasso. He's married and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and their children in a large extended traditional family in his birth village, part of the Sikasso prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. Bethé has been a trained mechanic for eight years. As a service to his numerous customers who wants to buy spare parts locally to avoid traveling, he also runs a business buying and selling used spare parts. He's very much in demand due to the quality of his products. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, he decided two years ago to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. He's seeking his third individual loan, and all previous loans were repaid without problems. He intends to buy connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, etc. The parts are bought locally and comes from dismantled vehicles, and are sold in his shop inside his garage. With this loan, he foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used mostly to bolster his working capital, help with the family expenses, and repay the loan. The remainder will be invested in his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used spare parts (connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, etc)
